text: Still the spot for late night sushi!  The ambiance is nice and its rarely crowded. The servers are attentive and the food is good. Their specialty rolls are better than their standard rolls. Once again I don't go their for the fresh rolls, not many great options in that category. However its still the 1st place we head after 11pm when the craving hits.

This place is great for a late night sushi craving since they stay open until 2am. Its got traditional Japanese seating,  restaurant, sushi bar or Teppanyaki. You have lots of choices on how to dine. The sushi is good but the choices could be better. I prefer fresh sushi rolls and I think their fresh rolls lack creativity. They have a good selection of tempura and deep fried rolls. The prices are a little much for what they offer and the 1/2 rolls menu is not much of a deal in my opinion. Its a cool place but not my favorite.
The best Japanese in Las Vegas!!!  I have been to a lot of Japanese places in LA and Vegas and food, drinks, decor, service as well as unique sushi is awesome!!
I recommend this to anyone visiting or living in Vegas.  The dishes are great and happy hour keeps you coming back for more and if you are lucky, you might get to hear some Jazz!

This was my favorite restaurant in 1999. The Japanese Sushi chefs were engaging, talented and very hospitable. In a dearth of culture and social connection, these guys made me feel like a king. Twelve years later? It was comforting to see the same art and decor. But when I entered and was ignored and left without a sign telling me to wait or move forward to one of the other rooms, it was uncomfortable. Three chefs ignored me, the waitress walked by and looked at me, no acknowledgement, and continued serving others. What happened to this place? You have a Las Vegas icon, once upon a time it was Caesars or Osaka, now everyone loves Sushi (thank you everyone, I can get plenty of good sushi everywhere, thanks to you) and Osaka is not worth passing the next Sushi place to get to. It's expense account expensive with average service and average food. The ankimo was fishy, the chu-toro was stringy and no better than the hamachi (wouldn't it be better to say you were out rather than dress up a fatty hamachi or blue-fin?). One saving grace, in a world of competitive all you can eaters downing monster portions of nigiri and sashimi, the portions of nigiri were small and mouth sized, beautiful. Sushi is a delicate food served with style and grace, thank you for the small portions. But then the cut roll menu looks like Denny's with the "me-too" monster portions and americanized flavor. Help!

Dang it. I really wanted to love this place.  But the truth is, the atmosphere was reeeally dark. Not in a cozy, intimate way, but dark and depressing.  Our food was just so-so.  We ordered soup, salad, two types of sushi, edamame, white rice, and okonomiyaki.  Unfortunately, the food lacked fresh ingredients and was mostly very bland.  Our server, Haru-tan (?), an ex-pat from Japan was WONDERFUL and friendly.  But sadly, we would not return to this place.  Phooey.

good rolls, and cool sushi chefs.  With the chilled jazz ambience, its easy to have a nice late night dinner.    However, the veggie-only(non-fish based) rolls are more expensive than the fish-based rolls, kind of counter-intuitive IMO.  Other than that, some nice age dashi tofu, and a salad with a rolls makes for an easy & tasty meal.

We went here because it was a Diners Drive-ins and Dives recommendation!  We were happy to say that Guy was right on!  I'm not a fan of seafood but this place did not smell of seafood and we sat in the same room as the sushi bar!  My husband and daughter had sushi and soup and I had chicken and all three dishes were delicious.  The servers were very attentive and the experience was a good one.  Will visit again the next time we go to Vegas!

After researching for about an hour my husband finds Osaka. After going over the menu we read some reviews, and found that some people didn't really like it and others absolutely loved. Well so did we! Yes the outward appearance of this hidden gem may ward off some but that's what I love about it extremely low pro. inside you find a small but well appointed and well decorated place. The food was great we ordered the Osaka rice kamikaze roll octopus fritters sashimi BBQ short ribs spicy edamame king crab tempura Salmon Kama. Our waiter Alex was a huge help with ordering since you see we ordered a lot for the two of us. As well as killed  the Sake sampler with the apple raspberry and lychee flavors and a whole bottle of the Lychee Sake (as you can see that one was our favorite. Late night menu ROCKS! Wish I could have ate more! Definitely going to become one these newcomers favorite hang out.

The sushi is fine but I can't even go out to eat without some liberal at the next table hooking me into her brand of politics. Now. I don't mind idle friendly chit chat with fellow diners but I keep it on the weather. She seemed intent on verbally haranguing and Harassing me. For 20 minutes she relentlessly yammered on and on about liberal politics and female white privilege. This woman was belligerent and looking for an argumentI couldn't even look at the menu as her voice was too loud to concentrate over. She's not the type that will allow you to ignore her. So much for being nice and it's my bad for even making eye contact with a lone diner. I feel like an idiot even giving people the time of day.

Walked into this restaurant the other night and, oh boy, they do they bring traditional seating back into style. Their luxurioius seating in the back that will make you take your shoes off to seat at a traditional japanese style seating tables brings you a bit of japanese tradition into your experience there. They have some of the best sushi rolls ive eaten so far in vegas. Will visit again soon. Great customer service.

Don't buy the groupon to enjoy at this restaurant! I reservation with mention using the coupon at 8:00 pm. When i get in at 8 pm, the lady which I believe is the owner of this restaurant said I have to wait 40 more minutes to seat at the cooked table or just choose a regular to seat. After 10 minutes waiting, the new walking group came, that lady told me again may be over 1 more hours and yell on my face that she didn't trick me. Too disappointing, i went out. I will never come back to this restaurant again ^.^

Visited this place last month with my parents and a couple of friends and had the worst service ever!  The gal who waited on us was young, in her 20's and doesn't have any common sense.  I asked her three times to give me the bill and also asked the other male waiter twice as well.  What does she do?  Let my friend pay for it.  And I know that I had asked her first.  I realize that she may have been put in an awkward situation when my friend gave her her credit card but she could have politely said that someone had already asked for the bill and not taken her card.  That would have been the common sense or right thing to do.  Needless to say, I was upset with how she handled the situation.  The food is okay, I've had better, but for me the whole incident with the bill leaves a sour taste.  I will not go back again!

Two words, "Great Service!!" I'm someone who likes to try new things whenever I have the chance. Although sushi isn't necessarily new for me, the experience I had at Osaka Japanese Bistro on Eastern ave. was definitely a refreshing experience! Before dining in at Osaka, I already had a favorite sushi spot that I would take friends and acquaintances but my first visit here changed that. I walked in to a very warm greeting and very promptly asked by Lina where I would like to sit, I decided the sushi bar. I didnt know what to order so she made a couple of suggestions and served our beverages in a timely matter. I told her that I'm a sweet roll/salmon and sake lover so she suggested the "Oh Kamisama paired with a cold blueberry sake" AMAZINGLY GOOD!! We all agreed this to be one of the best experiences at a sushi bar. To put it simply...Comfortable environment, delicious sushi, amazing sushi chef (ARMANDO), and service was 5 star at its finest.(LINA) THANKS GUYS!!!
The best sushi I have had in a while. From the service to the food was a great experience!

Welllll, I have tell you-10 years ago loved coming here. I just find it generic. The menu is out of control. Do not bring non foodies with- they will loose their mind...as I did with the boring sashimi.  Everyone else had sukiyaki and complained about how amazing tempura is/was...yeah, this place is bunk. Best o luck...going to momo!!! Hhhhhhhhway!

Amazing food I've been going here for the last 4 years and still they just get better and better. The sushi is amazing and always fresh and the sushi chefs are amazing friendly and always energetic( if u do go to the sushi bar ask for john and don't be shy he's one of the bests.

This is our go to place for sushi.  Off strip, reasonable prices, good selection of sake.  They do a lot of other japanese food options that are good also.  Just make sure to go to Sahara.  The location on Eastern was not nearly as good.

I absolutely love this place. I have been going there for years and never had a bad experience. The staff is always very welcoming and friendly, and the food is never a disappointment. I would recommend this place for sure!

Sorry guys, I would never come back again!!! The price isn't worth the quality of food. Service gets worse than before I came here.N needlessly the food is beyond the average price among Japanese sushi restaurants'. I don't really like to give a bad review, but as a regular customer at  "Osaka ", I've already lost any confidence with it. Sorry, I am disappointed that you guys cannot make sure the food we eat is always good n definitely deserve the price of food that I pay for.

Stopped in for teppan after a 6 year hiatus. Someone mentioned renovations in their review...what renovations?  Arrived at 5:30pm. The place was empty. Staff were all friendly & attentive. Our chef was okay, which in turn left our meal "okay."  Nothing seemed to be seasoned properly. I have had better teppan experiences & food here. I will be back tho. The service is excellent. The food usually is as well. When we left at 7pm the sushi bar was packed.   A few things about guest safety...  Carpet edges rolled back, mats by teppan room & sushi bar haphazardly thrown about. As someone who just had foot surgery I easily could have tripped & fallen, reinjuring my foot or sustaining a new one.   The teppan tables are built with bricks offset & randomly sticking out on the base. I struck my knee twice on this & woke up this morning with two nasty bruises on my knee. Not happy.   Watch your step & watch your knees is my advice.

One of my favorite restaurants! The service is great and I love the atmosphere, there's art hanging on the walls and jazz playing in the background. Last time I went there, I ordered the Titanic, which is a variety of sashimi and rolls. The fish was amazingly fresh and all of the rolls were handcrafted! It was something that I definitely recommend, if you are in a large group.

I visit this place often & I must say last night I was extremely disappointed & embarrassed! I had family in town who wanted an awesome sushi place to try in Vegas! Sushi Samba would have been a go but the time didn't agree lol. So we went to Osaka... When we entered an requested a tapa table we were told the section was now closed... Ok understandable no problem...literally less than 5 minutes, seriously not even 5 mins. 5 other people walk in a request a tapa and was seated with slight hesitation... When I brought it to the servers attention he didn't have an answer... I must say I was completely most utterly disgusted. I will never patronize this business again! This was the most extreme but the service is truly on & off... I've had one guy a few time that was quite pleasant! But this... Sorry excuse for service...

By far the best Japanese restaurant in town! All of the food is top notch and delicious.   We have been coming here for over 12 years and I have to say the service is great! We are always greeted at the door and always feel welcome when we go here. Staff is very polite and are always there to help and the wait time is fast but not too fast.  They have the best meso soup in town, I have try the other japanese food places, and I have to say this is the best!  I would recommend the firecracker shrimp which is so good! The chicken and beef teriyaki is always great with generous proportions.  The sushumi is superb! Tastes so good everytime I go here.  For dessert I recommend the deep fried ice cream! Will always continue to go here as long as I live here in Vegas.

Nice Hibachi style and sushi restaurant. Food tasted great and the table chef was very entertaining. Price was OK and the place was full on a weekday. Lots of birthdays that evening. Atmosphere not that great and the neighborhood is changing.
Love this place! Friendly staff and great food. I've never had a bad meal here. The Virgin Roll is my absolute favorite! We also love the live music!
Service was friendly, setting was unique, and the food was good. My husband and I got the Titanic boat to share and try a variety of things. The sushi was good but not the best we have had.

My Husband is a chef, he has given me many pearls of wisdom when it comes to choosing a restaurant; for example is the parking lot full? Osaka's is always overflowing!! Do the locals dine there? Locals have been dining here since the 60's. Las Vegas is a young city, so right away that is telling. This restaurant is a Mecca for the cognoscenti (peeps in the know) which includes lifelong residents and the born and raised Las Vegans. They know where the good eats are in this city and Osaka has the goods!! One thing I love is the privacy of the seating which only accentuates the incredible dishes. The service is wonderful! Exceptional wait staff and bus people, not only do they take care of your every need but they are all beautiful to boot!! (Not that that is a prerequisite) but it doesn't hurt. I would encourage everyone, whether you live here or just visiting our unique city, to visit Osaka's Japanese Bistro for a gastronomical delight! Enjoy!!!

I come to osaka often now, lately at least once a month, so I feel I need to upgrade them to a 4.5-5. Their service and food is pretty consistent, but the reason I'm upgrading their score is because of the servers. They are always very courteous and come by to refill drinks at least twice each time i visit. They even have tolerance for the lurkers... you know, those people who stay at the restaurant way past the time necessary after eating there. (I, unfortunately, know this from personal experience... thank you for not kicking us out!). So a shout out to the workers at osaka!

If you're looking for great quality sushi, Osaka is the place to go. I have been coming to this specific location for 7 years now and this place will always be my favorite for the best quality sushi. I recommend trying this place out whether you enjoy raw fish or not...The service is wonderful and the staff is always friendly. Osaka has never let me down. The only problem i see personally is that it is not that spacious and the sushi bar is a bit crowded. Other than needing to expand their restaurant, everything is pretty amazing. Sushi love!!

I love the feel of this place. Yeah, it's older but it's a familiar Las Vegas older I grew up with in the 90s. It's got a local Las Vegas feel mixed with Japanese atmosphere. I like that it's not brand new or remodeled away it's soul.  The food is made with love. You can really feel the coolness when you eat the food. And the people who run the place are so nice.

A FAVORITE of my wife and I! Delicious menu with the best sushi I have sampled in a while. This joint is very authentic in looks and has a nice menu to select from. Osaka comes with Teppan grill and great Tatami rooms in which you enter and the ambiance takes over from there. Servers and staff are genuine and very attentive and price range is very fair. Can't wait to go back!

The only thing that saves this place was their food.  Honestly CUSTOMER Service was horrible.Just went in to around 10pm and seemed steady. I sat down and ordered chicken katsu  and fried rice. After 30 min of waiting I asked where my food was and they said it was coming. Some people sat next to me and ordered their food, and 10 min later some fried rice came, but not for me. It was for the other table. Then another fried rice came for another table. I finally get my food 50 min later, no fried rice only katsu. I asked for my fried rice and she said it was coming. The table of 3, who just sat down next to me gets their 6 orders of fried rice. It's like they said no fried rice for that guy. He doesn't deserve it. To top it all off I had iced tea. I told the first server who tried to pour water in my drink that, and saved my drink. Next server comes and doesn't hesitate, he just pours water in my cup.. I mean come on I had tea on the bottom.

I have had consistently great service every time I come here. I haven't had anything I didn't like, and the sake selection is pretty impressive. The first time I went here, I was reassured to see a large table full of Japanese people, speaking Japanese. Does it get more reassuring than that?
After a few failed attempts at other sushi restaurants ended up here as a last resort... I'm glad we came here food is amazing, fresh and delicious. Great customer service!
Staff seemed bored and rude....tasteless sushi...dirty.....worthless

Went here the other day for lunch, and it was amazing !  My mother and I are Japanese, and have been looking everywhere for a GOOD real Japanese place to eat and we finally found it at Osaka.  The staff is very friendly and they also spoke Japanese as well which was a plus, we were able to order food speaking our native tongue.   We ordered some sushi and the fish tasted nice and fresh. They also make a delicious cucumber salad.  They have a good selection of desserts as well, I was surprised to see red bean ice cream on the list it is one of my faves!  The mother ordered green tea tiramisu which was also very delicious!   Gotta say I am picky when it comes to eating " Japanese" food in America but Osaka was great, with good prices as well ! I would recommend it to everyone!   Cant wait to go back and try eating at the Teppan syle.

I have to admit that I really like Japanese food, and there is quite a few excellent restaurants in Las Vegas. This is the one I go to if I want Teppanyaki. They grill the food in front of you and you can choose what you want to eat. As starter you can of course get a miso soup that is very good. I would recommend the mixed teppanyaki. The sushi here is also good, but nothing super special in my opinion.  I will come back here for sure. The service is very good.   My other two Japanese favorites in town is Yonaka Modern Japanese and Raku

The sushi is always delicious. I sit at the bar have had conversations with the chefs right in front of me who are rolling and they are always very friendly. I love the option they have of black rice with your roll! The only reason I'm not giving it 5 is because they are on the more expensive side and I can find rolls like that at other locations for cheaper.
My favorite sushi place! Tried some different good ones but none can compare to Osaka! Rudy is amazing & friendly & so are the rest of the servers! Love it!

When I ordered a vegetarian dish from this menu, I was very disappointed receive beef stock soup and beef products also delivered with the dish. What a waste! Also, some weird potato salad was smothering the tempura I ordered, so it was soggy by the time it was delivered.

Came here on a busy Friday night.  The place was packed.  We had an assortment of sushi, and the teppanyaki.  I can't say enough about the excellent service and attention to detail.  All the sushi was delicious, try the sushi lasagna (omg, to die for!).  The teppan grill was great.  We had steak and salmon but first they served us soup and rice.  The soup was really yummy and I loved the little noodles, very yummy.  The fried rice was great (and cute pacman while they make it for the kids), and the meat and veges were so fresh.  The entire meal was just a pleasure.  The staff was so attentive.  They have a cool ordering system - they don't even have to go to the kitchen to place the order.  They just put it into their little handheld and the kitchen starts making your food.  The sushi came out so fast, we were hungry!  Can't wait to go back!  We were so full we only had room for a scoop of green tea ice cream.  The dessert menu looks amazing and I love all the pictures.

I went there tonight to celebrate my birthday. I had a group of 13, we sat for dinner and 2 minutes later the grease trap fell from the top Of the tepan table and drenched me,  My sister in law and my MK clutch with grease!!! It took the servers several minutes to realize what happened and there was no sense of urgency to fix the situation. They ended up moving us to another section and 15 minutes later they apologized for the incident. I had taken several bottles of champagne to celebrate my birthday and the servers did not know how to open the bottles!! My husband and friends ended up having to open the champagne bottles and serve it themselves!!!! The service was awful. The only thing that made this night better was zac, our tepan cook. He was great. Our entrees were also great, however the soup and salad was not very good. Overall it was a poor experience and I will not be back.

Quick Review: Great value in the late night menu, good, but expensive food at other times of the day.  Long-Winded Review: When I grew up in Vegas in the 80's, there were only 1-2 Japanese restaurants in town, but they were very authentic ones that served food you could find in Tokyo.  Fast forward 20 years and we have a Sushi restaurant on every corner.  Teriyaki Chicken is served at Jack in the Box.  You can get California Rolls at 7-11.  There are hundreds of "Japanese" restaurants out now, but they're as close to Japanese as Olive Garden is Italian.  Osaka's menu remains largely grounded in its Japanese roots, but it also features a good selection of "custom" sushi rolls that you'll find in other sushi restaurants.  The menu is extensive, and some parts may be difficult to navigate since it is in Japanese (or the English equivalent, Romaji).  Item descriptions are all too brief and unless you've been there before, you may be intimidated by ordering something new.  It's probably best to ask your server or sushi chef questions before ordering.  What troubles me about Osaka is that I feel it's trying to be all things to all people.  It serves authentic Japanese fare, but it's also trying to be edgy, trendy, and hip by offering experimental fusion dishes and desserts.  However, the fact that I still go there regularly suggests that Osaka's experimentation doesn't bother me all that much.  As with older Japanese restaurants, prices are a tad higher than other places in town ($15 for chicken teriyaki dinner vs. $9.95 at other places), but the quality is much better.  You're not going to get as much food, but if you're looking for quantity, I can suggest some good all-you-can-eat sushi places that will feed you for under $30.  The real value of Osaka is its late night menu (10 pm - 2 am).  It features a wide variety of food for under $10.  You can get rolls and appetizers for $5 or less, and entrees are available for under $10.  The Japanese Style Beef Bowl is a steal at $5.80 (it's like a Yoshinoya Beef Bowl, but tastier).  It's a great place to go with friends after/before clubbing since you can do a family-style meal.  Desserts are hit or miss.  The Tempura Ice Cream is a great value at $5.50 and it easily serves 2-4 people.  Some of the other items are good, but definitely not worth the high price.

This was my second time to Osaka and I (we) really enjoyed it both times. Teppan was good the first time and great the second. We had sushi as an appetizer both times (albacore sashimi and the pocket aces) and was not disappointed. Riochi was our cook this time and we was awesome!   I would say for the amount of food you get the prices are very fair. My wife and I shared this time and still had leftovers.

This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant in Nevada.  The fish is always the freshest.  The food is just top of the line.  The service is always very good as well.  I remember reading that Osaka in Henderson was on a list of the 50 best sushi restaurants in the world...and the other 49 were in Japan, so that kind of says something right there.  I highly recommend this location.  I was not as crazy about the other locations as they didn't have the same awesome quality of fish and pleasant atmosphere.

It is in a strip mall and it is not ritzy, but the food..is so killer. The price is reasonable. Take people like your family to this place. Nothing fancy. Drink some tea, get a ramen or teishoku and eat some good food. Go to this place if you want good Japanese food. The owner and cooks are Japanese so it is authentic. Go to Japan if you want better Japanese comfort food. I cannot believe a place like this exists in Las Vegas!! Everytime I go to Vegas, I go to this place. I ordered the Tempura and katsu, last time I went.  It was crispy and full of flavor.

Not the best but not bad for late night after hours. This is one of those places you go to when nothing else is open other than fast food or cafes in hotels. Tasty sushi, hit or miss on maguro sashimi.  The edamame portion has recently been shaved to a small handful of pods, at $2.95, now that's a rip off.  I had to work on Valentines, which by the way is a WAY overrated day, non the less the BF and I had a late night meal. He had the tonkatsu which he said was fabulous. I had sashimi and one roll. Like I said, not bad for late night dining, 1 in the morning. BTW, they close at 2

We have been going to the Osaka on Sahara for years.  If you can get past the crazy entrance and the basic first dining room, you will be impressed with the other rooms, the prices, and the tasty food.  We love the choices offered, and it is always fresh and prepared to our specifications.,  We had friends fly in for business, and told them to go there to eat.  they really questioned my recommendations as they entered, but at the end of the meal, they raved and raved.

Amazing service!  We had Joe as our Teppan-yaki chef and he was entertaining. The waitress staff was there at every moment. We have visited several Teppan restaurants and the service is by far the best!

I had never had sushi before.  I have always been afraid to try it.  So, I went here with some friends.  My friend ordered all kinds of sushi for me to try.  My other friend eats Vegan so she ordered some vegan rolls.  All I can say is that I could not stop eating the rolls we had.  Obviously I know nothing about sushi but I can't stop thinking about this place and I can't wait to go back.  We were there a little late and it's got a great little vibe.  Amazing customer service.
has the best food here love the theme and the cooking show it is really cool

My new favorite sushi spot, very very very good fish. I used to go to the AYCE spots but once I started eating the sashimi at Osaka I can't stop. The Blue fin tuna is amazing, If you are looking for a really good sushi place in vegas this is it.

As we walked in, we thought the seating area was small but were seated immediately.  But, we found out later, they have two hibachi-style tables and many tatami mat tables as you go further into the restaurant.  Food was okay, nothing special.  Service was unimpressive.  Waiter did not engage, no expression or enthusiasm or suggestions  as we asked about the menu items.  As diners, we did not feel that welcomed. As we paid and as we left, there was nothing said by any of the workers.  I guess they don't really appreciate patronage.  Wouldn't bother coming back.
I wanted to love this place because it is so close to home, but nothing special. Everything...chicken bowl, 777, Kai special roll, miso soup was just okay.

I eat here at least once EVERY TIME I visit Vegas.  It's not your 100% authentic Japanese sushi place but hey I'm not a sushi snob.  I would have to say that they have the largest selection of Americanized Sushi Rolls anywhere.  The 777 roll is my favorite.  The "hot" foods are not bad but pale in comparison to their rolls.  Order a few of the special rolls and you're good to go.  California Rockin Sushi has NOTHING on this place.  In fact ever since I started going to Osaka I refuse to ever eat at CRS.

I don't know if i would come back here. So here is the review.   My boyfriend and I went to Osaka to try out their late night menu.   $11 for 6 piece sashimi, $7 for some of their half rolls, $22 for fresh scallop (not part of late night menu). Wanted to get the fresh Uni, but they sold out. Got the wings, Gyu Maki and shrimp shumai as appetizers.  Everything just seemed off. First of all the quality of the fish was not great. Really thin pieces, and almost dry. Got a white tiger roll, it was okay, like the Bonzai sauce, but everything else was just really plain. Fried wings were bland and just looked sad accompanied with raw broccoli and dry carrots.  No music was playing so it got really awkward cuz the sushi chefs were just busy making orders and they didn't even make eye contact with us. If it wasn't for the TV behind the bar we don't know if we would be able sit through our meal.  In the end, we just ate really quick and left. Like I said before, don't know if I would revisit again, maybe if they spruce up the atmosphere a little bit and get better quality of food.

I have visited Osaka's on Eastern on/off for the past few years. The last time was the other Saturday. All I can truly say is Awesome! We had all varieties of food: from sushi and appetizers to several maim dishes like the teriyaki and kutzu. The food tasted great, the service was very quick and attentive. My Favorite roll is actually the Ponytail. Its a cooked chicken rolls, but very Delish!!

Another great experience at Osaka's!!! We decided to have our NYE dinner at the Sahara location. The food rocked, flavors were well balanced and there was plenty of  left overs to bring home. I have never had a bad experience at this location or the Henderson location. The food always looks and taste fresh and amazing. The prices are always reasonable and you get the quality of high end food... I will make Osaka's a 2013 restaurant  for sure...   FYI, GET THE TEMPURA ICE CREAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Well, the gal and I rolled in at about 1:30 AM.  The place was pretty empty.  The atmosphere:  a little dreary, diveish, and old but overall fairly clean.  The service was decent.  Nothing to gripe or write home about.    The food:  forgettable.  The Korean style chicken was utter crap.  Stir-fried and all you could taste was spice.  Hello?  Korean chicken is supposed to be deep-fried.    I also ordered the udon off the late-night menu.  The broth had completely no taste whatsover.  They could have used minimal effort to load it with salt and MSG and that would have been a huge improvement, though not very imaginitive.    The gyoza was ok but obviously store-bought.    Would I go again?  No, I would rather go to Albertsons' and buy a microwave dinner.

Ate at the teppan grill with my family! The chef kept us all entertained, and the overall experience was pleasant. We ordered scallops, ribeye, chicken, and filet mignon. They use a crap ton of butter on everything they cook, but we enjoyed the food nonetheless. (I think excessive butter might be the reason why I devoured the food but shhhh.)

Highly recommend tatami room. We brought our 11-year-old son and he really enjoyed the experience. The sushi was awesome and fresh. Only disappointment was they did not offer specials. We previously visited Eastern location and appreciated the newness of the building, but certainly enjoyed the original location on Sahara. The service was superb, especially because after my son's second Shirley Temple the waiter offered to make him his signature drink called the Tiger Woods. It was a mixture of lemonade and raspberry tea. He loved it and we thought it was an extremely kind gesture by the waiter.
The late night happy hour is NOT to be missed!   The Japanese Lasagna is gooey-NOM-NOM and the Oh My God is a favorite as well.   Can't go wrong on that menu!
Amazing... really good! If your in vegas this place is a hidden gem. Best lunch specials and lovely service. Everything is fresh.

I am not a sushi expert by any means, but last night,  I got to experience a wonderful dinner there with a friend who is. Everything I had; pot stickers, the 777 roll, and tasting my friends sashimi style everything , omg! The atmosphere was casual and fun. The service was  awesome too! Huge selection on the menu, hard to pick when your a novice, and the saki was devine. I look forward to going back there soon!

I never thought o would give this place a bad review. I have eaten here a few times in the past and had a great experience, however the most recent visit was not one.  I called earlier in the day to ask if I needed a reservation for the hibachi grill and the lady who answered said it would be a good idea, so I made one. We arrived about five minutes before the reservation and there was no host/hostess and the entire restaurant was empty with staff walking around. We waited a few minutes before I found someone and asked if we could be seated. She said they were cleaning and I would have to wait.  We were seated and our order was taken. My girlfriend specifically said she did not want rice. The dude came out to cook our meal, forgot to make us the shrimp appetizer and put my extra rice on her plate. I asked for our shrimp once he was done and he immediately cooked it for us. No one came to ask if we were doing okay or if we would like more to drink. I can understand if the place was busy and they were slow to come around to check on us, but we were the only patrons in the restaurant. I was a bit shocked at the experience. The food was great, but I will not be returning due to the sheer lack of service.

Although the food is great I had a terrible encounter with the wait staff who insisted that they only took cards with the chip. That is the most absurd thing I've ever heard. This dimwit did not know how to process a regular debit card. She probably did not know how to process cash. She actually had the nerve to tell me that next time I'm here please use the card with the chip. Is this ridiculous or what?. Buyer beware. Money is money. Ignorance is ignorant. I guess I'll  head over to Spicy Tuna next time I want sushi. At Spicy Tuna those folks take cash, debit card, credit card, and check. Perhaps they have a more intelligent wait staff.
Very pricey for hibachi, seemed very dark and dirty. It was so smokey that my eyes were watering the entire meal. Tried it once won't be back.
My go to spot for some good brew n good sushi,open late night so thats good.never super packed like other sushi spots

My family love coming to this restaurant. It's The Place to come for after hour for their special menu. They have the best tempura crab legs that you can't get anywhere else. My husband introduced me to this place 6 years ago and we have been coming here ever since. Everything on their menu are so delicious and the price is great too. We always take our family and friends here whenever we are in the city or when I come here for business trip. Never miss a dinner here when we are staying at the strip. The staff here are so friendly and awesome. Rudy has been serving us ever since my husband took me here. And he is still here at the restaurant. We come here not just for some great and delicious sushi and tempura crab legs but to visit our friend Rudy too. Love this place!!!

The food was not good at all.... No seasoning to the food... Was the worse hibachi restaurant I have ever experienced.  WILL NEVER come back... Maybe it was the chef and his cooking but the hibachi was BAD No taste... I wasted  $77.00 we should of complain and not paid. We ate about 4 bites and was ready to go..  The service was nice it was the hibachi that we did not like... Need to teach the cooks how to season the food properly.

We sat at the teppanyaki table for dinner tonight and it was great. I had the fillet and chicken. The food was top notch and the chef put in a great show while cooking. I also liked that the table was smaller then other places i have been, it made for easier conversation. I highly recommend Osaka!

In Vegas for the first time and wanted to try something off the strip.. found this place loved it great service atmosphere and the employees were attentive and made you feel welcomed. Great food great price! Definitely a place to come back too
Such good sushi and plum wine. And very nice service. Best spicy tuna in town. I come here every week.

the greatest thing about this place is that they are consistent. you always know what your going to get. i only know this because i've been a patron for over 5 years. also the staff is always friendly and the restaurant is super clean and comfortable.  this place is more of a locals spot which i love. the quality of ingredients is top notch and they have a great late night and happy hour specials.  i only wish they had a few options for vegetarians ( but it is a sushi place.. hehe)  other than that i can't think of any complaints.

Apparently the tepanyaki portion doesn't open until 4. They have a very limited lunch menu. I called before I came down to make sure they were open but they didn't mention the limited menu so when I took a $30 cap from the strip I was very disappointed

without a doubt the best Japanese cuisine I've had in ages. Everything was extremely fresh, beautifully prepared and delivered with a smile. This was a real find for us as we were working in the area and stumbled upon it... LOVE it, highly recommend! You won't be disappointed. And leave room for dessert.... just sayin'
It doesn't get any better than this! Best quality! Best Chef and Knife! Amazing variety and new creations! Can compete any day with chef Nobu and his partners

If you enjoy Sushi or Teppan style dining - you MUST visit Osaka.  For years I've gone to the orgininal one on Sahara - but I live closer to the new one on Eastern.  The food is fresh and wonderful and they have half orders on the sushi rolls so 2 people can try a bigger variety.  The Teppan grill is also delicious and entertaing.  Leave room for dessert because the fried oreos are to die for!

I took my fiance here on a formal date and this place was perfect! We sat at a tatami room for just him and I, it is a traditional japanese room were you have to remove your shoes and sit on your knees. It was so comfortable though and we felt like we was the only ones here because the rice screens separates all the tables and it feels more like a private dinner. I loved it! Oh and right when you walk in you are greeted from every person you pass by who works there. Our waitress was so nice and have a sense of humor. In the menu there was just so much to chose from. We were soo full but my fiance still wanted to try the desert which was the fried tempura ice cream. Damn I was good to go after that. It was like a orgasm in your mouth haha. Well I would definately go here again but only on special occassions.

We had an amazing time at this place! Driving up it didn't look like much, and entrance would fool you too. But the food was out of this world! We had sushi and teppanyski, and it was so good that I did not wan to stop eating even though I was full. Highly recommended this place

Hands down the best sushi experience in town, the sushi is the shizznit and the atmosphere makes you feel like your in japan. Udon and miso soup is the best no one elses can compare. A bit on the pricer side but you get what you pay for

I did a last minute google search and landed on a local Vegas blog that said this place had amazing, fresh, innovative Japanese dishes.... so we went and were wowed. Don't be put off by the seedy area, it is located in the mini-mall with the mini statue of liberty statue and next to the store that sells, um... sexy attire. We were 5 adults and 6 kids and every single one of us were incredibly happy. We showed up for early 6pm dinner and were seated on tatami mats.  The menu is wide and varied, but it had things for picky non-adventurous types and others like me and my BFF who went for urchin and hand rolls and their specialty rolls.. The rolls were innovative. you can order individual yakitori freshly grilled, fresh ebi sashimi with their crispy fried heads, their udon was enjoyed by my 70 year old dad and 5 year old daughter, and the atmosphere made my manga-loving nieces very happy. The waiters handled our big ole table deftly and with patience. I recommend this place to anyone.

Hands down, the BEST sushi / sashimi for us ever!  Great atmosphere (very comfortable), super nice (and artistic) chefs, interesting new things to try, and desert to die for.  I don't write that many reviews, but had to sing the praises of this place.  Highly recommended!  We'll be back for sure.

This a cute lil random sushi place near herbs and rye. Has a great ambiance, when you sit at a table you have to take your shoes off and sit on a pillow. Kind of a fun concept. The only thing that sucked was that it wasn't all you could eat! I would definitely reccommend it to sushi lovers considering they had some rare fish!

This restaurant is so cute and small. The entrance is kind of weird and there is literally a wall right when you open the door. But as far as the food, it was delicious! I got the beef teriyaki plate and ordered the u-my roll. Both were good, but the banzai sauce on my roll was a little bit spicy that I wasn't aware of. Most of the rolls included something spicy so I would advise you not to order that if you don't prefer that. The staff was very nice and attended to our table often. And overall it was a good experience :)
Great variety, quality, & service! Stopped by for a quick dinner, served right away. A true gem!
Never been here but this place was on the " dirty diner report" on the channel 13 news tonight.

This place really lived up to our expectations.  We love going to teppan grill style restaurants and we have a favorite one back home in California.  So on vacation in Vegas we decided to try this place out.  It was just as good as our place back home and priced about the same.  Our chef, hurricane pho, was awesome and fun.  Would definitely recommend the teppan grill to anyone looking for good affordable food in Vegas.

Best sushi I have eaten in Las Vegas. I have eaten at both the Sahara restaurant (many years ago) and currently only go to the Eastern location when I want sushi. Always good fresh sushi and always good service.

Food was okay and came in a timely manner. I was disappointed with the customer service. They were very monotoned, and in my eyes customer service can always hype an over-all experience. I'm giving a poor rating and won't recommend any family or friends. This experience was nothing special and won't be remembered. If the staff manager reads these reviews I encourage coaching your team to be more personable.

I'm a big fan of Osaka - Henderson. The quality of their food is very consistent and their prices are reasonable. I always order the 911 roll and Miso Ramen soup. My kids enjoy their vegetable fried rice and Kalbi beef sticks. The teppan grill is a great value because of the portions and entertainment. If you're looking for a deal, go there during Happy Hour (starts at 10 pm nightly). I highly recommend this place if you have the munchies in the middle of the night.

I frequent this restaurant quite often.....I came in tonight at 9:50 to have dinner. I wasn't acknowledged until 10:10. Only 2 other tables came in 5 mins after me. I was greeted by my server who seems over whelmed, she apologized and I understood since I've been in hospitality for 10 years! She took my order (4 small items for HH menu all ordered at the same time)  The other 2 tables that's came in after me already started receiving food.I didn't receive my my first item until 10:40. I asked where everything else was and she said it was coming and that the cooks probably did my ticket in the wrong order. I told her I was patient with her after acknowledging me so late that now this is unacceptable. And that I'm sure she forgot to put in my order. 10:50 2 more items show up. 11:00 the server comes to me and asks if I want to cancel my last order I told her I would like to speak to a manager. Another male server came to give me my last item I told him I don't want it and wanted to speak to a manager. He said the manager was gone and he was the one in charge. I explained my situation and he also blamed the chefs saying that they're new. He offered a to take the last item off my bill. Big wow you removed something off my bill that I didn't eat, that I ordered nearly a hour ago!!!! He ended up giving me a discount , but because of the way the "manager" handled it I will not be returning.
I typically come for the late night happy hour menu, 10p-2a. Half size/half price rolls, and specials on their tempura and seafood, other appetizers, and sake specials. Can't beat that!
Miso Ramen is just ok. Sashimi and Roll combo is just ok. Good service :-)
My favorite sushi spot. The food is killer and the staff exceptional. I like to go solo, sit at the sushi bar, and watch the chefs work their magic. Sushi is an art unto itself.

Customer service deserves 5 stars. Food is good quality but the amount you get for the price is the reason I took a star off. We got the small sashimi platter that you can share with 2 or more people and the slices of the fish were a little small. They charged us for sides of rice which usually come with sashimi dinners. They also charged for green tea which most authentic places from home don't but this is also Vegas without many Japanese options.

My husband and I decided to take the kids to dinner one night. First time trying this place, although we've been in the neighborhood for years. We sat at the teppan grill, and it was awesome . Our chef was the highlight of the night.... Lots of props and kept us laughing. He had us catch shrimp in our mouths and even had a cheech and Chong pic. Food was really good! We agreed that it was the best filet we've had. Service was great... We will definitely be back!

This place is awesome for several reasons.  One the food is amazing.  The fried rice is the best.  Two the cook/entertainers are friendly and funny.  If you have kids, this is a great place to take them for a family dinner night as they will love watching them make the dinner.

Just got out from this place and decided to write a review. Why? Because I read so many reviews about their service being suck and I have to disagree!   It was 1PM and it wasn't too busy (I think there are 3 occupied tables, a family at tatami, and few people on sushi bar). We were greeted and asked whether we would like to sit on table or tatami. We chose tatami and so directed to back area.   All of the waitresses were very nice and helpful. In fact, when my husband ordered a Ten Zaru Soba (cold noodle) from their regular menu, the waiter informed us that the item also available in Lunch Specials menu and for the same price, we would get tempura (2 pieces of shrimp) on the side. I really appreciate this kind of gesture. Especially because of the last review I read when I stepped out of the car said that this place "WILL RIP YOU OFF"!   They also gave out our drinks then miso soups then our food promptly. We tried: - Oh Kamisama (tempura roll with spicy tuna on the top and spicy mayo sauce) ~ very good and fresh - Broiled Eel bento box ~ very good - Tonkatsu bento box ~ 'twas OK - Ten Zaru Soba (cold noodle) ~ pretty good according to husband  Food presentation was really good.  Waitresses keep checking if we were doing OK but in a non-annoying way. They just popped in and out; I think to make sure that we didn't have to go out from our tatami booth to get them.   So yeah, overall, my experience was a very good and enjoyable one.

Went here after skimming the Desert Magazine and reading how this place offers a cheap late-night dining menu. I was intrigued by the $5 ramen and the inexpensive sushi rolls.  The good: -There is a wide variety of items offered on the late-night menu, most under/at $5 and all under $10. Things like tempura, skewers, and edamame. -They also offer their regular menu this late. -They are open till 2am every day.  The bad: -The service was SLOW. The people were nice and they got our drinks to us early, but then disappeared for a while before taking our food order. And then it took us at least 30 min to get our food. The place wasn't packed and there seemed to be enough staff to handle the current crowd. -Even though the list of sushi rolls on the late-night menu were around $4-$11, they were only HALF rolls.  The food was just ok, and I feel like if I had paid more for it, then I wouldn't have enjoyed the food as much. Maybe I should come back and try the regular menu items? I'm not sure if I would be willing to, but for the convenience of their business hours, I might stop by again if I want some sushi at 1am.
I  didn't splurge on any of the specialty rolls but the rolls I got were cheap and delicious.
Excellent Food and Excellent Service......We had a last minute reservation for 13 of us and they were happy to accomodate us.  We could not asked for a better experience!
Love the tatami seating, great sushi, delicious teppanyaki
The hot food was delicious but the sushi was horrible and had to much rice on the outside. I do not suggest this place for sushi at all!

Dafne was very unprofessional rude and had a very bad attitude came from out of town to be treated badly and I had a party of 2 and want to charge me 18% gruiti what kind of business is this I would never go back again stealing from people is wrong

One of the best sushi restaurant in Vegas. I've tried many different sushi here and they were all delicious and fresh. Especially the special fish off the menu board were so authentic. Staff is very good and polite. Chef is very professional. Atmosphere was nice. They have many Japanese "tatami"style booth, very private. You feel like eating sushi in Japan!!!  I definitely recommend this place and come back soon!!!!

Best sushi place I've found in Vegas and their teppan grill is great too! The fish is great quality- the only place in Vegas where I can order tuna and yellowtail nigiri and know it will be on point every time! And the place is really cute and comfy the way it's set up.

I came here with a group of 5 for a birthday dinner a few weeks ago. Everybody loved it. We had one of the tables in the back to ourselves (I thought it was kinda fun eating with no shoes on) and the service was very quick. 2 of us came specifically for the Okonomi Yaki and we were not disappointed. We'll definitely be coming back here.

My husband and I were very disappointed in the service we received here. We are huge fans of Samurai (on sunset and marks) and had heard that Osaka was very similar. It being closer to our house, we decided it was worth a try and regretted it greatly. We waited in the front to be seated for 20 minutes. There was nobody else waiting and no staff member at the hostess stand. My husband had to go into the dining area 3 times to get someone's attention. There were maybe 4 other groups in the entire restaurant so there so no reason for such negligence. Once we were seated we continuously had to flag down staff members so that we could place our order, then once the food finally came it was subpar. As if that wasn't bad enough, they are incredibly costly. I don't mind paying a lot  for good food and good service but this was not deserving of it's price tag in the slightest. No plans of every returning to this disappointing establishment.

Terrible customer service!!! Had a groupon for that location and the owner wouldn't accept it. Said he wouldn't get a paycheck. Wasn't offered any other explanation or comp item. I spent money to go to a place I wouldn't have gone too and because of their error they won't see my face again.

It is one of the places in Vegas that has been around awhile and not to mention burned down and worth rebuilding. The service for some reason has always be excellent. It use to be where I took dates. The sushi is decent and what I enjoyed the most was the atmosphere. If you buy an Osaka shirt, every visit gets you a bottle of saki. I am a huge sushi lover and fancy sushi has become pretty typical. Every time I have been there and sat at the bar they offer a complimentary bottle of saki. Nice! Just a nice place to go.
Great OG sushi house ,everyone is super nice and the food delicious  Highly recommended !!!
What a great place.  Everyone was friendly.  The food was delicious.  Dinner for five and a child with drinks about $275.  The chef put on quite a show for us.
If you want fresh, you want Osaka.  Great late night specials too

Osaka is a first place tie for best sushi in Las Vegas in my book. They have a great menu full of super fresh fish that never disappoints. The staff are really nice and attentive. The chefs attention to detail in both presentation and flavor is what truly sets this place apart from the rest.
I love their calamari grill, kampachi, the quality of their tuna is the best in Vegas!
Love the Osaka Special with fried rice. Always good with awesome fried rice. Friendly service as well. We come at least 4 times a year :)
I always bring friends abd family here when there in town. I live the admiril feist. Getting ready to have now. Yummy!!
Wednesday nights I love their live music by the bar. Food is good nothing extraordinary, ordered some rolls and fried rice and gyozas.service was good. I will return mainly for the music.
Excellent service from the time we sat down until we left. Food was excellent without being way large a portion.  Very enjoyable evening. The kids love the hibachi style and the friendly chefs.

Swear by this place. They have the best salmon!! Great for a date or to go with friends. The staff is amazing and always super friendly. Food comes out fast which I appreciate! Luckily, I've never been one to let decor effect how much I enjoy my dinner. We love the live Jazz!!!
best sushi place ive been to by far ! kinda pricy, but its worth it

First time here at Osaka.  My sweetheart brought me here and we had the treasure chest , totally like it the tempura was on  point and so was the tuna salad .  Never had warm sake my baby popped my cherry on that one and im still on the fence on SAKE!!. She just ordered dessert Tempura ice cream with chocolate syrup in sure its going to be off the hook , cant go wrong with any kind of ice cream. Moderately priced and good fish quality. I recommend the tatami room if your good and fit but if your a big boy like get the regular table ! Since dinner started I've been planning my exit from the table, we will be coming back fo sho.

I'll try to keep this brief... Upon arrival there were minors doing homework at the bar; highly inappropriate. The hibachi tables and surroundings were filthy, so were the menus. The service was just OK. They forgot the appetizer, we never got them. The fried rice was so salty that it was inedible. The entrees were seriously below standards, bland and blah. There was no "show". I had a pepper shaker thrown at me - yes, it was an accident but it was greasy and it just added to my irritation. Bottom line: are you kidding me? For this kind of money you can get infinitely better food, better environment and better service.
Love the late night menu . They also have seating in the back which is very traditional and Private

Of the prodigious Japanese restaurants in this town, Osaka Japanese Bistro is one of my two favorites. (I reviewed the other one on Yelp with 5 stars, also). Osaka served me last night some fresh tuna poki salad that is too sublime to describe. Their tempura vegetables--zucchini, yam, and a red onion ring--were deep-fried with fresh oil, noticeable right away from the pale coloring of the breading and the way the taste of the vegetables were enhanced--not overpowered from previously used oil. (This is the mark of a 1st-tier sushi bar. 2nd-tier sushi bars in Japan actually purchased first-use oil from the top tier.)  Traditional tekka maki along with a plethora of other sushi rolls all complemented each other to be washed down with Osaka's signature apple saketini.  I cannot stress enough the importance of wait staff in the dining experience. The fact that I was surprised at how surreptitiously my drink was refilled or how my bill just appeared out of thin air is testimony to the efficacy of front-of-house operations. (I should have expected their efficiency when I noticed our server using an electronic order pad with stylus to take our order!)  Good staff do what they are told, and the staff here were well above that standard: they anticipated my wants.  If local Las Vegans want to experience dining excellence, they should look no further than Osaka Japanese Bistro.

Unbelievably horrible!! Came in for the first time tonight at 11:40pm with no one to greet us... Had to find our way inside to the dining room only to meet a girl who didn't look too happy to see us, didn't care that we were there... Didn't look at us while she was talking to us. Wasn't sure if she was our server or just a hostess? Anyway, worst sushi experience ever

We first came here at 2003 and have been coming back every time we visit Vegas for Sema Show   Last time we were here was 2012 and we were very happy.   We came here again today 2017, and I must say, it was absolutely delicious. We got the white tiger, Kai and treasure roll. Blue fin sushi  The fish is ridiculously fresh and extremely tasty, it must be imported from Japan daily  We came here again with our team, and was served by David. He was an amazing host and convinced us to get their rib eye hibachi that arrived in the morning and hasn't been frozen yet.  It was OMG!!!!!!!!!  We all tasted it an no one has ever tried this most amazing steak!  I tried it and I have tasted some of the most expensive steaks in New York, and hands out this was the best steak I have ever tasted in my life.  Keep up the good work! And we will defiantly be back again.

We are regulars here. On may 2. 2014  our usual party of five showed up for my sons birthday. Now we love eating here but as we were seated in the back at the teppan table a large cockroach crawled out from the side of the grill and headed toward my daughter....the manager just smiled said he would kill it and moved us to the next table! No offers of any kind followed! This was disgusting and will surely end our  twice monthly dinners there-gross!!!

My first experience with real sushi (not grocery store or deli counter sushi).  Loved every bite.  Even got adventurous and ate the face off of a giant shrimp creature.  Eyeball stalks, and all.  That may have been a garnish.  I don't know, it was also my first fling with the sake.  Speaking of sake...this is also the only place I've found that served a particular sake which was brewed by females, to cater to females.  Came in a frosted pink bottle.  Little bit sweeter than other sakes I've tried, but good...and the bottle looked precious, with a pretty flower stuck in, nestled on my girlfriend's nightstand.    I tried many new things, here.  Sashimi of various sorts, seaweed salad, eel sauce, tako and tamago...always attractively presented and delicious.  Went here several times over the years in Las Vegas.  Never had a meal I didn't thoroughly enjoy, never had a server who wasn't friendly and outgoing, never had any fellow guests complain about taking off their shoes, never had a menu recommendation that went unappreciated,   never had a check that raised my eyebrows.    My only beef with the place was the smell...the last few times I went, everything past the sushi bar smelled like a sewer.  Now, I managed food places for a long time, and I know that once there's a problem in the lines under the building, it can be a bear (a big, angry, expensive bear) to get taken care of.  But in a sit-down joint with aspirations towards the classy, aged poo cannot be allowed to waft.    SO...if someone can confirm for me that the smell has been taken care of (my nose now being several hours to the south), I'll bump this review up a notch.

Osaka really provides a stellar EXPERIENCE while you eat great food- with a sushi bar, tatami rooms OR teppan grill tables.  With their standard menu spanning almost 10 pages theres certainly no shortage of that while also not dominishing any of the specialty in their dishes they manage to offer a lot more diversity than your typical china town sushi place- even in the typical dishes.  They are always willing to customize & offer extremely attentice service, accompanying their ginger/wasabi with a lightly dressed cucumber salad.  O

Osaka has some of the best sushi in town. It's always fresh, and the prices are reasonable--particularly on the late-night happy hour menu, which runs from 10 to 2.  Last night, we had an early dinner at the sushi bar. (You can also sit at tables in the small front restaurant or dine at the teppan grill in the back, but we always come just for sushi, so we prefer to sit in front of the chefs.) As usual, we ordered a full rainbow roll and a half dragon. And to change it up, we tried two half rolls that we had never ordered before: the fresh white (albacore and hamachi topped with a tangy sauce); and the Treasure Island (salmon, hamachi, and capers--like a Japanese take on a bagel and lox). Both were fine, although the TI was a little tart because it was topped with a thin lemon slice. We much preferred our usual fare; you can't go wrong with fresh fish and eel.  We also split an order of the spicy garlic edamame, upon a friend's suggestion. Meh. And I got a large Sapporo beer. Yum! This feast cost just over $50, and it was pretty tasty. My only issue with the meal was that the rolls weren't rolled tightly enough, so they kept falling apart. Not a game changer, but still ...  Osaka was recently featured on "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives," so we were expecting it to be full of tourists. Thankfully, it wasn't. Lots of locals, and the same low-key atmosphere that we've grown to expect.  There are several Osakas in town, but this is the best--especially if you're a fan of rainbows and dragons!

Great stop if your on Sahara. The fish was surprisingly fresh and the staff amiable. Would have been a 3 star review had it not been for the quality of fish and a unique assortment of specials. The Osaka or grunt fish was the bet I've had. Highly recommended for a quick bite but seating is a little cramped so no large parties.

Authentic traditional sushi at its finest. The Japanese style tables with mats to sit on is pretty awesome. The sushi is delicious and creative. The flavors of the sushi sandwich were oh so good. The lunch specials are convenient for my co-workers and I. Staff is always great!

Been here twice now with my boyfriend and both times we have loved it! Our main chef is chef Ray! He is the best by far! He's quick, and always notices when your ready for another roll.! The Mochi there is amazing, 3 for $5.95.?! Can't beat that!! Will definitely be back again to see Chef Ray
Tuesday's has two for one appetizers. Go for the mussels, nachos, tuna, Brussels sprouts, and the halibut tacos.
I  went   there  last  Sunday   and  men  !!!   really  god  sushi   I  think  come  back   asap

Had a fantastic time here with a fairly large party!  The staff was very accommodating and we weren't made to feel like an inconvenience even with the size of our group.  The place has a very authentic feel and I very much enjoyed the Sushi, as well as some of the specialty beverages that they serve.  Worth a visit if you are in the area.

Nice place to have sushi and rolls. The food is fine, fresh and tastes good.  Maybe a bit plain. The interior is not fancy, dining rooms are small and dark.  But the ice cream... Wow, like it so much! I am thinking stop by only to get some :)
Good sushi.  They have 4 different seating options: Booth, Sushi Bar, Grillside & Shoes Off Floor.  Decent sushi at decent prices.
Why busy at night?  Because not too many restaurants are open.  It doesn't means that the restaurant serving under cook fish or tempura not even brown yet. Server and chef's need to more training.

Amazing food. I order to go from here 2-3x a week. However, tonight I called to place a to go order and I was very rudely told that they no longer accepted to-go orders over the phone and that I would have to come in and place my order. What? If I wanted to sit there for 30 minutes I would just dine-in. Extremely disappointed to be treated like this by a place I've been patronizing for a long time. I love the food but will no longer be giving this place my business. 5 stars for food quality, 1 for customer service. Beyond disappointed in you Osaka.

We love Osaka!!!  They have very fresh, delicious sushi and sashimi.   There are very few restaurants around that I could say that about.  We've been there many times in the past 4 years and never been disappointed.  As for the person complaining about the price, I understand that you want to have accurate information, however $40.00 per person is very average for a full dinner of sashimi and sushi.  We've paid that much at any sushi restaurant we've ever been to.  (even the gross ones)  This place really does rock though!!!
Food was great. Our chef Joe Hibachi was hilarious. A little pricier than other tepan grills.

Sometimesyoy get more than what you pay for--that sums it up in a nutshell. The rolls are buttery goodness. My sister and I sat in one of the wood bench rooms and ate to our heart's content.  It's simple, expected , and friendly enough to make you want to give them more business.
This was a great way to have our birthday dinner !!what a show!!! This is for sure a don't judge a book by its cover!!
Every time we come to vegas we come to osaka... it's defenetly the best sushi you can ever have.

When in Vegas recently for a business conference, my sales reps chose this place for dinner after hearing the rave reviews of how Osaka came highly recommended.  I was up for Japanese cuisine and something different from all the flashy tourist places on the strip.  The restaurant is definitely low key, casual and with no glitz whatsoever.  In fact, it looked pretty run down but definitely a favorite and popular place with the locals.  We requested a Japanese table that involved taking off your shoes and sitting down on cushions.  It was pretty run down and when seated and hanging my bare feet down under the table onto the old carpet, I couldn't help but wonder about the numerous pairs of bare feet that touched this very spot prior to me.  Perhaps my 3 stars is due to not being a seafood or fish lover.  I stuck to a teriyaki chicken and steak combo that was dry and just meh.  Rest of my party ordered various fish dishes that were okay but not exceptional.  I also ordered a California maki that came cold and didn't taste freshly made.  The plus, this place was pretty inexpensive verses restaurants on the strip.  It's good to see Osaka has a loyal following and good business.  Service was good too.  Perhaps just a place that wasn't for me.
The bam poppers we had on Wednesday were great along with the spicy tuna rolls and fried rice.  I also recommend the Japanese sandwich.

Okay, first off this place is my go-to sushi restaurant. I absolutely love this place, but today just wasn't that day. We walked in got seated with no probably, if you ever been to Osaka there are these tatami rooms and there is this one table where you are in a corner and there is a wall where nobody can see you and so unfortunately we got seated there. We sat down and usually you get water within the minute you've been there but no, we didn't cuz we were in the corner. 10 minutes pass by and still no water... nobody has yet acknowledged that we are there. So I stepped out and physically walked to an employee and asked can we please get a waiter and she said yeah yeah of course, so I sat back down and again waited another 10 minutes... so no water or anything. So we decided to just leave and go somewhere else. When we walked out no one even notice that we were leaving, they were too busy talking! & did I tell you that there were no business, there were only 3 tables so they weren't even busy! I'm not gonna say don't come here because I absolutely love this place. Maybe they were just having a rough day.

Osaka is simply the best locals sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. They are always consistent. The fish is fresh and I have never had a bad meal. Do not compare this place or its prices with an all you can eat joint.

Went here with friends because I wanted sushi & my friend from the wretched said Osaka was having some great deal. Well that great deal was only for the westside location so overpriced for what we ordered. I had one sushi roll which was ok but no better than nearby places without teppan that charge less. Two of them said their meal was good, but considered fair by the person who granted is the pickiest & also was paying the bill.
Great food and the service is always GREAT, however it is a bit pricey. Maybe not the best place for kids

Normally I would never give one star, but this place justifies it! I have been in Vegas for over 20 years, been to this and the Summerlin Osaka several times - however this experience was horrible! First, with how old this place is and how much they charge, update your business! When you walk in, the other review that says this place is like a crack house is very correct! That is the only way to describe the experience when you walk in. Further, nothing has been updated since this place opened ... even the bathroom, with the overflowing dirty toilet!  Now on to the service, very rude and a "no-it-all" with zero customer service skills.  We went in because of the sign that said "Late Night Specials" - I called and was told many of the rolls were very discounted. The truth is, they are half rolls! AND if you ordered a whole roll off of the main menu, it would have been cheaper then two half rolls. Do you think because it is late night in Vegas, people will eat less, so it is a deal? If you order a half roll from the late night specials, you save an average of $.25. Really? This is your draw to get people in? Very deceptive. The quality of the food was OK, nothing amazing - and not even sure if what we got was what we ordered. Also, do not expect a refill on your water or tea or beer for that matter.   So many better late night places in Vegas that actually wants repeat business.

I LOVE Osaka because they have excellent quality fish - some of the freshest I've had.  I work at a high-end Sushi Restaurant on the strip, so I'm *really* picky about my sushi.  This is one of the only places I can still go and feel like I'm getting the quality I expect, along with some creativity as well.  Try the Sapo roll - it's fresh, simple, and delish!  The Sake List is pretty damn good, their late night menu has great variety and prices, and the service is attentive and knowledgeable, too!  This is where I go when I get off work and I want sushi.  I'm treated with open arms, but they don't hover over me and try to talk to me all night.  And the sushi chefs don't get plastered while preparing the food like a few of the other small sushi joints around.  They have fun, but are professional.  Very few locals places can even begin to compare. Highly recommend!

Came to Osaka, waited at the front of the place to be seated no one came up to us for over 10 minutes, we were just standing there awkwardly and hungry and finally someone came to seat us, I don't think the front desk is ran good, or at least at the time we came in. I ordered some sushi it was pretty good, the prices were in the higher side, the food was pretty good though and the waitress was nice.

Sushi was great, I had the Bonzai, the sauce was amazing, however the staff was a bit standoffish and the tea was terrible, I've also never been charged for tea before, so that was new, other than that i really liked it. I might go back, if only for the amazing Bomba dessert i got,
Very good sushi. It is extremely delicious. I remember eating here with my parents and the service was top notch.

I just love all of it. AND they have brown rice. AND they're open late at night. AND they're on my way home, so when I'm on my way from work, and it's late at night, I can call and order something fun and delicious to pick up. Yay!

I happened to catch Diners, Drive ins and dives on Food Network the other evening and they featured Osaka Japanese Bistro.  Being new to Vegas, we depend on Yelp for restaurant recommendations.   Naturally, I pulled Osaka on Yelp and the reviews were not bad so my husband and decided to eat here on Sunday.   It was around 1:30 when we pulled up and we were able to find a parking space. Warning, the parking lot is very small.  We opened the door and literally hit a wall.  You can either go right or left to enter the restaurant but there was no sign on why there were 2 different entrances.  Odd but we decided to make a right and enter another set of doors.  You run into a dining room with a sushi bar on the right.  I'm assuming the hostess station is in the middle of the restaurant but not sure.  Just a very strange layout for first timers.   We sat at a table and waited for our waiter.  After 10 minutes, our waiter asked if anyone has taken our drink order which we replied no.  He promptly took our drink order while we viewed the menu.  We took advantage of the lunch menu and their special.  From the lunch menu we ordered: Kamikaze and Tiger rolls in addition to beef yakisoba.  From the daily special menu we ordered the King Crab roll.   The rolls were ok.  On both the Kamikaze and Tiger the sauce was very salty.  Yakisoba was very good.  The beef was really tender.  The king crab roll was nothing special.  Overall. Glad we tried it but will try other sushi restaurants.

Finished up date night with the GF at OJB.  I had made dinner reservation earlier in the week.  But I don't think reservations would have been an issue.  Things seemed pretty mellow at 9:00 in the evening.  While waiting to be seated I noticed a jazz singer in the bar area.  Cool sounds and would have loved to kick back and listen for a bit but we were starving.  We had a Teppanyaki table all to our selves.  While waiting for the chief we at a delicious roll called a "Japanese Sandwhich" which was similar to a "Japanese Lasagna" just not as messy.  We each  went with the fillet minion but the GF ordered the lobster and I the sea bass.  Our chief was very nice and got down to business. We did not need the culinary ninja performance and perhaps he sensed that.  He did the basic stuff but focused on getting our chow out and plated quickly.  Damn tasty was everything!  We particularly liked the sea bass of which I wanted to devour on my own but gladly shared with GF.  Osaka was a nice change up and very pleasurable experience.

I love this place!! One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas! I have been coming here for years! I bring all my visitors, friends and family members to this place! I love that they have traditional booths (you have to take your shoes off) and they have tables, a bar, or a hibachi grill. I prefer the booth. My favorite desert is the tempura ice cream with chocolate drizzle and whip cream on top!

I happen visit here by the search on the GPS. They open until 02:00am and have nice TaTami Table. Selection of apertizers and main Japanese foods are wide in addition to good sushi. It is satisfactable even by Japanese guests. The variety of Sushi is so wide and we could enjoy Aji, oh-toro, and chu-toro, etc, Impressive was fried rice that is exactly same to the one we can have in Japan. Although the most of the guests are Americans, I recommend here to Japanese peoples,

Service was excellent. Husband got two rolls, a kamikaze and caterpillar. He said they were at least a 4/5. I had the teriyaki chicken meal and it was just the right amount of food with wonderful flavor. We will definitely be back when his sushi craving hits.
Great value with a huge menu and quality food.  The lunch specials that are offered everyday and at a very generous time widow are a big bonus.

Mmmm sweet Osaka. They have some of the best sushi you can get in Las Vegas. As noted by another user the entrance looks like a crack house. They have traditional Japanese seating where you kneel and take your shoes off.

The food was amazing!! I had the ramen combination. I picked spicy tuna roll and tonkustu flavor. The order came with a salad, the rolls, ramen and a salad. The gyoza was really crispy. The best I had!!

My boyfriend and I wanted some late-night sushi on a weekday. We were on the strip, but couldn't find anything open past 10pm. One of the door guys at Bally's suggested it so we grabbed a cab. It's a bit off the the strip, but I'd probably walk across the country for sushi. We sat at the sushi bar, which was pretty dead (as was the rest of the place, it was like 11pm on Tuesday). We ordered a handful of rolls, all super delicious! The Chef was making unique rolls, not on the menu, which is always fun! Bill was pretty cheap for all the food we ate. All and all, it was pretty good. Only negative would be the distance from the strip to the place, but well worth the cab fare!
Took forever for a host to come. Host was rude and did not have any customer service skills

First time here. Nice place. No Japanese on the sushi counter. Not good. Ordered. Two combination dinners, ordered saba, salmon skin salad, two std. sushi. We were hungry and I wanted to try the sushi. First the waiter was not personable, I really think he wasn't trained as a waiter, no smile, put our dishes on the outer edge of the table. Strange. The other waiters were ok, They smiled and had eye contact, 1. Sushi was small,the rice had no flavor . the fresh fish was to small . 2. Saba was ok 3. salmon skin salad, salmon didn't have to much taste, veggie wasn't fresh , dressing was weak, 4. tonkasu was only ok, tempura was good, 5, sukiyaki was tasty. I have mixed feelings about this place. I went with a friend and she enjoyed it.
Allen and Rudy took such great care of us!!! Rudy was so personable and a joy to be around. Food was amazing too!!

I've been going to Osaka for years and the one thing others mentioned that I completely agree with is...  You always know what you're going to get.  I absolutely love their rolls, I love that they're open til 2 am (because I usually crave sushi during half-off roll time anyway).  I cannot find a place with better Japanese Lasagne. Seriously. It's always good and never cold.  My favorite roll in the whole entire world seems to be the Matsui #55 roll. I'm addicted to banzai sauce thanks to this roll.
