Was greeted, seated and served all within a timely period. Had kitsune udon soup with marinated tofu and some kind of fish broth. Helped after a long exhausting trip to Vegas. At the end tried green tea tiramisu, pricey but most worth it.  They have eating area (I was starving so just stayed there cause it was empty) and Japanese rooms. On right side they have stylish sit-down counter where you can watch them prepare sushi.   Next time will try more of their dishes when not as tired.

LISA LISA IS THE BOMB. Just saying. So my sister and I came here with our Dad, he had been living in Las Vegas for about a year, and he wanted to show us what good 'Las Vegas sushi' tasted like. I was skeptical. I mean, Las Vegas is a freakin' desert so I didn't expect the sushi to be as impeccable as we have it here in the city by the bay. Nicky B is a pretty foolish kid.   We walked in and I was immediately amazed with all the cool-futuristic-tables and high definition televisions that played menu items over and over again. We sat down at the sushi bar. Our sushi-chef was really nice. My dad knew him, so we he talked to us about stuff. Pretty cool. Then comes the food. I take a bite. I'm blown away! Wow. It was incredible. Tasty. Ahhh. Lisa Lisa I love you. Try it ya'll. You'll fall in love too.

Came to Osaka really late during my trip out to Vegas to check out the happy hour with some friends, and saw this place had great reviews.  We certainly didn't have a terrible experience, but I can't say I'd come here again.  I got a California Roll, chicken wings and shared a Japanese Burger sushi which was weirdly unique but tasted pretty good.  The California roll tasted odd, I'm not sure if the avocado was in the best shape, but it was alright.  The chicken wings were cool too, and we also shared some edamame.  But the prime reason I'm giving this place 1 star is the price.  This place is ridiculously expensive.  Even a plain 6-piece cucumber roll was $4.  You can get that other places for a buck.  And this was happy hour!   I can get way better sushi for a fraction of cost elsewhere.  No thanks, Osaka.

Osaka's used to be really good.  My last two trips were disappointing because the sushi rice tasted odd.  My previous trips to Osaka's were great.  The spicy scallop hand rolls were fantastic.  The price is a little steep, to say the least.  The service is great if they're not busy.
My hubby and I come in all the time for their late night menu. YUM and great prices! One of our favorite sushi spots! Thank you!

Came in for a birthday at the teppanyaki grill area with a group of 6. Great cook with a great show. Had the fish and veggies entree. Honestly never had a better fish and veggies dinner. Thank you!! Loved it!!

I held high expectations of this place due the the praise it had been given by multiple reviewers. But I was throughly disappointed. When I walked in and was lost I walked out one of the servers chased after me to not go out the door bc it would set off an alarm. Thus begins the terrible service from the wait staff. They told me to just walk in even though I had no clue where I was going and were pushy. When I got done and settle with my friends to eat they got my order wrong twice. When I did receive my sashimi I had been disappointed by the size portion and the taste of one of the tunas made my tongue roll over and die. If you are going to serve sashimi at least make it fresh. The waiters were extremely confused when bringing out our dishes and slightly unprofessional where I literally thought they were all high. When it came time for the check I was very angry they included gratuity because the food was mediocre and the service was terrible save for just one waiter. You are better off avoiding this place.

I was really excited to try this place after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins, ad Dives. We were promptly greeted and seated. The server was very polite and courteous. We ordered, I had the OG Special and my husband ordered chicken fried rice, we also had steamed gyoza. The gyoza was awesome, and the fried rice was really good. We like a little more egg in our fried rice than most so it was perfect for us. My roll was interesting. The rice is crispy like it was grilled or something, which I wasn't expecting because I didn't completely read the description. It was really good, you just have to get passed the square shape, heated, crispyness. As we were getting our food a large party showed up and they got all of the attention. We ran out of water and waited over 20 minutes for a server to bring us our check so we could leave. We would have asked sooner if we had seen them but they were lost in the back with the huge party. Very unfortunate for a place with such outstanding reviews.

This location is my favorite...yes its a older building but the tunami rooms are awesome :-) I love slipping off my shoes and slidding into the tunami booths. Something about the cozy intamate booth munching on good food while sipping on some plum wine....sigh* it just puts me in my happy place :-) and for you parents out their with toddlers...the tunami rooms are perfect for little ones (like mine) that do not like sitting still and being in high chairs :-D they are able to move more and stand while eating while keeping them nicely contained ;-) you can actually have a nice meal without chasing around your little cuteness!!

We came here to celebrate our son's birthday, since we always go to I love Sushi we thought it would be a nice change. Oh it was! Amazing!!   We started with a variety of sashimi, which came out super fast and was very fresh. Every piece was the perfect temperature and was tender.  Then we went on to rolls. One of my favorites there is the Roppongi roll. It's spicy tuna, shrimp, topped with tuna masago and yum yum sauce. We also had the bonsai, Tokyo express and 3 others. Two kids opted for the tonkatsu and curried rice. I don't like curry but there's was REALLY good.  Highly recommended, we've been there before, but this was our first time not doing hibachi/teppanyaki. We will be back.

Ohhh I got the regular badge from here :-) That excited me.  This place is really good. I'm a sushi aficionado. I try to visit as many high rated local places in town. Frankly Osaka is REALLY far from my house but it's close to my surgeon's office. So where did we go for lunch after my two post op appointments?    ... You got it!  They give you the option of Teppanyaki, Sushi bar or the traditional Japanese seating on the floor with big fun fluffy pillows!  I love their lunch menu. They offer low priced high quality half rolls. We ordered a bunch!   007 Roll - $8.95 Shrimp tempura roll topped with spicy tuna  Citrus Lemon Salmon - $6.50 Salmon with lemon and salt  We ordered a few more with unusual names but they were all amazing and fresh. They also have an amazing Saki selection:  Nagasaki Mandarin Infused - $22.00/btl Ginjo Ty Ku - $13.00/gl, $48/btl Tozai "Living Jewel" Unfiltered - $15.00/btl Daiginjo Ultra Premium Horim - $26.00/btl Daiginjo Ultra Premium Hakatsuru - $12.00/gl, $46.00/btl Otokoyama Junmai - $11.00/gl, $20.00/btl Momokawa Genshu "G-Joy" - $18.00/btl Nigori Murai - $12.00/gl, $46.00/btl Nigori Tozai - $15.00/btl   We will be returning!

Really like the decor and seating arrangements, you feel like in a private upscale restaurant. The sushi rolls are quite good, however the small dishes such as teriyaki/udon/etc are overpriced and not impressive.  Good for late night sushi and drinking session but who wants to drive so far from the strip?

I ordered chicken katsu and the chicken was so thin. Price is bit overpriced. Salad was not really fresh. Overall quality was mediocre. I'm still giving 4 stars because the tempura they had was ridiculously good.

Went here with a big group of girls. First loved the traditional seating. We got a ton of rolls and the lychee sake. It was all very good!  Not a single roll I did not like. The fish was fresh and the variety on the menu was great.  For dessert, go with the classic -tempura fried ice cream.
The OhMyGod roll is the best. I've never had anything but terrifice service too!!  Hands down my fav sushi spot I've found so far.

Customer service was terrible! Showed up last night with a Groupon for the teppanyaki dinner for 2. The manager said they do not accept Groupons although I had just bought the offer an hour before for that exact location. He had very little explanation except for saying it would come out of his pay check. Disappointed that there was not any comp for their mistake. I will not be back because of this experience. Now I have to get a refund from groupon. What a waste of my time!

I took my wife and son out to this place for her birthday dinner. We had the Teppan grill. The chef was awesome and my 4 year old son had a blast! The chef was very entertaining and the food was delicious! It was a great value and a lot of food! We left happy and full. Thanks for making my wife happy on her birthday. She also had a great time!

I think it's very sad when the TV commercial says "food prepared by professional Japanese chefs" in the picture shows some white guy chef flipping some food to a Japanese family. Fortunately the food wasn't as awful as that stupid commercial. When we were there my chef couldn't even speak a word of Japanese. I think most Japanese chefs know a little bit of Japanese because of their family origin.

Loved it!!!!  Saw it on DDD and it was well worth the trip off the strip.  We had the Roppongi, Oh Kamisama, and White Tiger rolls.  We also had the Blue Fin Tuna, Skipjack, Thai Hamachi and Special Tai nigiri.  Everything was amazing and super fresh!  We will definitely be back!

The hibachi is solid minus the chicken in my opinion, the sushi is the star of the show here. My favorite roll of all time "Pocket aces" no cream cheese is at Osaka, and the nigiri is always top notch fresh. I'm a regular here

Osaka has been a long standing Japanese Restaurant in the valley...I can only say it was Ok for me.  It's been many years since my last visit to Osaka Japanese Bistro on Sahara, but on this windy night, I came here with my girl friend in preparation for her upcoming trip to Osaka, Japan, as she wanted to try Okonomi Yaki.    Also we ordered  - Tako Wasabi - Chirashi  - Tokujo Nigiri: 12 pcs of nigiri Chef's choice   My favorite was Tako Wasabi...fresh and crunchy. The Chirashi had so much rice in the bowl, but was also packed with fresh cuts of fish which we enjoyed...unlike the nigiri, that seemed to all be dry and bland.  Service was excellent...they never stop filling our cups with hot tea and water.    Unfortunately for Osaka Japanese Bistro, Vegas has so much competition for sushi lovers, and Osaka stands as just average for me.  -2017 review #30-

I was extremely disappointed. I did have my food delivered, so i guess I  missed out on the dining experience of the actual resteraunt which, from the photos, looks nice.    I ordered the soft shell crab, shrimp tempura, firecracker shrimp, korean kalbi short ribs, and fried tofu. In total my order cost over $70.00. For that price I expect deliciousness; what I got was buyer's remorse.   The food arrived cold. Disappointingly included in my order was one small box of white rice and three containers of what had to be miso soup (which i did not order) but NO teriyaki, ponzu, or any kind of dipping sauce. I ate my tempura dry. The korean short ribs were so incredibly chewy I spat them out. The fried tofu was soggy and bland with a few spring onions thrown in the box. The softshell crab was dry with no flavor. It came with a cream sauce that was extremely runny compared to similar sauces I've had. The only redeeming dish was the firecracker shrimp - it was seasoned well, the texture was great, and it had just enough spice to make it tasty with a kick.  Overall the food was bland, dry, sloppily packaged for delivery, and a huge let down. I would not recommend.

Mixed feelings about this place.  The building is kinda weird.  You walk in through he sushi bar room to get to the hostess station.  So, if you're sitting in the sushi bar room, which is small, everyone walks by you.  The room had adequate lighting but looked aged.  There is a breeze coming from the vents that would blow for a while and then stop and start and stop.   Appetizers we got gyoza, kalbi sticks, spring rolls.  We did not like any of the appetizers.  Kalbi didn't have any carmelization and lacked the flavor I expect.  Spring rolls where real small and didn't have much filling.  gyoza were small with a thin shell and appeared to be deep fried, so there were crispy all around.  We're used to them being fried on one side and steamed on one side.    We got a roll sampler that had spicy tuna, las vegas roll, cal roll and a shrimp tempura roll.  Rolls were meh, just okay.  Don't think I would order those again.    Then we ordered salmon, yellowtail, and smoked salmon nigiri along with a futomaki roll.  The nigiri was good.  The futomaki roll appeared to have been refrigerated.  Seaweed was a little hard and the rice was cold.    I think if we only got nigiri, this place could have been a 4 star, but with what we got, 2 stars is about all I can give

Eh ...  Okay, I'll start with the good:  The ambiance and service was great.  They have those low tables, where you take your shoes off and/or sit cross-legged.  Our server was very friendly and hospitable.  The so-so: The food was okay.  I had tempura vegetable Udon soup and a side of vegetable rolls.  The tempura vegetable was good.  The Udon soup and vegetable rolls were okay.  The BF had curry rice.  I tasted the curry, and it was good.  The BF said the chicken was pretty good.  His Sister had Soba noodles.  I'm not a big fan of these noodles, but it she appeared to enjoy it.  I also had a melon soda, which was really good!  It has a marble in the drink, which is entertaining for little kids.  The bad:  The price was a little steep for an average Japanese restaurant.  It came out to $30 a person.  The pitcher of beer also has a large cone in the middle of it so that you don't get as much beer as you think you're getting.  Helpful hint:  They have a point card for those frequent patrons.  Overall, I wouldn't object to going here again, but it's not my first choice.
Best green tea! Garlic tuna nigiri. Yellowtail w ponzu n jalapeño nigiri. Wild salmon. Best spicy tuna rolls. Asakusa roll is redic! Dessert great too!!!
I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant. The fish is fresh, delicious, and the service is excellent. For something different, try the Rock & roll - it's bliss.

just ate here tonight. this place sucked big time. everything was so soggy! first off the diet coke was flat and too much syrup. my friend ordered the caterpillar roll and the rice was so soggy. i ordered the cali roll and yuck....too much rice vinegar & crappy fake crab meat....the tempura i could not believe they served me what they did.... the tempura was not crispy at all, it was mushy, almost like it wasn't cooked all the way! the oyako donburi was aight but too much rice and not enough chicken! this place is outrageously over rated! will not go back. Brians Beach is da bes if you want fresh ass sushi!
Really good sushi, the chefs where really friendly and fast. Disappointed there was no all you can eat. But still had a great time.

5 stars because this place was wonderful! Our server was phenomenal and the food was better than Benihana's! The manager came by our table and was so friendly. He stopped and talked to us for a little bit before checking with other tables.  We will definitely be returning :)

Extraordinary sushi! We tried the 777, the Kamakaze, and the Oh Kamisama all featured on their late night menu. YUMMMMM! The service was also excellent. We ate at the sushi bar and had speedy and friendly service. So glad to have found this spot!
Would not visit again!!! The cook for our grill was very nice, but that did not make the rice taste any 'nicer'!
Saw this was on Diners, Dives, and Drives. I frequent Vegas quite a bit, so, had to make a stop here! It was really good! Will definitely make a return back!

Today was my birthday and my children decided to take me to the Osaka Japanese restaurant on Sahara. We sat down excited about the fun of celebrating, expecting an entertaining chef. Instead we had to endure watching a chef struggle through preparing our dinner. He was totally unsure of himself and acted very confused. He kept dropping the utensils then bending down to pick them up off the floor, proceeding to wipe  them off with a wet towel...then reusing them. He could only prepare one item at a time and it was so stressful to watch. His knife skills were a d- at best. Not to mention that he brought out two pieces of meat, with one looking fresh and the other looking brown and old.  My daughter asked him about the color of the meat and he said it was fine. Then he offered to cover it in teriyaki sauce to improve the bad smell and taste. My daughter had to excuse herself to the restroom because she felt nauseous knowing it would make her sick if she ate that steak. I then told the very nice waiter what was going on and he explained we were the first people he had prepared a meal for. I said that the chef told us he had been working there twelve years. He said, yes, that was true....but he was working there in other jobs like bussing tables. I could go on about this negative experience but must stop with this final thought...I just do not understand and it is beyond me how they could let an untrained incompetent person play chef at the expense of their unsuspecting customers. Very disappointed!
Really fresh sake. Great rolls. Nice option to get a half or a full roll. Delicious lychee sake. Fast service. Amazing!

This is the oldest sushi place that I know of in this town. They were  doing  sushi before it was cool. The original on Sahara brings fond memories of emami I didn't know existed before 1986. Now they have blossomed all over the valley  I haven't been disappointed at any of them. Thanks Osaka for Introducing me to Japanese cuisine.

Being from Hawaii I'm  familiar with good Japanese food. I had the shrimp tempura and chicken combo. It came with 4 large shrimp 2 carrots 1 zucchini and onion ring. Tempura batter was light and crispy. On par with the best tempura I've had. The teriyaki chicken came with a light tasting teriyaki sauce. Pleasant and not over powering. My wife had the pork tofu. The broth was excellent. It had a good portion of pork but lacked enough tofu. And the dish was over powered by an over abundance of onion. The price of the entrees was reasonable.

I came across this place because I was looking for all-you-can-eat in the Henderson area and ended up at this place near the The Anthem area.   Which is a very beautiful community, and very peaceful.  I called to make sure if they had all you can eat and the young lady on the phone said that they didn't have all you can eat on Sundays!  only on Mondays, Tuesday they have all you can eat. but she asked me how far I was which I was around the corner and she said she would do all you can eat for me since I've never been there. which I thought was very thoughtful.   When arriving there was no one there so we had the whole place to ourselves. the manager was very attentive with great hospitality and was very welcoming. She did amazing in service!   The manager mentioned that we had to try the popular roll which was " sexy number one special" ! And that was not part of the all-you-can-eat, but then again she accommodated us again for us to try and  experience. she made us feel special.   Definitely will return to this place. the food and experience was amazing!  very pleased.

We are regular customers of Osaka Japanese Bistro on Eastern in Henderson NV, we saw they has a special Groupon for Teppanyaki for four. We decided why not? It was FANTASTIC the food was excellent ,Sake was warm and delicious , Asahi (Japanese Beer for those who don't know) was cold and crisp. Our Teppan Chef was hilarious and attentive to every detail. He engaged my 13 yr old daughter in a witty banter and had her as his foil. She enjoyed the show and food tremendously. My husband and her salmon was cooked to perfection, our Japanese fried rice was light and extremely delicious. My rib eye was rare perfectly cooked and expertly seasoned. We had sushi and sashimi for appetizers all were excellent and fresh. Definately an experience we will seek to duplicate in the future! I highly recommend Osaka, the staff are well versed and polite and the food is divine. Live Jazz on Thursday also!!

This place is super cool considering it's in Vegas.  Japanese style tables, a sushi bar, and some pretty shockingly good food that's reasonably priced for it's proximity to the strip.  Don't expect anyone to know where this is if you're taking a cab.  Bring an address and have mapped it out first.  I thought that it was an abandoned building from the outside, but after entering through the air conditioning airlock, it was business as usual on the inside.  This may be my second favorite secret japanese place for when I'm in town.

I love the tappenyaki dinners there. The sushi is always fresh alittle expensive but worth the quality.  Definitely a recommend go to place.  I am happy to know they are using group on know to help make it alittle more affordable.
Excellent Sushi. Like that you can get 1/2 rolls or full rolls. For 2 of us the bill cam to over $90.00 this included 1 small sake & a beer plus green tea tempura ice cream.

AR is one of the best servers.  He remembered my husband from a year later. He even changed the tv so that we could watch the Raider game. I hope that he will be there is March 2016. The next time I will be there.

Customer service here is great. A couple of weeks ago I brought in a friend who knew nothing about sushi. He ordered a few rolls including the salmon roll and when it was brought out he said I can't eat this because it is raw. I then told him that the fish in sushi is raw unless specified otherwise. The waiter came around and could tell he hadn't touched it and asked if something was wrong. He said yeah I just really didn't know it was raw and the waiter laughed and said no problem I will take it off the bill. First off it was my friends fault and I am not used to Asian people who work at restaurants having good customer service.  My usual order here is the miso cod and the cucumber salad with crab. Both dishes are executed well. The miso cod is both tender and flakey and the crab salad has a refreshing flavor that pairs well with the miso cod.

My girlfriend and I ate here for dinner last night and it was nothing short of amazing.   We had a reservation for 8 but, with traffic on the east side, we made it around 8:15 and they still sat us right away around the Teppan bar. The young man got us our drinks speedy quick but still gave us time to look at the menu.   I got the Chicken and NY with the Calamari Steak appetizer and a 911(spicy, spicy tuna) roll and half a California. While my girlfriend got the Chicken and Shrimp and Calamari Steak as well. It was about 3 minutes from when he left our table that we had already gotten our soup and salad, delicious.   When our chef came out, he seemed quiet at first but then really started interacting with my girlfriend and I as the night progressed. I won't get too much into his routine because I feel like that's something special everyone should see but it was very cool.   My steak and chicken were perfectly cooked along with the friend rice and the Calamari Steak, tasted very authentic. The Sushi was delicious, not too crazy but not too plain, I loved every bite.   Our tab came out to 112.28 after our $20 tip, not bad considering how much food we got and the amazing service. Came here for our birthday dinner and was fulfilled in every single way. We will come here again with an empty stomach and a big smile :)

First Time there and what made us go was the GroupOn Special.. but needless To Say we had The Best Service There and the Staff was Awsome!!Big Thank You To Sonny and our waitress and The Manager was great
My friends and I go here all the time, sushi is awesome. Everyone is super friendly. And the desserts are the bomb!
We go here often for tepan. The food is good and good service. The quality of the meat is good too. Not has sushi here but I want to try one day
Great local place. It's been in Vegas for years. Be sure to ask for Ryan on the grill.

My companion raved about this restaurant for quite some time.  She raved about the quality of the food and service.  I decided to try this joint and not upset her.  For a eating establishment I should write about the food but I couldn't.  Once we were seated I noticed a strong smell of urine at our table.  I discovered the smell came from the seat cushion I was sitting on.  After I moved the cushion away the offending smell still linger in my nostrils.  My companion beg me not to make an issue out of it. I complied. I recalled ordering my food but I couldn't tell if it tasted good or bad.  I lost my appetite. I can't believe the cleaning staff didn't noticed it.  I know I won't go back to this joint and my companion will have to bear with my objection for a second visit.

This place is filthy. We are sitting in the back at a booth and the space next to the wall is an inch thick in dirt. The place in general in unkempt.  The food was fair but 4 rolls and they all tasted the same.

Warning: this review might be a little partial since I just has the regular Japanese food and didn't eat sushi.  So we got here at around 7pm on a Sunday and was expecting someone to greet and sit us. We probably waited for about 5 minutes before someone came out and brought us to our table. There wasn't much customers that time too. Probably 1/4 of the tables or not even were occupied.    So we ordered asparagus wrapped in beef and another one that I totally forgot. The appetizers were okay but something that we may never order again (hopefully we remember not to order it again). I had the sukiyaki for my main entree and my bf had a curry over rice. They were both delicious and flavorful.   Maybe we will go back to Osaka to try their sushi dishes next time.

This is our go-to spot for good, local inexpensive sushi and ramen.  Can't go wrong coming here.  We always get at least a lasagna roll and spicy tuna roll when we come for lunch.  The shoyu ramen has a nice clean broth and they bring you the togarashi without even asking for it.  Good stuff.

Stopped here on a whim, and was very pleased. We sat at the bar, and didn't even know how big the restaurant was. Great service and food- and let me just say- there is nothing wrong about the "something wrong" dish!! YUM!

Another must-eat during our Vegas culinary adventures.  Almost always accommodating (no wait) for this quiet haven of quality food!!  The soft shell crab appetizers are a winner and almost anything else will not disappoint!!

I have been to a lot of places and this one may be on my list of faves. The staff were quick, efficient and kind. The food was amazing as was our chef (I wish I could remember his name). The only reason that I am not giving them 5 stars is because we ordered 2 slices of cheesecake at $7.95 per slice and they were THE SMALLEST pieces of cheesecake I've ever received. We spent $150 on 2 dinners, no alcohol and dessert, including tip... it was a bummer that it had to end with disappointment. I do, however, look forward to my next visit.

I always past by this place on Sahara so I decided to finally try it, been there forever so it must be good. Thankfully it was, if there was a standard for authenticity it would be this place. Felt like I was actually in Japan! I ordered the tiger roll and the sassy roll. The fish is fresh which is the reason why the rolls are so expensive. They do not have AYCE but the rolls are decent. If you are in the mid for AYCE this is not the place you want to go.   Their service is great! The ambiance is amazing also, the tables are set like traditional Japanese tables where you sit on your knees and eat. Now if that's not your thing the table are dug in underneath so you can sit like you are at a normal table. All in all a defined must come/go. Food is good and the service is great!
I love everything about this place, such as sushi, combination plate, and love the plum wine.  Great customer service and good food
2 words, JAPANESE LASAGNA!!!!!!! BEST IN TOWN!!!! i love this place, i love the seating and customer service! the sushi has never been bad here and ive always been in a great full mood when we leave.

This place is so delicious! I am a regular & most of the time they all ready know my order, their spicy edamame is to die for. Their service is also great. I enjoy this place a lot, highly recommend it.

Honestly a pretty average Japanese restaurant. Vegas has some great chocked when it comes to this cuisine, some offering outstanding quality while others with great deals and Happy Hours. We came after 10pm to take advantage of the late night menu here, but it was still pretty expensive for rolls. They came out extremely fast however, as if it was cooked in a race. Honestly it was too fast, like we ordered two rolls and less than 5 minutes later we were bested by them. And then our appetizer took a good 20 minutes. So their timing needs to be worked on. They also had hit sake for $5 for late night, but no cold sake which is always very interesting to me. All in all, the sushi was ok, the service was slow to take our order but extremely fast to produce (at least the sushi), and the venue was nicer inside than the area appears. But I would try another great Vegas sushi place instead unless this is simply next on your list.

I can't believe some of the reviews here. "Not a place to catch up with friends" ? No, really ? "I usually eat AYCE crap sushi, I can't believe this place is not what my refined palate expected". "I expected a great deal and was shocked at the bill because I don't know how to read a menu". "I expected super fancy sushi from my BENTO BOX !".  Granted, if the place is packed, service can be somewhat slow when you sit a a table (hint: sit at the sushi bar). I have been here many, many times, and have yet to find fault with the quality of product they put out. The layered flavors of the different rolls are better than any other place I've tried in Vegas, and I tried lots.   Try the White Tiger roll, Tokyo Express, Roppongi or Treasure Island, and check the specials board or ask the sushi chef for recommendations.

Fish is not fresh. Best way to find out: try a salmon nigiri... You can tell by the aftertaste. Tastes like freezer burn. The rolls are mediocre.. With really gross sauces on them. The fish is sloppily cut.. Will not go back here, ever again. Osaka's quality has diminished throughout the years. Maybe it's just this location, who knows. The one I used to frequent was the Sahara location. Decided to try again but this location since its closer to my home. Bad move on my part. I wish I would have ordered from Kaizen, or I Love Sushi instead. Blah, Osaka. What a let down.

I'm shocked by the negative reviews... I've been going to this restaurant for over 2 years and I have never had a bad experience. The sushi is always fresh, the service is great and I love the traditional seating. I will agree that the look from the outside and when first entering is a lil sketchy but it also gives it a lil character. This is the go-to spot for a midweek treat. I highly recommend the Omg roll. I crave it monthly.

Came in expecting a 4 star sushi joint ... Coming from the California coast maybe my expectations were too high but ... Cali crunch roll was similar to the sushi at albertsons  which I won't eat ... Veggie tempura so soaked in grease ... Miso soup lacked favor , watery and plain ... Apologized after one bite and maybe half a cup of soup that I can't eat any of this ... And was told to pay for both the tempura and soup ... Highly disappointed and a lesson learned . Blows my mind this place is in business .

This was our first visit to the HENDERSON LOCATION. So, the other location in Summerlin may be better.   My wife and I ate here as members of a birthday celebration. When the reservations were for 6 people, and 7 showed up, they treated it as if it was a great inconvenience. Prior to being seated for dinner, we had to wait quite a while to get drinks. And even then they were out of a few beers. The waitress was not a bartender by any means. She was confused about the ingredients of basic cocktails.   The manager, who sits at the front door was in no way accommodating or friendly. We did not feel welcomed or comfortable upon our arrival. Perhaps it was the additional member of our party that upset him. We felt as if we were an inconvenience.   That being said, the food was good. We had the combination dinner with steak and seafood. The preparation and presentation were really nice. Our chef was humorous and entertaining. The food was hot and flavorful. The sauces were outstanding.  So, we were happy with the food and unhappy with the hospitality. That being said, we will try it again and hope we our experience will be better. Worth giving it a try!

I love this place! I've been twice. They have an extensive menu.. tons of rolls... lots of specials (I always opt for their sashimi). Everything is fresh. They have great fresh wasabi too. The prices are so much better than most places in town and they're attentive and super nice. They also offer a cucumber wrapped Rock & Roll roll- if you're watching carbs.

A fun & funky place to bring friends and family!! Every time I step into this restaurant it makes me smile to be seated either on the floor or in one of the sunken booths. There's a great atmosphere shared by all.   I was with some sushi newbies, so we didn't venture out too far meal wise on this visit- although they offer quite the creative mix of rolls. I can't wait to try their Treasure Island - complete with capers and sliced onions and the El Pollo Loco, with chicken, asparagus and Japanese salsa! Say What?! That is my kind of loco!   For this occasion, we ordered: *Spicy tuna - a solid basic *Ribeye wrapped around asparagus - meat was on the tough side, with a flavorful sauce and succulent asparagus. Just an okay dish. *Chicken nuggets - the kiddo and big kiddos chowed down on these little nuggets  *Fresh White roll - My favorite roll of the night! Fresh, juicy albacore with hamachi, shaved radish, cucumber and wrapped in soy pap. It was delicate yet hearty. *Kai's Special roll - had some kick. *Lisa Lisa roll - this was kind of a standard, and our table's favorite. How can one go wrong with shrimp tempura done right?  Service has always been wonderful here, I can't think of one occasion where we didn't receive a greeting, smiles, a quick seat, explanations to questions, help ordering for anyone at the table, quick refills, sake flowing; it's all good. In addition to their funky rolls, they offer Special Boats that are quite a feast to the eyes. If you are looking to make an impression on someone, I'd say that's a sure bet. Then there is the Shabu Shabu, Sukiyaki or Yosenabe to try for yet more adventurous options. Life is good here; Adventure on!!

This is the oldest Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas.  We came here at the recommendation of DDD.  Not a disappointment at all.  You take off your shoes to sit down...we loved it.  On weekends they are open until 2 am and have a late night menu that is very good and reasonable.  Sushi rolls, tempura shrimp and vegetables, teriyaki chicken all good.  If you have a large group I would recommend reservations.  Be sure to ask for Rudy.  He is the bomb!!  This is a place all must try.
The OMG roll was just that! And the Kamisama roll was great yummo!! Also, the service was professional and courteous. Definitely recommend this one to all foodies and kid-friendly too!

Went to Osaka tonight for something lighter after a heavy lunch. Chose it as part of a DDD food adventure while in Vegas. Outside is nothing much to look at but inside is quite authentic and the staff, especially Jared, were fantastic. Thought the prices were very reasonable.   Went with a couple of standards as a baseline and a few of Jared's recommendations. Everything was very good but the special cucumber salad, spicy garlic edamame and roppongi roll were top of the list. Delicious. Wish we had more time so we could go back. Might have to skip something else so we can. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

I come here every time I'm in town. It used to be one of the best Sushi places period. Always loved this place and recommended it to friends whenever someone was visiting. Yesterday I went, and for the first time was disappoint. The rolls just aren't as good as they used to be. Way too much rice and not enough fish. Plus the individual pieces were almost falling apart. I'm also not a fan of the fact that out of the four sushi chefs only one is actually Japanese.  What a shame.

This place was decent.  I came here for the first time tonight, I ordered the following: Hot green tea 1/2 911 roll  O.G roll Spicy edamame  Miso soup.  911 roll wasn't spicy like I was hoping but still pretty good, and the OG roll had good flavors but I think mine was burnt because it was tough to chew.  The spicy edamame was undercooked and weird. Couldn't finish it. Miso soup was good, and my green tea never stayed empty for long. I'll come back for non sushi items next time because the sushi is over priced for the quality you're getting. Love the tatami mat sections. The carpet is old and needs to be replaced and the bathroom was pretty much out of soap.  The service was great but the rest was mediocre. I'll try it again though because I want to like it.

Hands down, the absolute BEST Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas! The best sushi I ever had! You can't beat this place. This is what all Japanese restaurants should be measured against. I love this place and can't wait for my next trip to Vegas to go here!

I ordered a take out of about 4 sushis rolls and they were all delicious ! I had the Crunchy Tako, The White Tiger, The Virgin and the Pollo Loco. The customer service was also delightful, the servers kept on offering me water while waiting for my order. Very nice place !

I love Osaka for the fact that they bring in fish and food that is not available at popular places across the street: ankimo, amberjack, aji.. And they're true to tradition. The set up is separated into several different eating styles but we always just eat at the sushi bar.   They serve half rolls!  They've got quite a lot of items on the menu and always have a special They have a punch card that gives you back 5% on the card for further use. We've had dinner in just that card several times.

Hamachi Sashimi - Perfect. Tender. Fresh.  Uni Sushi - Very fresh. Not too slimy. Melts in your mouth.  Asakusa Rolls - Spicy tina topped with albacore and scallions, tataki sauce on top - The spice level was good but it was missing that extra kick. The tuna was good..The roll just didn't have anything that stood out.  Osaka Rice - mixture of sushi rice, crab, masago, mayo, sesame oil, and sriracha - Sooooo much yumminess. It's like a comfort food more than anything else. Def try this.  I think it's best to stick with with the fresh sashimi and get some osaka rice to have a good meal.
Came back and tried the king and Queen steak and lobster it was yummy my favorite so far outside of Benihana even better in my opinion because I prefer cute smaller restaurants with good food ;)

I went into Osaka last night for some late night sushi with my friends. The entrance is kinda creepy, but whatever haha. We were asked if we wanted to sit at the sushi bar or in a japanese room. We chose the room. It was cool because the room is really big and you get cushions to sit on, and you take your shoes off.  That's about the most exciting thing I can say for this place. The service was just alright. There were like 8 people in the whole restaurant and it took them almost an hour to bring 3 sushi rolls. They barely came by to see how we were doing, just seemed like they wanted us to leave.   The rolls were also kind of pricey, even being half off. They were alright, though. The fried banana was really good. I wouldn't come back to this place.

This place has a true japanese feel to it. It is a small, almost divey, place. There is a room for table seating, a room for sitting with the chef as he prepares your meals and a room for good ole Japanese style seating. You remove your shoes and you sit on a pad and down low. We sat here. It was awesome. The initial server that serves you water and drinks and busses your table was a mid-aged white man who spoke very well (very educated) and it was a dismal reality check as to the stake of our economy that this professional has been reduced to busser work. Not that we don't love or need our bussers, they definitely keep the restaurant in order. I couldn't refuse the sushi. I ordered a half roll of the Asakusa (Spicy Tuna Roll topped with Albacore & Scallions) which was close to orgasmic. I ordered a standard yellowtail roll and then I checked out the rest of the entrees and found a Curry Tempura (which does not seem to be on their online menu). It was FANtastic!! Needless to say I left with happy taste buds and a loaded stomach. If I go back to Vegas I will most certainly be visiting here again.

I had a groupon here and i took one of my buddies.  Even though i had the groupon the service was unbelievable.  sometimes when I go out with a groupon, i tend to get unhappy faces with the staff, but at Osaka, the servers were awesome, they were helpful throughout the night, and the food was fantastic.  I am glad to get the groupon because now i know there is a gem of a place nearby my house, I cant wait to go back.

My Favorite sushi place!!! I LOVE these Guy's!!! Andy & Oscar are my favorite sushi bar chefs  I am so addicted I come at least once a week during lunch!!! My favorite is the OH KAMISAMA!! They have lunch specials too! Mmmmm forever a fan!  Updated to add: the whole staff here is great!!

Osaka offers three ways to dine- the sushi bar, the main dining room, and the tatami room. We went to the Sahara Location.  We had the dragon roll and few other which I don't remember the name. I thought the price was high but the sushi was melt in your mouth good. I noticed they had a special free lobster teppan dinner for your birthday with purchase of 5 teppan dinner. Definitely want to try that out.
1st time here and I must say the Food and Service was GREAT!!!! MO-MO is the best she took care of us.We will be back..

Great food and great service. What can you say. We had awesome Sashimi and sushi and they were amazing. It was to awesome ! Good size portions and good Saki too.  Hence the 5 stars VS - 5. PS: No hot towels and no edamame and no orange with plum wine like the good old days gift. Enjoy !

Wow. Seriously? Why is this not at my house? We have excellent Japanese in CA but... Not like this.  So much variety on the menu. If you know Japanese food and ingredients, you will absolutely love this place. The appetizers we enjoyed were a full Roppongi roll and an okonomi yaki. Yes. They offer happy delicious comfort pancake happiness.   The main dish for lunch was a 777 roll, a chicken bowl and a Churashi bowl that's to. Die. For.  I am not a Vegas fan. I am an Osaka fan. I need an airplane. Stat.

We've eaten here several times since my last post and everything has been really good. When we've eaten with the live chef, he's always been extra attentive to our 3yo son. The food is still a little expensive and I've stopped asking for brown rice because they charge so much for it. Otherwise, the food it good and the take out is prepared quickly and the location is convenient for us.

This place is extremely cute! It was our first time there and we were seated at a "booth." It's the kind of place where you take off your shoes and eat. It made me feel like I was at a real restaurant in Japan. They're opened until 2 AM so my boyfriend and I came for their happy hour. They have a huge selection and we ordered a few rolls. Just FYI the happy hour rolls are smaller than their regular rolls. It was tasty and the food was fresh.

Got suckered by DDD and gave this place a try...  Featured as the very first sushi place in LV..   I should've known better than to expect fresh sushi in a desert or trust Guy's pitch for Sushi on a show featuring Dives.. Buffet quality fish both cooked/raw Rice to fish ratio sucked.. Same on rolls.. Gave it one more star as I know Its hard to please LA pallets on asian food out of state.

Another nightmare of a restaurant, perfect for those that think that a California Roll (poorly made) is the height of Japanese cuisine.  Rumor is that Yukio Mishima ate here before deciding to kill himself.  1. Ambience: When you first walk in, you think "hey, instead of the pretentious bs overpriced Vegas Hotel Japanese restaurant scene, I may have found one of those amazing hole-in-the-wall spots that will be a great authentic experience"...well, the hole-in-the-wall is right, and in this case, it is just that.   The restaurant is old, dilapidated, and damn confusing to escape from. But if you check it out thoroughly, you can almost smell (um and smell other things to) that this was once a great, great place. It looks like the shell of a restaurant taken over by someone's kid or run by an owner who no longer cares whether he has a customer or not. Perhaps his dog died and he's depressed. Perhaps the dog is one of the menu items.   In fact, when we were there, there were about 4 people in a space that could seat at least 100 or more I would think.  Then there are the prostitutes and what not that like to stop by for their pick up orders. Not the restaurant's fault but certainly, this is an inviting atmosphere for them. Funny part is that they got better service then we did.  2. Service: haahaha! What? What's service? Um. Not on the menu.  Yah, so we sat in front of the most disinterested Japanese sushi chef I have ever experienced outside of wacko Nozawa in LA. But Nozawa is at least an actor. This momo was for real. Rude attitude. Totally didn't give a shit that we were the only customers at the bar, or basically in the restaurant. He was busy in his own world. And then of course, there is the attitude driven little Yakuza wanabee waitress who looks like she needs to focus more on the Hello Kitty art on her nails, then bother with a customer.  When we asked in advance if a certain item was cooked a certain way, and were given incorrect information, they still hesitated, and gave us attitude about taking it back! I mean, we asked in advance! But its our fault that they deep fry what in any normal restaurant is grilled. Oh I speak of YAKITORI. Yes. They deep fry it here so that it has a wonderful brick like consistency. Yum. I guess they didn't read the definition of yakitori, like the part about the "grilling" aspect.  Oh, and when we said our "itadakimasu" and upon any "thank you" to the chef...pin drop...no response. Oh man, he looked annoyed and pissed the entire excruciating meal! Wanted to get my tanto blade from the car and go Watari Tetsuya on his ass but I was more in a Totoro mood. Or maybe Golgo 13. Yes I speak Otaku.  On top of that, no one comes by to see if we need anything. Have to call out for the waitress for water, a plate, a gun, whatever.  3. Food.  This is simple. Gross. Lousy quality fish. Even the salmon was 12th grade. And that is cheap fish to do right. And don't think you can escape into Rolls and Handrolls. You can't. Because they are as bad as everything else. Drenched in sauce to make up for the disgusting taste.  All together...125 dollars and no "thank you" from the retards that run this place. Not impressed is an understatement.   I challenge you to try OSAKA and experience the disaster that spots like Nobu made possible. So now you have two choices in Vegas. Authentic -Fake Disgusting Overpriced and Authentic-Fake OK Overpriced. Either way, there is no Japanese food other than Ichiza and Raku in Vegas. Actually, there is no Japanese food in Vegas. Cause those two options are like McDonalds in Tokyo.   Instead, find a hot Japanese girl or guy, get your Tanto blade, and threaten them to make you a proper dinner. Make sure to check your salmon for parasites, and in the case of Osaka, the chef as well.  P.S. I feel like I may have gone a little over-board in this review and so I apologize to anyone who's feelings I may have hurt, like the a-hole chef who stole 125 dollars out from our wallets and in return gave us horrible service and food.

This place is one of my favorite restaurants! The food is good (decent selection from r Vegan/Vegetarian considering it's a sushi place)  & it's a great location. My favorite thing about this place is definitely the customer service!! My fiancé & I come here all the time, and we have never once had a bad experience!
The Sushi was delicious and the chefs were fun to talk to. We get there at 1am and were not rushed to leave at 2.
Came in a couple nights ago at like 1am which was great, some of the best sushi ive had in along time. Thanks!

I'm pretty sure that the people who gave this place five stars are related to the owners and therefore get better portions and deals. While I can't say the food was bad it was a complete rip off...I paid 100 for two king and queen plates (celebratory dinner for my bfs bday) the plates consist of a lobster tail and filet mignon with grilled veggies.   The lobster was probably considered a midget given the tail size and the lobster meat had been removed and cut up and replaced in the tail where I'm sure we got smaller portions than what was initially in the tail. I mean the amount of lobster was so little I'm pretty sure they took one lobster tail cut it up cooked up and grabbed an empty tail to split it up in two portions.   Similarly when ordering they ask how you want your filet mignon cooked however it is a useless question because they cut it up in little pieces!!! I don't know about you but I don't need help cutting up my meat I'm not a five year old, needless to say the small chunks were all very well done and again it was a very small portion.   You would think that at the very least they wouldn't skimp on the mixed veggies since its not a high cost item but they must be on a small budget because it was not substantial. I guess they get bargain prices on rice because we got a ton of that even though neither of us eat rice.   The food didnt taste bad though and they had nice sauces to dip your minitature meat portions into. At the end we were both left hungry and ended up getting capriottis later that night (bomb sub place that I definitely recommend) and was left feeling robbed especially after getting a better tasting and filling meal for like a quarter of the price.   Definitely not a good place to go unless your super rich and therefore don't mind getting ripped off. That's what I get for trying to avoid the fancy restaurants on the strip to get a good deal.

Osaka is the place to check for sure in while in Vegas!! We had our wedding meet & greet family dinner here and boy was it one amazing experience we will never forget! The food & the customer service was unbelievably AMAZING!!! Manager David & staff treated us like family! We will definitely visit here every time we come!

Been coming here for many years....  Our family prefers TEPPANYAKI and there are many varieties -combinations to choose from. Quick service and very clean. Quality is good, my husband always orders sushi too and he's never complained. Do recommend it for family gatherings with children, as the chef always "performs" while cooking and it is entertaining as well.

One of my favorites places for sushi! It's definitely a dive and it's been there forever but the service and quality is top notch.  My favorite rolls are the Pocket Aces and the Fresh White, but any of the others are great too. The place has recently been seen some minor remodeling such as the carpet and walls of the sushi bar. Size of rolls isn't always consistent, just depends on sushi chef.
Loved it,small intimate, food very good, desert nummy!
Always fresh food. Seafood salad is great and must try their scallop dishes!  Another place I go every time I'm in Vegas!

It seems a bit harsh to only give osaka two stars but i have to rate it like i tasted it. It was my first visit to osaka having typically only dined at ayce sushi restaurants. I had high hopes considering all of the great reviews i had read. I have to say I was extremely dissappointed! Not only was the sushi just so-so, I ended up spending way more money than I would have at any of the ayce places i frequent.   I would have been okay spending the 36 bucks for two rolls and a hand roll if the rolls themselves were delicious. But that was not the case.  My friend ordered the oh my god roll which was decent. As a whole the meal was not up to par. For those people that believe you get better quality from the restaurants that don't have ayce, think again. This place is a perfect example of the opposite.  I'll stick with places like Oyshi and sushi mon.   Clearly more money doesn't always equal better quality.

I normally stop by Osaka on my way home from work to get soup and a small appetizer but I happened to be off for the evening. I placed my order for pick up and as I pulled into the lot a lady was sitting on the curb approached me.   She was someone who probably doesn't get a meal as frequently as most and quietly asked me if I could give her my leftovers after dinner and didn't want any money.   I went into the restaurant to get my soup and half of a sushi roll and asked the server if I could leave money for the lady outside so she could pick her meal and actually be able to sit down and eat it. A bald man who was another server chimed in and was like no you can't do that, she'll bother other customers, that's what they usually do. It's better if you get her something to go.   I will not be returning to Osaka. That man had no humanity or compassion in him. If that's the type of people that work there, my business is not needed. A real sit down meal was all I wanted to provide for someone. Whoever that server was should be ashamed. If you can't help humankind there is no hope.
This is one of those places that only the locals know about. Best quality Sushi in town!!

The sushi chef was great but he was SUPER busy clearly preparing a huge platter and we had a hard time getting his attention to serve us. The sushi was awesome. But we wanted other items from the menu and had to tell the sushi chef because the waitress NEVER came back. Even after she delivered my husband's dish, she NEVER returned :( For as good of reviews as this place has, we expected better service or even a little bit of service. The entrance is also confusing. Which way do you go in? There needs to be some signage in the weird hallway that you enter. I'd try some where else next time we're here.

I'm not a huge sushi fan but I'd definitely come back here. All the food was extremely fresh and tasty. The prices were a little steep but what good sushi place doesn't charge a little more? We had the Oh My God roll, Roppongi roll, 911 roll, Lychee Sake, Miso Soup, and Unagi. All were great except the unagi in my opinion but I'm not a fan. Everyone else most definitely enjoyed it.  The service was good. Nothing out of this world but our server came back and checked on us a few times throughout the meal and did her job.   Overall, I'd really give Osaka a 3.5 because of the prices and mediocre service.

This place is awesome! Kinda pricey but its really really good. They do not have ayce(all you can eat.) its per order, the quality of the food is Amazing. The staff is very friendly and helpful on selecting food. I would definitely recommend this place if you love sushi!.

I ordered for delivery from EAT24 and let me tell you what a big disappointment! First of all the 8.99$ charge, come on you guys i live only 2miles away.. Second of all food arrived 1 hour and 45 min after i placed the order (i live only 2 miles away from the restaurant). Third of all but not last, i guess delivery driver never checked my order cause on top of that i had missing items.. I would not recommend this restaurant to non of my friends or the delivery service that is taking their orders... slow, incorrect, bad experience!!

While the sushi in this spot doesn't hold a candle to I Love Sushi or Sushi Fever, the service and half rolls make up for it overall. I consistently have a great service experience here and have never had to wait for a table. Plus, there is very little bullsh$t at the sushi bar which is sometimes appreciated on a "school" night. The Hibachi is another story altogether, it is a tasty affair and the shrimp dish is some of the best I've ever had! Most certainly worth a visit!

This is the best sushi restaurant in town. We had the omakase (chef's choice) and had his specialties. The sashimi here is really fresh and tasty. The prices overall on the  menu was very reasonable. The cost on the omakase is really up to you. We told him $80/person and we had over 10 dishes. (2 of which had toro) You can always set this lower and order more later if you're still hungry.   They do have coupons available. Check online or in the local advertisements.

Sushi and Tapan. We began with Sushi Rolls. All fresh and very tasty. Next was the Tapan table. Great chef. Did the usual show with the flying spatulas and the famous Egg Roll. The food was delicious and the service was excellent as well. As soon as someone's drink was nearly empty, our servers were all over it. This is a do over next time I'm in Vegas

Awesome experience, awesome service, awesome food! My best friend came in from Dallas and we both love Benihana's of Japan and decided to give Osaka's a try. Oh my gosh it was more than we were expecting and much more food than we are used to. Let's just say we had Osaka's for lunch at home the next day. I can't wait to go back.

Definitely an experience. Not totally impressed by wait staff but the selection is why we were there. Good for a first date. Quiet and relaxing. I'd come back anytime. It doesn't compare to my favorite sushi spot but I won't hate.
Huge variety. Rolls were delish. Loved having the option of a half roll. Was able to get multiple rolls. Get the spicy garlic edemome- amazing!

This place is awesome! Extremely good service. Awesome happy hour prices. Most sushi rolls are 4-9 dollars for 12-2. This place might have gotten me hooked on sushi and I dont think I want to settle for anything less. Only reason Im giving 4 stars is because I ordered some weird sushi. Nothing against the restaurant. I just didnt know what I was ordering. Some of the sushi is served hot and I did not know that from just looking at the menu. Other than that this place is awesome. ALSO! I did not try dessert here but they have tempura ice cream and fried oreos and cheesecake here!!!

This restaurant is great for  food. It's absolutely delicious. The teriyaki chicken and the shrimp lovers combination. The flavors and the presentation is great. Mireya service was outstanding and from everyone else too ruby etc. Great place to eat and enjoy
This Osaka has some of the freshest sashimi in town. I had the Toro last night and it melted in my mouth. The service was great as well. This is one of my go to sushi spots whenever I'm in town.

Usually eat at the Osaka on W Sahara, but I love the idea of live music. Most Sushi places are into crazy Japanese dance music or some rap/R&B. Osaka plays jazz, it is such a cool chilled vibe. I want to linger and drink. Other sushi places make me feel like I need to be grinding up against the sushi chef and slip dollar bills in the hostesses bra. One bit of disclosure, the murals of the jazz artists, on the wall, were done by a friend of mine. Must visit. AYCE? No. Fresh fish? Yes!

We took a table in the Tatami Room. I would highly recommend sitting there instead of at a regular table. Where do I begin?? The menu is a notebook of options! Take your time here and don't be in a rush so you can savor the flavors. Check out the pictures and they will speak volumes!   There is a picture of a bowl of fish. There was a plethora of fish...from mackerel to tuna to salmon to shrimp. There were so many varieties. You can share this meal.   They make all of their own sauces. The eel sauce is amazing! And do not pass up dessert...ask for their Fried Tempura Oreo! We won't need to eat for weeks!  So far...this is the best place we've eaten in Vegas!

Just as mentioned by other yelpers the layout is really weird.. Upon entering it's a immediately hallway directing you to go right, you would think once you enter the actual "restaurant" it would be one big open space, but you walk into another room where I think the sushi bar was and a few other tables. The rest of the restaurant is divided into rooms.. We had visitors from Canada with us and I almost felt embarrassed we took them to a odd restaurant such as this in a sketchyarea. We came on a Saturday afternoon as a party of 9. The major plus is that they offer their lunch specials 7 days a week, which is good considering other restaurants only offer deals on the weekdays. I ordered the bento "b" with chicken katsu as my main entree ($10). In addition, I ordered a tiger roll, made up of 4 pieces for $8. The bento included miso soup, gyoza, tempura, a tossed salad, and 2 pieces of CA roll. Everything was pretty standard, except the CA roll seemed a little heavy on the rice and less on the crab meat. I enjoyed the tiger roll and have nothing to complain about it. The piece used for the chicken was rather thin, but still a good size. And the tempura, was good because the batter was light and not overly greasy. The service was good for the most part as they refilled our waters regularly and were attentive to us. Nothing really stuck out to me and I don't live around here so I probably won't be back.

Excellent service, enjoyed the teppan grill. Our cook was a young guy they call him "white boy". Very talented with his skills for being so young, you would think it takes years of practice but he's got it down. If you go there ask for him. Just sit back away from the grill b/c he doesn't give warning when he makes a big ass bonfire in your face, thought I lost my eyebrows...j/k. Food is good, will come again

First of all, we waited at least 15 mins to be seated when it's 930pm. Not many people in the restaurant. The waitress eat in the kitchen when we walked pass the open area connected to the kitchen. Lots of TRASH on the floor back in the kitchen hallway. There was an older chef George who was cooking for us. During the chitchat, he told us he had too much sake tonight. How can employee drink during work??? We ordered 4 fried rice. He made 6 bowls and asked a waiter takes two away, George said "one for you, one for so on so". George insist me to open my mouth to catch the food he threw. I refused a few times then he started yelling at me and force me to do it which already give me an unpleasant experience. I said no and started eating my food but shockingly he threw the vege on my head. He was EXTREMELY DISRESPECTFUL to the customer and he kept arguing with me after throwing the food on my head. This is unbelievable. I have never had this kind of HORRIBLE experience in a restaurant. Will NEVER come back. DO NOT go to this place if you want to be treated properly and keep your appetite and don't GET SICK.  The waiter who took the rice George made from our table laughed to another waiter when he was cleaning the table next to us. He said the guests were so stupid left the whole salmon on the table.  When the boss is gone in the restaurant, EMPLOYEES DRINK and EAT WHEN THEY ARE WORKING, no one does the work. BAD HYGIENE. This is NOT PROFESSIONAL at all. This restaurant needs to hire professionals or provide basic training to the bumbs they hire.   This is the first yelp review I wrote. I normally don't want to spend time on tiny things like this but I want to let the public know and don't pay for the shitty service. The customers deserve much better especially when you pay over $50 a dish.
Probably the most unimpressive entrance to a surprise find in Las Vegas for traditional Japanese fare. Tempting menu options, made for hard decisions. Our selections did not disappoint.
In Vegas for a car show and wanted Sushi....so glad we came here. Food and service were excellent. Kalbi Ribs were beyond excellent. Highly recommend Osaka.

im a big sushi fan n i got to say out of alot of place ive tried in vegas this is surely one of the BEST!!! they got amazing happy hour!..the waiters are very nice n friendly i prob come here every two weeks n they know me n my orders lol...this place is very chill n there booths are what japanese style so u take your shoes off but i really recomend coming here n tryin a few of there amazing sushi rolls!!!!!

This was my very first time here, with a $20 off coupon for an order of $80 or more.   When you arrive, the door is crazy hard to open with their air vent system. And very cold inside as a result.  We had a reservation for 6:30 on a Friday, which was smart because it was packed. The older Asian gentleman who seemed to be a host was very curt and sat us in a half-booth half-table when we had wanted a full booth but luckily my guests were not picky about seating.  We were given drinks right away and placed an order for tempura bam, which took twenty minutes to arrive and we noticed other tables void of food like ours as well. They seem to be short-staffed for the weekend dinner rush, something for the owners to look into.  When it finally arrived, it was disheartening at best due to how small the portion suez is to the price. Being a la carte instead of AYCE, I expected much more bang for my buck. Add to that I ordered a less cooked Alaskan Box that other guests preferred the tempura bam over so sharing was difficult when we were so hungry and waited so long. The Alaskan Box (tobiko fish egg, salmon, rice in square cut w/o seaweed) was stunning to look at but quite bland, with the cucumber being too overwhelming for my taste.  Knowing this, we ordered four rolls: Shrimp Tempura, West Vegas, U-My, and the one with hamachi. I guess I did not order the right items because each one had something off and fulfilling about it.   I know Osaka is meant to be one of the more premium bistros but I was not too impressed. Perhaps if I have another coupon and a chance to order different things I will return. The main highlight was our server, very vivacious lady who took the time to explain menu items and the Japanese language behind them. Also as we left there was live piano, very rare these days unless you dine on the Strip.
Everything we had was so tasty and delish! The servers and sushi chefs were all very nice. Great Sushi spot

Was really looking forward to experience the taste of the food again that I remember from my last trip to Las Vegas.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the food this time around.  Portions were ok though.  The nori used for the sushi rolls was very bad because we spent more time chewing on the nori.  The quality of the nori was just not there.  I love to eat sushi and don't think that I will return to this restaurant in my future trips to Las Vegas.

This place is great for a sushi night ! It can be a bit pricey and the sushi is kind of smaller than the average sized sushi but the quality of the sushi is just amazing makes up for it  so it's well worth the price!

We used to come here a lot but the last few times we were there, the service was really slow so we've stopped coming. Aside from the service, the food was good. They have unique tables that are inset into the floor, so you take off your shoes before sitting & you step down into the booth seat. The parking lot is really small so we often had to park in the lot next door.

Thank you Guy Fieri! We were looking for a great local place to eat off the strip while on vacation in Las Vegas and checked the list on the triple D website. I am so glad we did! Osaka is almost like 3 different restaurants in one: a sushi bar, teppanyaki grill and Japanese restaurant. It is located way off the strip in a strip mall. We ate in the Japanese restaurant section that has low tables that you take your shoes off and tuck your feet under. Super fun! We ordered several sushi rolls, firecracker shrimp, miso soup and their house chicken soup. Everything was amazing! We got the Roponngi, Pocket Aces, and Kai Special rolls. My favorite was the Pocket Aces with the crunchy fried onions on top- yum! The rolls weren't super inexpensive but they were big and really fresh. Next time I'll come for happy hour. I'm so glad we tried this place. It's worth the Uber ride.
Absolutely delicious.  Had the ocean delight-wonderful.  The best service.  Enjoyed greatly.

I have only come here during their happy hour per se (10pm-2am) and I or we sit at the bar.  The chefs are great and quick, the items on the late night special menu are plentiful and cheap.  The rolls are half though.  One of the dishes I ordered was the scallops, the quality of the scallops was great.  They have sake and beer on the menu too and it is affordable.  I can never drink whenever I come though.  One day I'll be able to come on a normal day and use one of those cool rooms where you sit on the floor without your shoes!  Until then, this place is definitely worth trying out.  Service (not the chefs) at the bar was ehhh..
Love this place. Best sushi in town IMO. Everybody I have taken here has loved the food. Very fresh and clean (means a lot coming from a germ freak). Lunch specials are the best!

This place never disappoints!  Go see Julio, John, Ray or Armando and you will love it! Best fresh fish in town.  If you like hipster rolls this might not be your place but if you like fresh fish nigiri style or sashimi there isn't a better place!

Osaka is many good things:  1. a sushi restaurant with a wide variety of fish. When you go into most neighborhood sushi joints, they have the chalkboard specials. Unfortunately, whenever I ask for the more high-end stuff off the chalkboard, NOBODY has it! One waiter at a not-to-be-named sushi joint actually laughed when I asked for the Bluefin. I said, "it's on the specials," and he said, "oh, we never have that." (?!?) Not so at Osaka! Just last night I was offered Bluefin, otoro, and chutoro (sp?). We had the bluefine and the cheaper of the toros (can't remember which). Both were delish!  2. A great sake bar. Seriously, I bet they have 40 different sakes on their menu, one to fit every price point. We had a $19 bottle of cold "mountain man" last night. Good not great, but I like trying things out.  3. A reasonably-priced teppanyaki joint. The chefs do all the standbys (smiley face, fire, peeing man to put out the fire, onion volcano, etc etc....) which my 2 year old loved! It's at least 2 meals worth and they have all kinds of options. I got the chicken ($19), and my husband had the NY and lobster ($35, I think).  4. A tatami room. Actually, I have no idea what that is or what they serve, but I see people taking off their shoes to sit there.  5. In my neighborhood!

Forget the Strip or Fremont, Sahara Ave has everything!   Based on all of the reviews, people seem to either love Osaka or hate it. I love the place. I never had sushi before I tried Osaka and now I'm addicted. Since I'm not expert, I'll keep it short.  Why i love the place: -Eat the volcano roll. it's the most delicious food item I've even tasted in my life. - the rolls all come in half or whole, so you can order lots of different rolls and share. - the place is affordable. -The flat screen tvs at each booth have a looping slide show of everything that they sell in the place. if your conversation falls off, you can drool at the tvs.

You get what you pay for.  That's my motto when it comes to Osaka.  One of the few places that serve 1/2 rolls which is a plus.  Price is another plus (one of the cheapest in town).  Quality is not the best, but not the worst.    My friends tell me that this place has the freshest sushi. I think my issue is because I frequent this place only during the late nights. I think the earliest I've been here was 11 PM. I don't think it's the freshest, but again probably because I come so late.   Service is good and I can't complain about that.  With a ton of sushi restaurants in Vegas, this place gets only 3 stars from me.  Btw, don't get their calamari either.  Pretty much a fried mistake.

This place is so good. The service was amazing. The cooks made everything very fast. And they also offer breakfast that looks amazing ! And I've never even seen a Japanese restaurant offer breakfast !  The shrimp Shumai was my favorite ! Definitely will be coming back here especially since it's very hard to find amazing shumai that's not always sold out. Will be coming here as much as I possibly can

OMG!!Not only is this really authentic Japanese food, they also deliver it direct to your hotel room. Cannot believe my luck that I found Okonimiyaki in Vegas AND didn't even have to leave the comfort of my room to enjoy it

My favorite place to eat the best delicious sushi!!! I absolutely love this place! Everything is always fresh. The service is very attentive to your need & the sushi chefs are awesome. Atmosphere is very chill & relaxed. They have it all, delicious desserts, delicious everything! Definitely a Must try!!!
I love coming here. Amazing sushi. But best of all its fried rice is like no other. I'm not a big sushi fan I don't order anything but crab, shrimp and salmon but I must say its very good here.

Found this restaurant a few years ago when I moved to this area of town. I'm glad to have found a Japanese restaurant actually owned by Japanese! Most of the Japanese places here in Vegas are run by Koreans, which I can't complain about, but I like the authenticity of REAL Japanese food like my mom makes! :) Osaka was also the first Japanese owned restaurant in Vegas!  I love the late night menu. Since Osaka is open until 2am and I'm up late, it works perfect for me! The late night menu is large with great prices! Half size/priced suchi rolls, low priced apps, and great drink specials as well!   Some of my favorite items are: udon, zaru soba, shabu shabu, katsudon, katsu kare, and their selection of fish! Their soups and sauces are very good and similar to how my mom makes!  The sushi chefs are very nice, friendly and Japanese. They are great at recommending menu items and love how creative they are.   They feature teppanyaki (table grilling) and tatami tables by request and live music certain days of the week.

I loved it. Sat down at the sushi bar and right away got greeted and asked what i like to drink. Very attentive and quick with the food. Food was delicious, fresh and just yummy. I will most definitely be going back if I'm ever in Vegas again. Oooh and asked for a roll that wasn't on the menu and with no hesitation he agreed to make it for me which I loved. Thank u!!! Ooh and lunch prices were just right.

Honestly, I expected more from this establishment. Maybe it was just my visit (it was my first), but first impressions are everything for me.  Service is great here, comfortable atmosphere and theme. We sat at the tappan tables... It felt like there was no air conditioning in that back room. I ordered Japanese scallop sushi when i ordered my drink because I love it, it was very good! The other sushi rolls we had were pretty good, interesting custom rolls. I got the chicken and filet mignon habachi and shared with my wife. Chicken and steak were average for upper medium scale Japanese bistro, but they completely lost me with the sauces. Call me traditional, but I like a ginger vinaigrette and yum yum sauce, they serve some strange tasting sauce that is an awful yum yum imposter next to an OKAY ginger sauce. When I asked for some yum yum sauce, it was basically Japanese mayo with a tad bit of sweet something. Not the yum yum I was hoping for. Like I said, the sauces are make or break for me.  If you want REAL amazing habachi, place downtown called Mosashi (sp?) Tiger is the owner and a chef and the food, sauces and service are superb. No wonder when we always go there somone famous is dining with us.   All in all, I would not revisit this restaurant unless I had a 50% coupon and a free pedicure.

I think this place is great!! It's in a good location but since it's not on the strip the prices are average. Very awesome chicken katsu. Also sampled a few other items they had (forgot the names, but they were all good.) The food itself would only get a 3 star rating but the fact they have four different seating options is not only unique but sure to please almost anybody. Plus, our server was very friendly. If you're craving sushi this is the place for you.
Great place to dine with family and friends at both of Osaka's teppanyaki and seated areas.  Prices are reasonable and they have friendly service.

I've been here many times during the years and it's an okay place. Everything they serve is simply average nothing really that stands out, but it's still decent.  Most of the time the service is friendly and delivery of food is accurate and quickly delivered. I like this location, because it's closer to the center of town, so if I'm running out of time I can come here for a quick bite. This isn't the best sushi place in town, but it's good enough to recommend.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and it has been that way going on 10 years.  Its got a real neighborhood feel too it.  Food is always fresh and service is super polite and prompt.  I just love to go there after work and take off my shoes and lounge around on the pillows.  I recommend the chicken teriyaki, tempura shrimp and veggies and Japanese sandwiches.

Got food poisoning here yesterday. What a terrible post meal experience.. can't ever come here again. At the time, the food was an overall good meal, however I started the worst food sickness about 3-5 hours later. This, I will never forget. Culprit is the ginger, rice or filet tataki (not sure on sp).

Exceptional sushi!  Exceptional!  I'm sure the experience is even better if I eat in but I always take it to go. I called in my order and when I got there to pick up, I had the great pleasure of watching the sushi master lovingly preparing my dish. Atmosphere and staff are wonderful. Some evenings, there's even a live band performing. Great place to dine!

I feel I need to share one of my favorite sushi restaurants from Vegas. This is an off strip restaurant that is pretty popular with the Nevada locals. The location of Sahara is the most popular one, but this location is smaller and more quaint. The one on Eastern Blvd in Henderson is the one that I like to go to because this is where the best sushi chef in Vegas works. If Hiro is working, he will make things you never heard of that might not even be served anywhere else!  Some of my favorites are the Beef Tataki with crispy garlic slices on top, Escolar with fresh jalapeños, rock shrimp salad, the Chilean Sea Bass appetizer.
