Honestly, anything he makes will be fantastic, guaranteed! I believe he's usually off on Wednesdays and Thursdays and works evenings, but if you treat him well, he'll do the same! For those not into sushi, they have the Teppan room and also a full menu outside of sushi. They even have the tatami mats at both locations. They serve free hot sake between 4-7pm and Monday Night Football pitchers of beer during happy hour.   If you are a local, they have a frequent visitor card that gets you money off after you spend a certain amount, otherwise if you visit their website, you can download a one time 10% off coupon. Hope you have fun!

Food is GREAT, but every time I come in it takes forever for someone to greet me. I stood in the doorway this time waiting for someone to approach me, made eye contact with a chef that was talking with two different waiters. I approached them after waiting 3-4 minutes, and still nobody said anything to me. I had to go find another waiter walking around to help me.. I find it very offensive that this happens almost every time I come in to pick up an order. Very unprofessional. I am not one to complain but they definitely need a host up front at the desk by the door. I've never seen anyone behind that desk and I'm here quite often.

This is the place that made me a believer!  I have always been leary of sushi, but after my experience here I love it now.  Not been to a ton of places, but this is the place I base all others on.  And none have come close.  I can't get enough of the 911 roll.  And everyone I have told about this place all agree this place is tops.  Also you can't beat there sushi happy hour and the ambiance all in all Osaka is great.

Went to Osaka again today. This place has been in Las Vegas longer than I have, like 48+ years !! Their food is consistently fresh, the fish tastes like fresh caught, just like it should ! Great Service and quality food make Osaka on West Sahara a true Las Vegas treasure !

Been hitting up Osaka Henderson for over 10 years now!  You won't find a much bigger menu, it's rediculous.  This is my dependable go-to japanese that never does me wrong.  My faves:  -Kickass Tempura  -Salmon Sashimi is always on point! -Teppan Grill is TOPS -BOMB house chicken soup -Not a big roll guy, so I can't comment on that.  Can be a little pricey, especially for you "all you can shove" lovers.  Staff is super friendly.  Worst part of the restaurant is the strange wind vacuum opening the front door.

Great service, all the rolls I tried were amazing. Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Good sake selection. Would come back.   However, sitting at the sushi bar sucks: the countertop is so shallow that your knees clash with the wall beneath the counter. Could not find a comfortable seating position.

This restaurant is wonderful! It is lovely inside. The decor is beautiful and clean. The staff is very friendly and the sushi is fresh and very well prepared!   They also have bento boxes for those who aren't into sushi, which are among the best I've seen. They aren't stingy with the plates and everything is fresh and flavorful! I have been back several times over the past few weeks and they are consistent.   I would recommend this restaurant to anyone without worrying about it missing the mark. Bravo!

Love this place!  Like what everyone is saying about the layout is kinda weird but still great ambiance, once you get to the Japanese seating area. And the place has plenty of seating even great for parties or dinner events.  Plus if you go on Groupon you get some kind of discount but I think its only for the anthem location.   Customer service is pretty good. They even gave us a little history about Osaka. How the owner was a great guy. He wanted to help people with no work so he opened a restaurant. There is a painting of him in the sushi bar. Also found out that they are NOT associated with the Lake Mead location.   The food is amazing! I mean your never gonna get it as fresh as Japan but taste is on point. Kinda brings me back to Japan.  It is a little pricey but totally worth it specially  on happy hour! I love love the tempura bam.  The curry is pretty good as well and is a big portion. And of course the sushi! I definitely recommend this place. It doesn't look much considering the location. But its a  MUST TRY!
Delicious, fresh seafood!  Outstanding service!  We came in on a Tuesday afternoon and did not have to wait to be seated to have sushi only.

This restaurant  is so weird. I made a reservation but  they said they dont take reservation from 4-8pm ...just after 8pm  for night . We are fine with that . that is why we take 8pm with show cooking on table...but when we come on time, they don't put us on  that table instead other one. They said we need to wait for 30mis. We are ok...but after that they said we need to wait more time... so bad. We take reservation already. Why we need to wait many time. We spend 30mins for driving to this restaurant...but it is tooooooo....o bad.  I don't eat food yet so i give this restaurant 2 stars for bad treatment.

Another excellent Teppanyaki experience at the Henderson location. Oddly our Chef is a white guy (Zack) that cooks a hell of a lot better than any of the other Asian or Hispanic Chefs I've had in the past(Not to be racist here) and I eat a lot of Teppanyaki . He is just that good and the food is awesome. He will adjust your meal according to your liking and we are always left extra fried rice and steak to your liking. We've had the Filet Mignon, the Tiger Shrip which are huge and the Salmon which was also huge. All in all, this is hands down one of the best places to eat. Sorry, I don't each Sushi, so I can't speake to that...
Great 911 roll if you like spicy. The oh my god roll is very tasty too. THe interior is very Japanese like, low floor tables and bamboo, nice atmosphere, friendly service

Osaka is hands down the best Japanese restaurant in the Las Vegas area. I always try to leave The Strip to get a more mellow, authentic experience and this place is my first pick. Fresh sushi, a large menu, great service, fair pricing and tasty specials all make this place the go-to when in Vegas.

Osaka is great! I am not sure how it can get any less than 4 stars. Its a local's staple for good reason. I have personally been patronizing Osaka (sahara and eastern) for 14 years. I have NEVER had a bad meal, food is always consistent and service has always been wonderful.   Not only do they have an extensive sushi menu, great lunch specials, amazing Teppanyaki chefs, a rewards card, live music but they are open late too! Osaka will always have a spot in my foodie heart!

It's a must to stop into Osaka anytime I'm in Vegas!   Service is great, food's yummy and there's many options, and I love the vibe in the restaurant! I can lounge and sip on sake or do sake bombs with help from the chefs!

The quality of fish here was great, we also got some yakitori that unfortunately was all dry and overcooked.  Also got the fried oysters, they were fresh but also over fried. The entrees were so-so, everything seemed extra salty. There's no doubt that their ingredients are of good quality, but if I were to do it all over again I would stay away from the appetizers and entrees and just order sushi straight up. If you are into Uni and Ikura, definitely get their Awesome Threesome. Service was friendly and fast, water cups were never empty. Waitress was very knowledgeable of their huge several page menu.

Came here to try this place on a Wednesday night. We wanted to sit in those booths that you take your shoes off Japanese style. I love this concept. Only thing I would have to say is that the pillows to sit on in this room is kinda old. Some looked new but some were old or dirty. Our servers did an excellent job bringing out everything fast and tending to us. My boyfriend and I ordered the Ron Special Boat. It was filling and good. Didn't care for the potato salad that came with the boat. Everything else was good. The sauce for the tempura was my boyfriends favorite sauce. Before we got our boat we got a refreshing cucumber salad and the miso soup with noodles in it. I love that their soup has noodles in it! It was delicious. The cucumber salad was really good and part of my favorite as well! I also ordered some hot sake. It was smooth and the server did a great job recommending the sake choice for me.  Our Ron special boat had beef, chicken yakitori, came with rice, potato salad, sashimi (salmon, tuna, and I believe yellowtail), California roll, and tempura. It filled the two of us up and we had to get the rest to bring home. Their desserts looked good as well. I think this is a good spot for hibachi and Japanese dining. I think if they updated the pillows then the place would have a better new look and feel to it.
Amazing food! Can't stop talking about it!! Will definitely go back next time we're in Las Vegas.
Overpriced restaurant and plenty of MSG in their food. Looking for a heart attack or a stroke? This is the place. Service is up & down.

This is one of my favorite sushi places.   The fish and rolls are high quality.  The people I have found that don't like it just like the all you can eat places.  There are a good mix of rolls and the staff is very friendly

I have been craving deep fried ice cream not the corn flakes kind but the like batter kind. I saw a picture of Osaka's tempura fried ice cream and it www just what I was looking for.  It's amazing and you get a very large portion lol I wouldn't mind sharing...I'll definitely be a frequent flyer

When you look at the outside of Osaka, don't be fooled by how it looks.  The parking is small and narrow and there are no windows outside.  However, once inside, you'll notice the ambience is nice and you will dine Japanese style.  Yes, taking off your shoes or flip-flops and sitting on the floor.  I must say that this is one of the best sushi places I have ever been to.   The sushi is good and the presentation is simple.  The udon is good as well, but I was unable to finish it.  I ordered the Oh My God sushi and I noticed that they added lettuce to their sushi.  I found it strange, but I found not difference in taste.  The sushi wasn't mind blowing and I don't know why they named it Oh My God.    Service was great.  Our (I went with my sister and boyfriend) server was always checking on us if we wanted more water or anything else to eat.  We only had to ask him once for refill.  He was always on top of things.    Overall, I wouldn't mind coming here again.  Maybe I should order the San Diego Salmon.

One of my favorite places to eat at, especially for sushi! Their service is awesome and I love their tempura, miso soup, teriyaki chicken, japanese lasagna roll, etc. They also have great desserts! My favorite is the tiramisu. I know, you're thinking.. at a Japanese restaurant? Well, it's some of the best I've had & I've eaten tiramisu in Little Italy in NYC. Go check it out!

Osaka Bistro is awesome, if you appreciate quality sushi that is. The sushi/sashimi is fresh and authentic. I got the medium sashimi platter which was enough for four to share. It had a good assortment of fish from snow crab and fresh abalone to hamachi and hirame. I'm drooling just thinking back to that sashimi platter! I also had another platter with the various types of nigiri sushi that I ordered. The amaebi and kinmedai were terrific! The toro melted in my mouth! I also had the shigoku oysters which were fantastic and fresh! There are many other sushi rolls to choose from and a large menu with items from the kitchen if sushi is not your preference. My mom loves their sukiyaki. She and my dad have been coming here for years and now that I've seen why, I'll be back for sure!
Always enjoy sushi here.

I've been a fan of Osaka for awhile. They've been around for awhile. They're a steady sushi spot. They've thrown in some new items as they've aged. The "bistro" part was only recently added, at least to my recollection they were once only known as Osaka. The restaurant, although in a seedy part of town, has been kept up well. I'm sure at some point in time, this spot was a GOOD spot in town. But you can't really help what happens to an aging city. You can help keeping your restaurant clean and nice looking, which Osaka has done.  I enjoy the atmosphere of Osaka, it is dimly lit when you first walk in and around the tepanyaki areas. However, the dining area is well lit with nice, clean, wooden tables. The service has always been up to par when I have visited. The servers are well versed on the menu, they are around consistently to refill drinks (I usually always order a hot green tea).   On my last visit I went with a friend because I had a LivingSocial deal, which they honored without any hesitation. I had a few different items: Age Dashi Tofu. I thought it was pretty good, although I have had a better age dashi tofu at Cafe de Japon. The serving they give at Osaka is quite large. I shared some with my friend. The broth it was in was a teeny bit salty for me, but I did drink it all up. Moving on to sushi, because that's what I came for. I ordered the Lisa Lisa roll (shrimp tempura, cream cheese, avocado, eel sauce). It was decent. Not the best or worst roll I've ever had. The tempura was on the soggy side. Wish it had had a more crispness to it. Next: temaki (hand roll). I always get a hand roll when I eat sushi. I ordered the Miki's special, it's simple: crab, massago, and mayo. It was good. And lastly: nigiri. I ordered the sweet shrimp (Ama Ebi). This was my favorite by far. I wish I had just ordered a bunch of these. They were stuffed full, very generous portions.   My friend also allowed me to try some of the food she got. I unfortunately cannot remember what it was she ordered. But one thing was the Japanese pancake, which I really liked because it had seafood in it.   We ended our meal with the Bomba - chocolate peanut butter! I highly recommend this. It was very good.   Overall I like Osaka. I will be back again. They have a very extensive menu and I would like to try more sushi as well as their Udon.

Always love coming here for real, traditional Japanese food. Osaka keeps an authentic menu, prepared to perfection, which is getting harder to find with all of these fusion-type Asian restaurants sprouting up. While that's alright sometimes, when I want an authentic Japanese dish made right, I come here. Love the ambiance & the staff is very friendly also.

Food and service was amazing. I was unclear from the entry on where to sit or if anything else was available for seats other than the few tables. However the establishment clearly needs a remodel but the food made me forget about my environment. I will return!

I love the little hole in the wall joints and found this place on Yelp.  We walked in and immediately sat at the bar, which we love to do.  We didn't realize that they had an entire back section where it was more or less traditional Japanese seating which is lower to the ground.    Great food.  Loved the Sushi and the service was great.

We keep coming back for the fish. The Sushi is top notch and of superior quality including their neighbors across the street.  The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is the service.  We've eaten there about a dozen times for both lunch and dinner (happy hour rocks too!) but I swear unless you're sitting at the sushi bar or at the grill they'll barely check on you except to take your order and drop your food.  Still, the food is fantastic (although a little overpriced) so we'll be back again

This is a layback take off your shoes(literally) Tatami tables kind of place, cozy and comfortable place to enjoy delicious Japanese cuisine. Love the variety of prices not so expensive(lots of options) can be if you don't take the time to read the menu.... Overall it's a great place for Sushi, teriyaki platter, or Kobe-beef.

NICE TIME This restaurant has everything that you need. From Japanese to Chinese cuisine there is something that can feast your appetite. This restaurant has a live band that you can enjoy while eating your delicious food. All of the sashimi is very fresh and the special rolls menu had many interesting flavors to their rice and their sauces. The service is quite excellent as well. When you walk in the hostess is very classy and polite. It feels like you a part of their "family" in a way. There is nothing bad I could say about this restaurant. It's sleek, clean, warm, and tasty.

I keep thinking I have visited here before and I probably have.  It's one of my mom's favorite places.  But I go to Vegas once a year (missed last year) to visit my family (mother, brothers and inlaws, cousins) for Christmas or other occassions (bdays, graduations).    My mom's favorite is shrimp tempura so she almost always gets this.  Food is good enough, pricing I would say is medium. I normally don't pay (the oldest brother does) but for this occasion since this is my mom's bday, I footed the bill.  It was not bad for 6 people (but none of us drink so that helps make sure the bill is decent).  I had the combo (they have plenty of that).  I finished it off.  My sis-in-law got the salmon kale salad and got a taste of it (I enjoyed it very much).  We were there on a Wed night and there was live music (interestingly loungey).    Pricing good, food tastes good. Not too busy on a weeknight.  Everything went well.  Leftovers were brought home to enjoy (my mom).  They also have a tepanyaki (grill) so if you want anything grilled, even if you are on the non-grill side, it will take some time so we forgo that order for the husband.  He had the beef teriyaki and by the sign of the leftovers, was not enthusiastic about it.  No reservations needed on a weeknight.
Delicious japanese food. Order the two boats the Titanic and the Ron. U can't go wRONg. Thank me later

The smell in the Osaka Japanese grill room is disgusting. The chef was very happy and had great jokes but burnt the rice, which is my favorite.  Then everything after that was not good.  This was the first time in my life Didn't t  take home my leftovers and love love love them.

I do not like this place, it feels like I was pushed through like cattle. The food is not that great and they never come to your table even to offer you more napkins or forks. I would not go there again

I stopped writing reviews on Yelp because it was too time consuming, but after eating at this restaurant, I can't help but tell the world about our experience, one that I hope will make other people wary of coming here.  We arrived at Osaka on a typical Saturday afternoon (1pm-ish) and was shown a table in the back room (where the tables were larger).  As we walked past the first room upon entering, I noticed that it was fairly empty but it didn't struck me as odd since there are so many restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas.  We sat down and were given multiple menus, each one with something different in it.  I guess this could be a good thing since I like having lots of choices.  We ordered our drinks (hot green tea and iced green tea) and browsed the menus for omakase, which we heard from someone (ahem) that it is worth coming here for.  After everyone in our party arrived (there were 5 of us), we asked the waitress about their omakase and she completely hesitated. I thought that was strange considering this should be a simple question.  She said she'll be right back, so we sat there, thinking maybe she's just new or something.  But even so... o_O.  She came back and in broken English asked us if we wanted sashimi or sushi, and we said a little of both.  She then proceeded to say that it's $100 for all four people that wanted it, and I confirmed if it was $100 per person, or if it was $100 for all four people because that makes a HUGE difference.  She said $100 for four people, so we agreed.  After ordering the "omakase" - I realized that she must have ordered us the plate of normal sashimi/sushi that was on the menu.  I remember seeing $50 for 2 people for something, so with 4 people, she just doubled it.  I thought sure... why not.  We were going to try their assortment of rolls, but given that the omakase is supposed to be good, I decided to give it a try.  The first plate of sashimi came out looking decent.  I'm not too familiar with the names and the translation for the type of fish, so I'm just going to say that I tried just about everything on the menu and only a couple items tasted okay.  There were quite a few nasty bites in between, including one in which I had to spit out.  Now, I'm not a sushi snob at all, but when I have to do that, it means it's NOT good.  My companions agreed, and another person had to go thru that ritual later on in the meal as well (said one of the fish tasted grainy too).  Fortunately, our napkins were right in front of us.  =)  As an additional note, we received 2 additional plates of sushi rolls which were supposed to be part of the omakase deal.  We thought it was just so-so as well... perhaps even bad.  At the end of the meal, we noticed the $100 + $70 on top of our other charges.  We asked about the $70 and they said it was for the 2 plates of sushi rolls that accompanied our sashimi omakase plate. Needless to say, that $70 was a surprise because we were told  it was $100 for four people.  If they told us they were going to bring additional sushi plates for $35 each, I think we would've either said no, or ordered or own rolls.  Ugh.  I hate when mess-ups like this happen.  We told our waitress about the issue and she left to talk to the owner/mgr.  The owner/mgr. came by quite awhile later to ask us what the issue was.  We explained clearly about the unexpected charge and the miscommunication but he wouldn't budge.  In fact, he brought up how good of a quality the fish were, and given that, this is still a good deal.  The whole time, I kept thinking if I should tell the truth about the quality of his fish, but I kept my mouth shut in case he was going to give us a break.  I suppose we all could've said something because at the end, nothing happened out of the negotiation.  He wouldn't even take the charge of one $35 plate of sushi off, so we paid, left, and vowed never to come back.    I've had a lot of sushi before, but I would rank this as the worst sushi AND experience ever.  There are a ton of other great sushi restaurants in Vegas, so look it up on Yelp and go there.  You will not regret it.

Sit at the bar and ask for Shu. He makes the best sushi I ever had. The rice doesn't fall out when you try and eat it.   Ask for the fresh wasabi too, so much better then the paste.   Great quality fish and a huge selection.
Soooooooo disgusting didnt like food and it SMELLED like BATHROOM dont recomend this place

Saw Osaka Japanese Bistro highlighted on a recent Triple D episode and had to try it. We were in Vegas for the weekend and sick of casino food so this was the perfect alternative.   Restaurant atmosphere:  My mom - born and raised in Osaka, Japan - was skeptical as soon as we pulled into the parking lot. She was even more skeptical as we entered the establishment. We were greeted with a black wall! It's drab, a bit dark and the decor is sadly lacking in so many ways...outdated, dingy and not so appealing.   We opted to sit in the tatami room vs. at the tables near the sushi bar. The set-up...taking off of the shoes, tatami mats (I suspect those tatami mats haven't been cleaned in a long time!) GROSS.   If you know anything about the Japanese culture you know that cleanliness is at the top of the list. The second generation owners of this establishment need to take note of this and make an effort to create an atmosphere which is bright, clean and inviting.   Food: Mom ordered the sashimi and tempura combo $22. She said the sashimi was delicious but she was not happy with the rest of her meal. The sunomono cucumbers were crunchy and they're not supposed to be served that way. The rice - plain ol rice - was not cooked thoroughly. RICE - served any way is KEY in any respectable Japanese restaurant!! The miso soup was ok. I ordered the Nebeyaki Udon. The base was good but overall I wasn't impressed.   The rolls are way too overpriced and I just wasn't going to pay $15-$20 for a 'specialty' roll!   Service: our waitress was super nice. I think her name was Haruko. She spoke fluent Japanese which was a plus for my mom. She made suggestions, was attentive and checked in on us several times. There were additional servers that came to check on our dining experience as well and they were very nice as well.   The restroom: F'in disgusting!!! What the heck! You couldn't even wash your hands as there was only a trickle of water! Is this the ONLY restroom in the establishment???!!! Is this where the servers, cooks and SUSHI CHEF washes their hands after they relieve themselves??!!  The hands they will use to prepare and serve your food???!!!! This is a health code violation!   I don't think the average diner is aware of an authentic Japanese dining experience. It definitely isn't at Osaka Japanese Bistro. We were disappointed to say the least.   1 star rating = half for service and half for sashimi!
I love Osaka. Their food really good, place is clean and good customer services. Nice place to go with your family

My cousin loves this place. We were actually seated at Steak N Shake and we had this epiphany that we should go get sushi instead. So we got up and drove all the way up the I-15 to Osaka.  When you enter, you're greeted by a blank wall. What is this - a Japanese Speakeasy? You then turn right and go through another door that takes you to a small sushi bar area. From this initial view, you'd think the place was tiny. If you continue to the back and left, though, you discover that the place can seat quite a lot of people. They have a Teppanyaki area and a surprising number of private booths and traditional looking Japanese sunken dining tables. The space is very aesthetically pleasing.  Unfortunately, when it came to the food, I was disappointed. I really wasn't that hungry, but I tried everything that my cousin ordered. We stuck to their late night special menu that is available 10pm-2am.  * Beef Tataki Salad - It looked amazing, but it lacked flavor. I think I've only ever had Beef Tataki at Ichiza and theirs runs circles around Osaka's. * King Crab Tempura - This was easily the best thing we ordered. Delicious. * Salmon Skin (half) Roll - This also lacked flavor. I'm kind of a purist in that I like to eat sushi exactly how the chef made it. I never use soy sauce or add wasabi. I stuck to my guns on this, despite the roll really needing the extra flavor. * Screaming Orgasm (ahi sashimi on top of some salad) - This also looked amazing. It had better flavor than the Beef Tataki, but I wasn't blown away by it. The dressing was a little too vinegary.  On the plus side, the service was excellent. The two ladies that served us were extremely friendly and attentive to our needs. The green tea tasted great and was the perfect thing on my still recovering throat. Whenever I was running low on tea, the lady would come back and top it off promptly.  I really hate giving less than three stars, but I must stay true to the rating system. Indeed, I have experienced better. It's too bad because the service and decor of Osaka are top notch.

Food was good, but after the meal were told only cards with chips are taken. My bank doesn't have a chip and I was told to go to a cash machine. The managers solution was not acceptable and a self printed sign adjacent to the entry door is not acceptable! David the manager was unprofessional and unable to handle the situation. His response was childish and has made a loyal customer of over six years decide to never return! A negative star is appropriate for the actions of the manager alone!

Who would have thought that the desert could serve some good fish?  Well after much searching through the phone book and online listings, I found a great Japanese restaurant while vacationing in Las Vegas.  Every time I'm the area, I always end up having dinner here at least once.  I'm big on the raw fish, and Osaka takes the cake for having really good sushi while not hammering too hard on the price. And it's not one of those Asian fusion restaurants on the Strip, so that adds to its appeal.    If you're in the mood for Japanese, try this place.  Plus they have combo dinners and soups that would appeal to the non-raw fish eaters too.
I love this place!  O-Toro all day!  They always have some sort of fish that's not on the typical menu.  The mussels are out of this world.  Go and enjoy good sushi here.

First of all Kenji and Himae are fast and friendly so sit at the bar.  The quality of the fish is amazing. I say don't fill up on rice eat sashimi or nigiri pairs.  The garlic tuna( maguru) is delicious. Also try the Shikoku oysters amazing.  I can't say there was anything I didn't like my friend ate 20 pieces of himachi, so it must have been good. Kenji also made me a lemon salmon roll with avocado and cucumber inside which wasn't on the menu. Great people and high quality food!

Absolutely my favorite sushi place in Vegas! The food is delicious and at a reasonable price but more importantly very clean. Meaning: I have never gotten sick from eating here. This is a common scare with eating any food raw. I trust this place, especially for my "sushi virgin" friends. Favorite rolls: Oh My God, Japanese Lasagna, and a simple salmon nigiri (oh so fresh and sweet!).  If you come with a group of people, they have "sushi boats," which are literally wooden boats full of sushi (prefixed selection though). There is no all you can eat menu but I'm not really into that. Just go to any Osaka location, you will not be disappointed!

Absolutely my favorite sushi place in Vegas! The food is delicious and at a reasonable price but more importantly very clean. Meaning: I have never gotten sick from eating here. This is a common scare with eating any food raw. I trust this place, especially for my "sushi virgin" friends. Favorite rolls: Oh My God, Japanese Lasagna, and a simple salmon nigiri (oh so fresh and sweet!).  If you come with a group of people, they have "sushi boats," which are literally wooden boats full of sushi (prefixed selection though). There is no all you can eat menu but I'm not really into that. Just go to any Osaka location, you will not be disappointed!

Visited Osaka on April 24th and 27th 2016 from Long beach california to see our favorite and best waitress Angie!!!! She's the best!!!!!! Couldn't be more pleased with the service and the food!!!! The tempura udon and fried rice is the best of any place!!!!!

Been coming here for the past 10 years and we can't have enough of this place, tried a lot of places in Vegas but this place Rocks!!! The Sushi Chef Jaime knows what we like and we don't , as soon as you walk in the door they will greet you and call you by your name of course if you come here often like we do lol! Everything is fresh ready to serve as order! Tried pretty much everything off the menu and what can I say? It's really good! Highly recommend this place for Family, friends or even date night!

Osaka's Bistro was okay. I have definitely experienced better. I thought being an older establishment it would be better. Businesses do not stay around 30+ years if they are bad.   I would say the food was average for Teppanyaki. There was nothing fantastic about it. The facility is incredibly small, OLD, and definietly seen better days. I thought the private rooms were probably the best part, however, I did not dine in one.   There was only one bathroom, and it was not exactly clean. The bar was small, drinks were overpriced and the sushi was so-so. Overall it was an average experience, with average food, average service and an expensive price tag. we paid $160.00 for four people. I will not be going again.

Have probably eaten here 30 times. It's definitely the best sushi in the area and its very affordable.  It's way better than all the all you can eat places nearby and will cost maybe $10 more.  The raw fish here is always fresh and high quality.  I would reccomend the sushi, tiger roll, kalbi rib appetizer and the black forrest cake.  Also the lunch special is a great deal would recommend checking it out.

My favorite place to go when eating sushi with the family. I usually try to go during lunchtime because dinner can get pretty busy. The servers are nice and attentive. It's my go-to place for a nice lunch, and sometimes dinner, with the family,   P.S. It's not just the sushi that's good. Curries, udon, etc. Delicious. :)

My partner an die always go there to eat sushi and fry rice, but last night we had David has a server and was terrible! I didn't see him before there but he did a really bad job. no water, we order the first plate of sushi and wait more than 20 minutes to get the second order and never show. went to the cashier to paid my bill and he was ether chilllin, and when I told him very generous about the waiting he didn't said nothing and either good night or so, very very unprofessional ....

I love sushi..but I was a bit disappointed  with this company. .. service seems to be slow. .. and when I ordered  yellowtail nigiri I asked for ponzu sauce on it with jalapeño and siracha on top they said they weren't able to do it because they were to busy in the back room....so I told them to give me a side of all three so I can do it myself...it's not an all you can place ...so not sure why they were not able to do it....im spending the money for each piece of sushi..

We found this restaurant on Drive-in diners and Dives. This is the sister restaurant to the in on the Strip. We ordered John's boat. The sashimi (tuna, yellow tail and salmon) was so fresh!  The beef teriyaki was very tender. I think it was beef rib eye.  Was afraid there would be too much food for 2b but it was just right. Will come back again

Go here all the time. Especially for the late night menu. It is a cozy atmosphere and always something new to try. Depends on the server,  but sometimes it's great or slow. But besides that it's fun and always changing while keeping the classics.
Amazing as usual. The food is great and the service is exceptional. It's not just good for sushi, the udon here is the best we've had in Vegas.

I am a HUGE fan of Sushi. I have been to this location 3 or 4 times now and I am hooked! I live in Chinatown, this place is so good that I actually leave Chinatown to eat here.  What is so good? -The Seating! This place is huge. They have sushi bar seating, table seating in the back and Hibachi.  - The Service! The service is ALWAYS spot on. I have sat in all parts of this location and it is always perfect. The staff speaks clearly so I don't feel like I need to do sign language unlike some sushi places in Vegas... -The Dessert! I never thought I would find an asian restaurant with amazing dessert, but this place takes the cake... Or should I say chocolate ice cream amazining-ness ;) I actually LOVE the gelato!  They have a full bar which is always nice as well :)

I ordered the usual and customary hamachi sashimi, the dish that sets the bar for me and my sushi adventures.  Well, not the best Hamachi I've had.  It was fresh, but kinda tough, it didn't give me that melt in my mouth kinda feeling I like.  Good portions though.  Kinda expensive.   Fast service.  All in all, just another mediocre experience.  Get your sashimi sushi when you're closer to the ocean.

I'm big on first impressions, so when friends said this place was good, we decided to check it out.  Our waitress was very nice. The sushi was descent and the beer selection was great.  Here's the bad: terribly slow service. It took over 30mins to make a simple roll. Luckily we dined with friends so we weren't in a hurry but we hardly saw our waitress. I shouldn't have to flag people down just to find out the status of an order. When she did finally return, she gave us our check. She never came back. Had to go to the counter to pay which is no big deal but I waited for 20mins just to pay. Staff just walked by me and several people waiting to pay, not even acknowledging anyone.  I won't return. There is a huge selection of sushi places I would rather go to.

The waiters and the guy greeting is on the front here super nice but overall the food didn't amaze me.  I much prefer the original Osaka on the other side of town. Something about this place just isn't as good.  Ordered salmon and yellowtail nigiri and the rice wasn't good and tasted old.  Miso soup and udon tasted very artificial and bland. Did not enjoy the taste.  The oh kamisama rolls and the catapillar rolls were tasty but super sauced. If you aren't into the simple, fish/rice combos and you like the very Americanized, super saucy rolls then you will enjoy ordering the rolls.   Overall, service was very nice but for the price I'd rather make the farther drive to the original Osaka on the other side.
Ordered a late night pick-up dinner of 5 assorted rolls and some kimchi. The sushi was very good, and the prices very reasonable.

A staple of mine while I was going to school down the street, I am almost obligated to write a review for this fine establishment. A sushi joint that has yet to let me down.   Osaka serves all of their items a la carte, so no AYCE. But if you have the extra money and want better quality sushi than what you would get from a AYCE place, come here.  Anytime of day is a good time to come, they have lunch and late night specials. The rolls and nigiri are always fresh and delicious, and I regularly order their various bento boxes, combo meals, and appetizers. I am more of a nigiri guy, but this place has plenty of appetizing and unique rolls that I will often order. As I stated earlier, this place has yet to let me down, I have ordered a lot of different items off the menu, and they are always on point.  The service is always top notch. The wait staff is always attentive, and will always customize your order to your liking. I've never gotten a wrong order, food that took forever to come out, or items missing. If you decide to eat at the bar, the sushi chefs are awesome, and will always start up conversation to be friendly and to see what you would want to order and make suggestions. One of my go to chefs is Oscar. He is normally there during the lunch hours, and always makes awesome rolls. He even does his own custom order of baked mussels with Sriracha sauce that is awesome, ask for it, and he will be happy to make it for you.  While not necessarily a con, it can be pricey to get your fill here  if you just plan on eating sushi. But it comes with better quality of food, so it almost cancels itself out. They at least have a reward card here to accumulate some free food after a couple of visits.  It is one of the older sushi spots in Vegas for a reason. Top quality food with awesome service is always a good combo when eating out somewhere.

Been waay too long since I've come here. And how I've missed it.  The fish is always super fresh , osaka rice and baked mussels are always a pleasure.  We have the ultimate osaka roll, lisa lisa, unagi roll, yum yum roll, and rainbow roll. A wide variety of goodness.  Don't be afraid to step out of your comfort zone and try something new , they will not disappoint.  As always service was a pleasure,  our waiter was very fast and friendly as well!

I must say, I've been to many sushi Japanese bistro places in Las Vegas, however this would have to be my most favorite. I was introduce to this place by my lovely sister in which she has shown me the capabilities these chefs have in making their dishes as for as presentation.   First off l, their edamame is the best I've tasted. It is not just served plainly or with salt sprinkled, but it is first pan fried with garlic and then garnished with chili sesame oil. I'm not kidding I could not stop eating them! My second dish was the dynamite roll made with delicious scallop, clam and crab and a nice spicy specially sauce to go with it! The texture was there and so was the taste!   Overall I had a great experience. I would definitely recommend and head back next time I visit. The service is on point there and even with drunk Vegas crowds they still manage to keep there cool!

The food was excellent. We got food from the grill and it was the best I've had in a long time. The restaurant is small and fills up so I would try to call and make a reservation if you want to get a seat during prime time.

Very American style sushi, not what I was expecting. I like the taste of raw fish and don't appreciate nigiri coming from the chef with so much wasabi the fish can't be tasted, especially if that is the experience on the majority of the pieces. Rolls aren't much better, the Aces and Yum Yum were  bland, and in the case of the Aces over powered by sauces. Total price was $90 for two (Friday 6/20/14). If you like Wasabi more than fish, and prefer McDonald's to In&out this place might be for you,  but if you'd like even a hint of tradition or subtle flavors look elsewhere.

Love this place. Went there for our anniversary dinner and so glad we did. We felt very special as it was just us at the grill. Our chef was so engaging and entertaining! He made sure we got everything he cooked to our complete satisfaction. The hosts were so attentive too making sure our drinks were always fresh. And the food! The soup, salad, rice, beef, shrimp and chicken are made to your liking. You don't feel rushed at all. If I could give it more than 5 stars I would.

Years ago I would have given this place 5 stars, sadly it has declined. The timing of the food was horrible, as one entree did not come until about 15 minutes after the first one - and there was only two of us. The late entree arrived in stages which was kind of annoying and when the chicken arrived it was absolutely cold. The sushi was ok - that alone would be 3 stars.

I lived in Las Vegas for a couple of years and this is one of the places I miss the most.  They always have good food and have never disappointed me.  On this visit my hubby had some assorted sushi - which he just loved - and I had a combination dinner.  The tempura was cooked perfectly and the chicken was moist and delicious.

this is my favorite place for sushi that doesn't have an all you can eat deal. it looks small from the outside but once you're in you  have a variety of seats from the sushi bar or tables or private booths. my favorite roll is matsui #55. the sashimi is consistently fresh. service is very friendly. if you can't decide what you want by reading it off the menu they have plasma tvs at every booth that show pictures of each roll with their names.   this location has pretty much the same menu as the eastern location. the lake mead location is separately owned and operated with a completely different menu.   they also have a VIP card available that you use each time you eat and it accumulates a 'bonus' which gives you a discount off your next visit after you accumulate $10.
I love Osaka but a few things I didn't like like the fried rice and had king crab sushi once that had ice particles.

Decided to come over here off the strip with some friends.  And since I rarely go off-strip whenever I'm in Vegas, I figured I'd give it a shot and grabbed a taxi.  That said, I was generally impressed by the ratio of price to sushi during lunch time compared to sushi on the strip.  The quality was pretty good overall.  Though, I honestly forgot what I ordered though since I had more sake than sushi (something along the lines of a badass samurai or something), but I had no issues with the sushi.

Let me start out by saying that Osaka has some damn good sushi and reasonable prices. The booths in the back are cool and they have a very large menu selection.  Now let me get to the part where I will never forgive them for doing what they did:  I had made a reservation for 16 people 2 weeks in advance of my birthday for dinner. I checked back with them several times during those 2 weeks, including 24 hours before and they kept telling me it was all good and they would have my table ready at the exact time.  Well, I showed up on my birthday and was told they didn't have my reservation. ANYWHERE. And that I will have to wait until a table is finally available.  My friends and I waited for over an hour, when they finally came to check on us because we were starting to fill up the seats in their cramped bar area, they offered us a couple free drinks after which they told me we will still have to wait another hour for a table.  Are you kidding me? On my birthday? Screw you, Osaka. Your organizational skills are horrible and your sushi doesn't make up for your lousy service. Even on my previous trips to this restaurant, the service is always either really slow or they mess something up on your bill or they forget to get you an item you ordered, yet I have never complained because I thought I broke even with how good the sushi was.  Well, never again. And I would actually like to thank the horrible staff at Osaka for my introduction to Ichiza, who have WAY better sushi and are so friendly and prompt with their service.   The gist: Osaka has horrible service, go to Ichiza instead. It's right by there near Chinatown and has much better food, prices and service even though it's about half the size of Osaka.

It's been a long time since I last visited Osaka. Boy, what a difference. It used to be a traditional Japanese restaurant, but now, it's turned into a fusiony bistro. I should've read the reviews on here before going.  The restaurant is now separated into tatami rooms, teppanyaki, sushi bar etc -- we got the tatami room.... which was fine. We got a sushi platter, zaru soba, selections from their robatayaki menu and agedashi tofu. The zaru soba was actually really good. Robatayaki items weren't bad either -- skimpy portions though. The sushi however, blows! I was so damn disappointed in the poor quality we were given. They used to be fantastic.  After this visit, I really won't be returning again. I like my sushi traditional. I'm kinda a stickler about that. The agedashi tofu was quite dismal too, not true authentic agedashi tofu at all. It was so dismal that the young man refused to eat it and he was the one who ordered it.  The service was attentive though hence the extra star. They have a late night menu with discounted prices after 10pm.

I like Osaka mostly because they have good sake samplers and decent food for those who don't eat fish.  I have been here with friends on numerous occasions and have always managed to find something to eat without fish.  Having lived in Japan for years, I like to think my broken nihongo has a hand in me getting what I would like...  Love the Inari and the tofu soup was bland but not too bad.  The tea here is one of the reasons I like to come here..sooo tasty.    The Sake is great I had rice, cold, warm and flavored and enjoyed almost all of it.  Great to go with a group of friends, sit in the back on the tatami and drink, eat and be merry.  The waiter was kind of nice to give us the some remainders of open bottles since were shutting the place down.  A big bonus because it was normally not something I would order because of the expense.    The place is good for groups, and the seating is somewhat private so you can have a good time.  Like all tatami you can take your shoes off and sit cross legged which I love.

Great ambience. I love the customer service here i been coming here for a little over a year now. I am NOT very open to many sushi restaurants because i have gotten sick. I have NEVER gotten sick here at osaka and my food from the kitchen is always fresh and Hot.   I onyl eat a few things in a sushi Restaurant and its usually not on the menu and have to be customized to my liking... they always make my custom sushi roll to my liking with a smile every time s/o to Heimi hes a Kool Guy. I also eat shrimp Ebbi whichi is great here as well. See pics below for what I eat every time. Thanks Osaka

What can I say? The BEST JAPANESE RESTAURANT IN VEGAS! ^_^  I love their rolls, their sashimi are so fresh and delicious!  My fav dinner dish is Teriyaki beef, they are smoky!  They have Teppan table but I always prefer the sitting at the tatami room, cause it's so cozy and private if you want to bring your partner.  Service is wonderful, and food came out fast.  For desert, I recommend the green tea mousse, they have the most prefect taste, not too sweet and not too creamy.

Looking for a late night sushi place that offers happy hour specials, we were referred to Osaka's in Henderson.  Walking into this pretty big and established restaurant, we're given three menus to peruse!  There's seating available at the sushi bar, the tables, and even tatami rooms!  The menus are quite extensive and you have to spend a great deal of time doing the matching game.  One menu offers the happy hour specials, but in order to find out what's in each roll, you have to read through their regular menu.  It takes a good while!  A large selection of rolls and thank goodness for pictures.  They all start to sound the same though and many of them overlap.  They also offer this Buy 10 Get One Free from their special roll menu.    You can also do Shabu Shabu, Sukiyaki, or Yosenabe here if you'd like!    We finally decided on a few things from their happy hour menu, and surprisingly, we didn't end up with much sushi!    777 Roll ($9.95 HH price, $12.95 reg.) - "Shrimp, scallop, miki, tobiko, cream cheese; topped with avocado, albacore and served with garlic and yumyum sauce."  It's a pretty good roll, but fatty as hell because that yumyum sauce is a mayonnaise-based sauce.  You can tell how bad it is for you once you take the first bite!    Deep Fried Tofu ($3.50 HH price, $4.95 reg.) - Also known as Agedashi tofu.  It was a bit tough, not easy to break apart.  I prefer my agedashi a little softer so my spoon can gently cut into it.  Tonkatsu ($3.50 HH price) - I'm not a particular big fan of the pork cutlet, but the BF is.  He thought it was pretty good and such a great value that he ordered another!  Shishamo ($2.80 HH price, $3.80 reg.) - Grilled smelt fish with smelt eggs - it was okay here.  I've had better.  A bit tough and on the smaller end.  Osaka Rice ($4.95 HH price, $6.95 reg.) - "Mixture of sushi rice, crab, masago, yum yum sauce, sesame oil and siracha sauce."  My friend was eating this as she's ordered it before.  It was okay, there wasn't enough taste going on for my preference.    Seafood Salad ($6.95 HH price, $14.95 reg.) - Lots more sunomono in it than I would have preferred.  I usually like my seafood salad to have a more seafood than anything else.  If you sit facing the sushi bar, they have a slide show on the computer screens with their different rolls and dishes presented.      Overall, the food here is a bit more expensive than other Japanese restaurants. They are obviously doing okay since this is their second location   Late night happy hour is good until 1:45 am!  You can find a 10% coupon on their website too!  (Food pics can be found in the business profile!)

It's late on a Sunday night and the BF suggests trying out the original Osaka after having visited their second location a few weeks back.   Walking through the front door, you immediately face a wall.  Not the most feng shui I'm sure, but make a right down the hall and you'll see another entrance which brings you right to the sushi bar.  I noted to the BF that this location was way smaller, and he then pointed out they had more room in the back.  We took a walk down there after eating to check out their tatami room (lots of space), semi-private booths, and a hibachi grill area too.  They are pretty fancy here with slide shows running on a computer screen at every booth in the back.  I would be even more impressed if it was a touch screen where you can order all your food by pressing your selection.  That would be super high tech!    Anyway, back to the review and the food.  The menus are pretty much the same at both locations, for the most part.  From their late night happy hour menu, this is what we ordered:  * Shishamo ($2.80) - It came with three pieces.  Again a bit tougher than what I'm used to.  They seasoned it with black pepper, but I asked for some salt to give it a little more kick too.  * Korean-Style Spicy Chicken ($4.50) - It's literally stir-fried chicken with Korean spicy sauce on a bed of lettuce.  I wasn't sure if the lettuce was garnish or to eat.  Oh well, I ate it.  * Crazy Horse Roll ($4.20) - It's tuna, salmon, masago and mixed together with spicy sauce.  It's a very basic roll, but pretty good.  * Fire Roll ($3.90) - Crab meat and spicy sauce.  Unfortunately, it looks like the CA rolls you buy from the supermarket, but without the avocado in it.  It had a bit of kick in it.  And from their regular menu:   * Ankimo ($6.95) - Monkfish liver...oh how I love this stuff.  It's an acquired taste.  I like to soak my chunk in ponzu sauce and then break off a tiny piece and savor each little morsel.  The BF likes to dunk his piece into the sauce and then toss the whole thing in his mouth.  He likes to then mush it around in his mouth.  Haha!  They are known for their exotic and colorful rolls, and they can be a bit a pricey.  It's our unfortunate luck that the only two rolls we ordered were so visually boring.    Service: It wasn't too busy this late in the evening.  A handful of people at the bar and few people at the tables.  The BF had to ask for his soda to be refilled and the waitress never came back with his drink!  When he asked for it, the waitress got him another one.  Then a few minutes later, she came by and took his drink away!  (We were wondering why she did that.)  When she came back with his drink, she said she was refilling it again.  (I guess to make up for his drink disappearing in the first place.)  The BF asked for my own pot of tea since I'm a big tea drinker and to save them the trouble of having to refill my teacup every five seconds.  One waiter came by twice to take away dishes that we weren't done yet.  In the process, he would try to squeeze in between us to reach for the plate, only to realize there was still food on it.  And finally at the end of our meal when the plate was clearly empty, then he asked if he could take it!  We were amused.  And actually, when we are both done sharing a plate, we actually put it to the side to help them out for that reason - so they don't have to reach in between a couple of lovebirds.  Duh!       Don't forget that you can get a 10% coupon when you visit their website!  (Yep, there's pics of our food eats in the business profile!)
This is the best sushi restaurant in the Las Vegas area, and I make it a point to eat here at least twice whenever I am in Las Vegas!
Oscar is a great chef ! One of the best sushi places in Las Vegas ! Fast service and the sushi is amazing

This is a nice Japanese restaurant that looks like it caters to Henderson locals.  I'd probably give it 3.5 stars, but rounding up doesn't seem too inaccurate.  The ambience is good, but not great.  It's not really great for a romantic night - it's more like a good place for an after work get together.  They have the fake tatami tables, where it looks like you're sitting on the floor with a low table, but the ground is actually hollowed out and you're sitting normally with no shoes.  The food was good, but the portions seemed a bit on the small side.  The fish was fresh and service was excellent.  One thing that I really liked is that you can get any roll or sushi dish with brown rice.  It's not the greatest thing you'll ever eat, but I sometimes go on strange diets and it's nice to have this as an option.

Had lunch with a friend today and asked to sit at the grill!  Today's review is inspired by my fellow Yelper Nelson Q:  L)ow lighting in the back area for an intimate setting one on one O)nly $10.95 for the Teppan chicken lunch special!  Steal :-) V)entilation above all grills = no burning eyes or smokey clothes E)veryone sits around the grill.  Makes for random conversation and new friends!!  T)he fried rice was good, just a little burnt pieces of rice and egg E)ach course uses a lot of oil, butter and sauces, be advised! P)resentation of the meal was excellent!  So entertaining P)roper service from the staff.  Everyone was so accommodating A)nnoying little girl at my table; little rude to the chef; super disappointing N)o need for the sauces given to you in the beginning.  The food is super flavorful Y)akitori style chicken was excellent!  Garlic flavored, sweet and savory at the same time A)ssortment of vegetables to go along with your meal; sauced up nicely! K)ind of my first time doing this...ok it IS my first Teppanyaki experience. I)n the end, sooooo worth the money!  Well I tried do the acronyms justice.  One things for sure, definitely need to try this experience.  Super cool!

A hidden jewel in LV! We waited for a table to clear for About 30 minutes. And everything was WORTH it! I'm picky with Japanese food because I'm from Gardena, CA, where the old school Japanese live and where the best Japanese food is served in Los Angeles.  Osaka Bistro is one of the best I've been. Oh, I don't know the owner but he was so Nice! Guys try this place next time you go to Vegas!
Tatami mat area cool. All sashimi fresh. Good service.  Iconic restaurant if you read history.  Benihana type cooking area may have been better choice for comfort.

I brought my boyfriend and our good friends for dinner on Tuesday. We had a great time. Our friends were delighted by the ambiance of the dining area. The sushi was wonderful. We had three bottles of the Zipang Sake and it was priced just right. Cheesecake with strawberries along with two different flavors of Mochi. The mango was really good, but not a big fan of the green tea Mochi. Always be back to this restaurant!

Disappointing service tonight. We purchased a Groupon to go to dinner there this evening. When we presented the Groupon, the server stated they do take any Groupons. Which was confusing since we purchased the Groupon for that specific location. The manager came over and stated it was a mistake and they would not honor it. The manager seemed like it was our fault and were insulted that we presented the Groupon. He then told us if he accepts it, it will come out of his paycheck, then he left. Food was enjoyable but the poor management.
This place is not very clean :-( need I say more??? Take the extra time to pay more attention to detail. Just filthy

When first pulling up to the parking lot, don't be scared off like we almost were.  The area is filled with adult themed stores (stripper shoes and attire, adult toys...).  The doors are solid, no windows or anything.  The area looked kind of sketchy.  We decided to go in anyway since the general reviews were good.  I had the chirashi and my wife had the tempura udon (ramen?).  Both were excellent for the price.  Total without drinks or sides was just over $20!  We will definitely come back next time we are in town.
Always a sure bet. Had octopus there for the first time this past winter and was impressed.

Lol just walked in there. Kind of laughable how 3 servers and a bartender were have a wonderful conversation at the bar NOT acknowledging customers who walk in. Disappointing. I mean you can stare at us, but like are we going to be seated by you or serve ourselves? Walked out. Never got a chance to eat at the restaurant. Will not be returning.

Exterior was super random and it's in a strip mall but I was pretty surprised to find a cool little spot that's been there since 1967! Attentive service and a huge menu. The large seating area for groups is super super cool.

All I can say about the sushi here is it's amazing. I told my wife to take me somewhere we have never been for sushi together and she chose Osaka because she remembered loving it 6 years ago. Now here for some information on Osaka.  Exterior: I would consider this a hidden gem that is in plain view. I have passed it easily 20-30 times without ever noticing it. It looks like your average chinese restaurant with small signs and red neon lighting all around the place. Don't let this deceive you.  Interior: As soon as you enter the building you feel like your'e in a different world. I'm not saying it's high class but compared to the exterior it looks good. They have three different areas to sit depending on the experience you would like which I enjoyed. You can have your usual sushi experience next to the sushi bar with a couple small tables for couples, a sushi chef prepare your food directly infront of you while he is doing all kind of tricks and making balls of fire, who doesn't like fire? And lastly they take a more traditional approach which I did and liked, you go to a seperate room with enclosed booth style seating where you remove your shoes and sit on small cushions. Cool experience.  Staff: The staff were great. Everyone acted professionally, gave advice on what rolls were ordered most and preferred by other guests, and the service was on point.  Now for the most important part, sushi: The sushi was absolutely amazing!!! We ordered the "Titanic boat" which came with a large variety of sushi on a huge boat. It came with 12 pieces of Nigiri (6 salmon, 3 albacore, and 3 tuna) and they melted in your mouth. The fish was so delicate and well prepared I will definitely be back for more. It also came with 5 other half rolls. I apologize as I can't remember the names of them but can assure you each and every bite was delicious. I have been to numerous sushi restaurants in town, many in California, and have a friend who owns one in south Vegas, and this destroys them all. Sorry for being a traitor if you read this buddy.  I will upload pictures later for all of you to drool at your computers. Enjoy.

Most importantly, most amazingly fresh sushi I've ever experienced!!  I think about it at least once a week and it's been three weeks since we dined here for our first time!!  Unfortunately I can't remember the exact name, but it was the closest item they had to spicy tuna on crispy rice.  I think it was called O.M.G.  Or maybe that's just how I felt about it!?!  Secondly, we had the Zack attack.  No it's not a sushi roll, that was the name of our awesome hibachi chef.  He was super sweet, super outgoing and very fun.  He prepared my sea bass wonderfully and the fried rice was the best fried rice I've ever had.  It was fun to introduce my husband to the sea bass as well.  How has he not enjoyed sea bass before?!    All in all a wonderful experience!  I'll just keep daydreaming about it until we can make it back!

Saw this on Triple D's, first sushi place in Vegas, so yeah gotta try this place out. The lighting is dim and it is casual. We sat in a kinda private booth area, no shoes, so you sit crisscross or yes for those that cannot sit that way you can sit as you normally would in a chair there's room for your legs under the table still.   We came in right when they open since we were heading driving back home after.  Sushi was very fresh and good. We came in time for the lunch special and order every roll on the lunch special which can included a few signature ones. Hey why not, we definitely wanted to try it all. For sure it was worth it and we did finish it!   If your craving sushi come give this place a try and get the experience of the semi- traditional seating area.

Having spent time in Japan this is about as authentic as it gets..! The best rolls and selection in town..!  I have been going there for 9 years and never had a bad meal.! If they would just show the Sumo tournaments at late night I would be there then too..! I always wonder if the bad reviews are by people that have never really had authentic Japanese food..!!

I was craving sushi, my fiance was craving teppanayki so Osaka seemed like the perfect place to have both.   I liked how they seemed to purposely make sure each teppanyaki party got it's own table and chef. This could have been because they were mostly empty, but I did appreciate having our own table.   Sushi was just OK. It was tightly rolled and they had a nice selection, but the negi hama I had was just OK. Not rotten, not super fresh.. just eh. I did love, however, that they offered half rolls. It was great to be able to get some variety. For ~$15 I was able to try 3 1/2 rolls.. this worked out really well. The rolls with all cooked stuff (shrimp tempura, etc) were great.. but that's hard to screw up.   Teppanyaki was pretty good. Filet mignon was off the hook - seriously the best steak I've had at a  teppanyaki place..very tender and cooked really well. The chicken, sadly, was random end pieces and not too great. Lots of chewy grisley pieces.. eww. The fried rice and veggies were just average.   Overally not a *bad* place , but nothing special. As teppanyaki and sushi are pretty expensive, I'd probably only come back here for the lunch specials. I'm not sure the quality justifies the dinner prices.
Nice atmosphere. Not too crowded for a Friday night. Opted for the traditional seating. Had a couple of roles and tried a couple sake samplers. Overall a good time and would come again.

This restaurant is a long-standing, family-run restaurant for sushi, teppanyaki and other traditional Japanese foods.   I got the pork katsu curry and it wasn't bad. The katsu was crispy and the curry sauce was kinda tasty. The complimentary miso soup was bland, but it had noodle and a slice of kamaboko.   Tatami rooms and teppan room are available.   We had a birthday at our party and the restaurant gave her a complimentary birthday ice cream. She got two scoops of ice cream (green tea and mango) with whip cream and candle on top.  3 stars!!  Osaka Japanese Bistro is almost yummylicious!!
i like this location the best!!!! waiters are nice and very friendly and we love the tatami room and i don't know why their food is better. I just love the atmosphere and everything about it.

The service here is exceptional! The food is really fresh and the presentation is exceptional. Need towels in the bathroom. Had the sashimi sald and the green tea. Green tea was amazing and bottomless! Would come again. My 13 year loved the ambiance.
Bad service.. nothing special with food.. too upset to mention what kind of service they gave us...  just a waste of time to go here..

Simply beautiful restaurant. I was only getting takeout, so I didn't get to experience it. The tempura and Karl I sticks were perfect .--except for the price. For 6.50, there were only two small 4" sticks with 4 tiny bits of meat on each. I do realize that this is a nice restaurant, but it was so miserly that it lost a star. I would love to come back, but perhaps not when I get a craving and just need a quick snack.
Fantastic service, excellent variety of sushi  and sake!!! Restaurant is quite, quaint, and fast service :)
Our waiter made some suggestions and we went ahead and ordered them. not disappointed!  Enjoyed everything and the sushi was fresh as always!

After a long day of moving in the scorching 110+ degree weather, I decided to reward myself with some Japanese food. A quick Yelp search and Osaka was our choice. We arrived at 5:30 and were immediately seated. What's cool is that they have the traditional Japanese floor seating with an American twist. In an authentic Japanese floor seating, the patrons sit directly on the floor with specific seating styles and arrangements. The one at Osaka had an opening under the table so people could put their legs in it as if sitting at a regular table... Just lowered.... If that made any sense... Haha.  The menu was extensive. Did I mention they also have Teppanyaki? We opted for the regular Japanese food. This is what we ordered:  Treasure Island Roll: $14.95 Salmon, Capers, Sliced Onion Topped with Hamachi, Thin Sliced Lemon Served with Tataki Sauce, Masago, Scallions -- I think this looked better on the menu than in person. Dont get me wrong, it was good, but not for $15.  Hamachi Maki: $8.95 chopped yellow tail, scallions -- For a simple dish, I rather enjoyed it. It wasn't "knock my socks off" kinda dish but I'm a huge Hamachi fan. Would I order again? Possibly if it was a wee bit cheaper.   Fire Roll: $5.95 extremely spicy miki special roll -- It was just meh. Just a filler dish for a cheap price.  Zaru Soba: $6.95 cold buckwheat noodle w/soba sauce (Substituted with Cold Udon Noodles) -- Very refreshing dish. Its 110+ outside and this cold dish was perfect. It was simple yet delicious.  Seafood Okonomiyaki -- I forget what was in this, but it was a wee bit on the sweeter side. I do remember there was lots of shrimp and scallops in it.  Overall, I would give this place a 3.5. My iced green tea was always full. Service was outstanding. I would definitely eat here again... but it is on the pricey side.

I'd give 1/2 star, but Yelp doesn't allow that. Just finished eating here for lunch...did you know they import bugs from a farm?! We didn't either until there was a bug affixed to my chop stick. Asked for the manager, that was a struggle too...finally got to talk to the owner Gene who informed us the bug must have come from the farm. No sorry, just information of where the bug used to reside. So if you are up for a little excitement in your dining experience, try the salad and ask for extra imported bugs.
Since I don't think I'll make it to JP anytime soon, I like to believe this is just about the same!!! Nice atmosphere, yummy food, & a decent wait staff!!!

Love Osaka.  Food is always good. Sushi is fresh.  But our draw is always the teppanyaki grill. Oh the fried rice.  I could eat that for days.    The chefs are fun and they always do a little show.  Some are better then others.  But the food is always so good!!

I haven't had any of the food here yet, but the mojitos are amazing!  I came here to see a friend play in a jazz trio, which I really enjoyed, as well.  Will have to try the food sometime when I'm here next...

Service was seriously on point. Amazingly friendly staff. As soon as I removed my chopsticks from the wrapper, someone removed the trash from the table. Everything came out perfectly and fast. Fish was fresh as can be, flavors were more unique then I've encountered. Every dish was a pleasant surprise. Wish I had photos, but we ate everything too fast! Can't wait to come back...like in an hour ;)

Food was good, wait staff was nice, chef's cook with good quality and nice speed. Only thing I hate about this place is how small it is. It's always over crowded and people always squeezing by next to you behind you bumping into each other. If they moved to a bigger locale I'd be there all the time. I'd recommend but won't return to the sardine can.

Went on a Saturday night. We were seated right away. The place wasn't overly busy. As you walk in there's a photo of Guy Fieri from Diners Drive Ins and Dives. This is definitely a Dive. And not in the good sense of the word.   We asked for water and waitress brought us two small glasses of water. Waited over 15 minutes to order. I ordered the chicken teppan dinner. Waitress said it would take 45 minutes. What the hell? Are they butchering the meat on premises? She suggested chicken teriyaki and tempura. Tempura was flavorless, like eating deep fried styrofoam with a forgettable dipping sauce. Soup was so salty we couldn't eat it. Cucumber salad was decent, but very small. My husband's dinner was served 10 minutes before mine.  My chicken was cold, overcooked with very little sauce. Waitress never checked in on us but was super attentive to the table next to us. I flagged her down for water refills, which never came. A server passed us several times with water pitchers and refilled glasses at the adjoining tables but not ours. I had to go to the bar to get refills. Husband, who has a stomach of steel came home with a sour stomach. Maybe it's a good place for sushi but not for cooked food. This is a must miss in my opinion.

The BEST spot for teppan in Las Vegas. My husband and I love this place! It's the chef that really makes the experience with teppan and chef phong at this location is fantastic! Such a friendly guy and his food is exceptional. Tonight my husband ordered the lobster and it was some of the best we have ever had. The rolls are quite good as well and they also have the traditional Japanese area with the low tables and floor mats which is very cool. Definitely worth giving it a try, you won't regret it!

I went to an early dinner here with 2 coworkers. We walked in around 4:45 pm. The place was pretty dead and we even for a second thought that they were closed. Guess we were just early! We all ordered the shrimp & chicken off the teppan grill menu. The only seasoning I saw them put on the chicken, shrimp, rice & veggies was just salt, pepper and butter. I felt it needed more flavor. Something to set it apart from regular old chicken & shrimp. I feel like Geisha House gives their teppan meals more flavor than salt & pepper. Overall, portion sizes were good like they always should be. You leave full and satisfied. Our chef was awesome and nice. Our waiter was super nice and even chatted with us for a little. He wasn't awkward or antisocial. We had a good dinner.
Take your shoes off and stay a while... Traditional Japanese dining ,private booth, Teppanyaki room, sushi bar etc....  Great Late Night option!

My husband and I came here on first trip to Vegas; and we weren't really expecting much because it's a little in coast and were from the coast. But we were wrong. Their sushi is exceptionally good. We got the tons special and it can definitely feed more then 2! We also got a few other things too. The service was really good; our server David was very attentive. They have some food options for desert. I would for sure recommend banana foster cake!

We usually come to osaka during lunch for happy hour since its about $4-7 per order of sushi.  What we usually order are:   Tiger Roll: it has a little kick of spice-ness to it & I am not a fan of it because i dont really enjoy spicy food.  Yum Yum: Plain Japanese Lasagna: one of my personal favorites, it has a a melted cream cheese on top of it & i love it.  Shrimp Fried Rice: I had better fried rice.   The service is consistent each time I have been there and the servers always seem nice.

I have been here twice, and Osaka does not stand out when I try to think about a sensational Japanese restaurant in Vegas. There are three requirements which I look for in a restaurant; service, deals, and food quality.   I would not suggest Osaka as a place to go catch up with friends, because you will end up leaving frustrated. The service was lacking. We came around lunch, and it was quiet, yet we were missing many basic essentials such as plates when our appetizers had come out and drinks were not refilled regularly.   The food was decent, but nothing particularly special. I ordered the lunch bento box with broiled unagi and grilled salmon. My salmon was on the dry side and I had to douse it in lemon juice and toss it in the excess miso dressing from my salad. The unagi was delicious, but it was the most anorexic eel I have ever eaten. It was mostly skin, but that was cooked beautifully with a nice crunch. It came with rice, a salad, two pieces of gyoza, and two pieces of California roll for 15 dollars. This was a decent price, but I was left underwhelmed.   I was looking at their lunch special which gave you a choice of one main for 8 bucks. Maybe that would be classified as a deal, if someone tries it, please write if it is worth giving Osaka another chance.

Food was okay. Grilled salmon was good. Yakitori portion was small and overcooked, meat was too tough and dry.  One thing we laughed so hard was that there was a menu saying "kintama udon" in Japanese writing. Do you know what that means? "BALLS UDON" yes, the balls!! Men's testicles!! LOL I've never heard such thing in my life! I wonder if they knew it when they created their menu. Lol We were laughing so hard that the waiter guy asked us if we are okay lol then we explained about the kintama udon thing and he said "oh yeah, every Japanese customer laughs" oh man I died that day.

I am use to going here for teppan (chicken, shrimp, steak) and sushi and have always had a good experience. Better than Benihana! Service and staff is friendly and helpful. This was my first time here for lunch. Prices are great. I also love that they offer half rolls on some of their sushi rolls. I got the Chicken Teriyaki w/ Shrimp Tempura, comes with rice and miso soup. It was very tasty. And it was a good amount of food for $8.50. I also got Unagi sushi, which was okay. I got to sample around at some of my friends food...Hamachi Kama which I've never had was yummy and the Uni roll (wasn't as bad as it looks:) We also got different desserts at the end, the Chocolate Tempura Ice Cream was heavy but yummy, tasted like a funnel cake with ice cream. The Chocolate Soufflé was delicious, the warm chocolate filling made the dish. My favorite was the Flan (yes at a Japanese restaurant), it was reminiscent of creme brulee. The mochi wasn't great, might have been in the freezer too long.

Maybe I just dont like teppan?  A friend and I came here to eat the lunch special teppan, $8.95-10.95 for chicken/beef/shrimp teppan with soup and salad. While the teppan chef was quite friendly and very entertaining and the service was very good, the food was just 'meh'. My shrimp dish was about four shrimp and a mix of sub-par vegetables with some brown rice and sauce. Thats it. Im not sure what I was expecting, but I think it was more than this. Im wondering if this restaurant just floats on the 'excitement' of the teppan experience?  Anyway, we also got a sushi roll (Katie Maki) just to try it out and it wasnt great either. It was huge with tons of rice that was falling apart. Not great. Overall the experience was decent only because I was there with a good friend, but I wouldnt return. Maybe at night when all the teppan are going it is worth it, but if the food is the same, it isnt worth it to me, even then.
Delicious baked mussels and fresh spicy Tuna.
The food is good but not great enough to justify their prices. You will leave here still hungry and with an outrageous bill. For 2 people our bill was more than my car payment is.

Osaka is a great little hole in the wall spot in Eastern for late night Happy Hour sushi!  I've been here multiple times with groups of friends.  I've tried multiple items such as spicy edamame, shrimp tempura, tiger roll, shrimp fried rice and mochi.   Tonight, I ordered the Combo A and shared with a friend. We ordered for the Appetizer - NZ mussels  Standard roll - Nevada  Signature roll - Oh kamisama   The appetizer NZ mussels were to die for! Most fanciest mussels I've eaten especially with the garnished masago! The sauce on it was so good we dipped it into our Nevada roll which was also amazing. It was almost like a California roll, but instead of crab it was shrimp which was a lighter taste. Then the grand finale with the Oh Kamisama was the cherry on top. All the sauces with the perfect amount of kick balanced out on the roll!   Overall, great service, attentive & quick!

Yes! Yes! Yes!!!!  I was fortunate enough to be introduced to Osaka's for my future brother in law's birthday. I like sushi, so I was anticipating your usual run of the mill sushi, not expecting anything super fantastic.  Boy was I wrong!  I can't say enough great things about Osaka. The food is excellent!
