It tastes fresh always, and the variety of rolls is outstanding! There is something for every palate! Even my fiancé who was not so keen on sushi, at least once a week asks me, "so when do you want to go back to Osaka's?"   The atmosphere is great! The minute you walk through the door you get greeted by everyone (or so it seems) you can sit in tables close to the bar, but I believe to get the full experience you need to sit in the Japanese room. Remember to take off your shoes!  All in all, if you want a sushi place with great friendly service, great atmosphere, and all with great prices, come to Osaka! I promise you won't be disappointed!
I love eating here.  If you are a salmon skin fan, like I am, try their Salmon Skin Salad.  The sashimi is great and the staff is very nice too.

Amazing selection of specialty rolls and appetizers. Unfortunately they don't have AYCE... BUT the rolls are so good, it's worth it. They have a ton of unique and tasty sauces and make everything they serve taste like a little piece of heaven. Favorites include: The Virgin Roll (a great starter sushi roll for those just venturing into sushi town), Japanese Lasagna, Lisa Lisa, U-My Roll (which is a mouth full, for sure).   They have a bunch of different seating options (Dining Room, Japanese style tables, and Teppan) and it's a really cute place. Overall, one of my favorites and it's not far from the strip (at least it doesn't seem that far, but nothing does when it tastes good!!).

This place gets points for ambiance, they have intimate rooms with tatami mats where you mimic the Japanese custom of eating while sitting on the ground. The service was speedy and attentive as well. After ten p.m. Until closing at 2:00 they offer discounted dishes, and this is the menu we ordered off of. The seafood salad was fresh, but it had crab in it and I prefer Tuna or salmon this is just a personal preference thing. The rolls were all very fresh. They're shrimp tempura was excellent. This place is great for a date.

Ummmm...my mouth is watering just thinking of the Kai's special roll. My family enjoys a dinner here almost weekly. The fish is always fresh and when we walk in the staff knows to bring us our large hot sake and beer order without having to even ask. I always bring visiting friends and local friends in and not one person hasn't enjoyed the yummy sushi. We do tend to stick to rolls but I've had shabu shabu once and it was darn good too. I tried almost all the well known sushi places along eastern ave and this is hands down my fav!

Looks like Osaka fixed some of there issues. Service was above average and the food was solid as always. Sushi still tends to not taste the freshest in town but is adequate. The teppan tables are the highlight of the restaurant and depending on the chef can be a pleasure to experience.

We've been coming here for many years-in the 15 years we lived in Las Vegas and 9 years since we've left but returned to visit family. This review is a compilation of all our visits. Osaka is one of our favorite places especially as far as ambiance in LV.   We tend to go to dinner early so there are fewer people and we have the back to ourselves. The sushi bar and bar area gets pretty noisy during happy hour as does the teppanyaki room. So, going early has lots of benefits. We enjoy sitting at the sushi bar on occasion but my favorite is the quiet tatami rooms in the back. The tatami rooms are low tables and seats where you remove your shoes before heading down into a cozy space.   We are such creatures of habit when we do sushi. We always get a hot saki, a Kirin beer, miso soup and shrimp & veggie tempura. Then we change it up-though hubs often has a Chiarashi bowl so he gets lots of different things. They have updated the menu since we started and have a good variety of selections. Osaka does a really good Chiarashi. In fact, I think everything we've had is good.   The past few times we've been there has been with friends for a special occasion and they prefer the teppanyaki tables. We wouldn't go to the teppanyaki table on our own but it's it's nice to do the tables for a special occasion. We usually reserve the whole table and have even had to add a couple seats to fit everyone. They entertain the group though it makes chatting a bit more difficult except to the ones closest to you. We have had steak or shrimp which they cook nicely-despite all the activities on the cook top. The meat come with rice and veggies.  We do recommend Osaka. It is a wonderful place with a variety of areas in one restaurant to have a nice quiet dinner, a fun happy hour or special occasions.
Great place for sushi! Amazing menu.  Call for a reservation if u want a private table tho.
Worst sushi ever. For the owner - Please step up and do better. It's shame to serve such a good traditional food in  very poorly way.
Always a great experience. Quick and friendly service and most of all incredible food. Little pricey, but you get what you pay for.  Fried oreos are pretty incredible.

I don't usually write reviews for restaurants unless I am super compelled to. Which I am. Osaka Japanese Bistro is absolutely amazing! I ordered a salmon nigiri sushi and Tonkotsu. The cuts were delicious and high quality. The Tonkotsu still haunts my mouth. I was in Osaka, Japan last year and the authenticity of this place is very, very spot on. I highly recommend checking this place out.

Location feels dated, and it's in a converted night club club or something, it has no windows, feels like a shady basement somewhere. A lot of the detailing is left over from the 1980s. Sushi bar is cramped and boring, only noise is from the tv showing some random show. Though their servers are friendly and helpful, the chefs are not. I dislike the feel of this place immensely.  Sushi and cooking is very average for above average prices. It's fresh enough, but flavors don't pop, nothing stood out, and a lot of their recipes are dated. And the half rolls on their happy hour menu really don't save you much.  They have Tatami rooms and a small teppanyaki grill area that feels like a fire hazard. Area of town is sketchy, parking lot feels unsafe after dark. Not going back.
best sushi place in Vegas! Very fresh fish, great selection too.... if you eat kosher this is a good idea sense there are more roll options.
A good place to get away from the Vegas strip. Sushi is decent and not as over priced as other places.

Amazing food, BUT we arrived for our 7:30 reservation and a cook had called out sick so we had to wait until 8:30 to eat. We were disappointed in the wait time but the food was tasty. I'm sure it was an off night so we will probably try it again.

I randomly stumbled upon this little gem on my way to the camera shop down the street. I came for lunch on a Thursday and there were 5 other patrons there, who seemed to be regulars. This is a non-tourist, low-key casual spot; my kind of place when I'm bumming it during the week.  The decor is a bit dated, but that's irrelevant because the food and service make up for it in every way.  Our waitress, Misu, was sweet and attentive and the sushi was ultra fresh.  I'll definitely be back soon.

I'll start by saying that I am SUPER picky about sushi.   This place has a really cool ambiance, with traditional-style seating in the back which we loved. They had some great specials and a very extensive menu.   I got the california crunch rolls, dragon rolls, and seaweed salad, which is my go-to at any sushi place. The rolls were huge and so fresh and tasty.   As a group we shared mochi and the tempura bananas for dessert - all the desserts are HUGE (don't let the pictures fool you) and delicious.   Highly recommend!

Very good quality and great prices! Best of all you can get delivery from them :) I'm always skeptical getting sushi delivery because it's not a food that sits well for long. Tried the delivery though and it was so fresh! Definitely recommend this place if you want quality but don't want to break the bank.

Now that Yelp is offering delivery from so many excellent restaurants, there really should be an option to mark the review "in-house, "take out," or "delivery."   I've eaten at Osaka once before, in-house, for a birthday treat. It was before Yelp, but I would have posted a very favorable review for it back then. My only criticism would have been that they didn't serve pickles with the rice.  This review is for their delivery service through Yelp.  I recently reviewed another sushi establishment based on a delivery order. I was disappointed then; this experience was so much better!  The sushi we ordered was prepared beautiful, generous but not overly big slivers of fresh, sweet fish on expertly prepared rice. And the presentation, for delivery food, was excellent. They even included that plastic "grass," which is annoying, but at least is says "we tried!" All the boxes were labeled with the menu item they included, a really nice touch! And the order was correct; a blessing. We asked for extra chopsticks and wasabi, and they sent us service for eight, with enough wasabi and ginger to keep our nasal passages clean for a month!  We ordered tempura as well, and that's where this establishment lost its fifth star. The tempura was a bit heavy and oily. The dense oily texture was due in part, I'm sure, to "delivery time lapse," because tempura is meant to be eaten hot out of the oil. Even a few minutes left sitting will cause it become oily. And reheating is problematic, as the shrimp will be over cooked and the veggies limp. So even though it's really no one's fault but mine (for ordering it), I still had to pull that last star.   This place is not cheap. You can balance the price with the quality though, and order judiciously. And certainly, a couple of rolls and a side would be a better value, but I prefer traditionally prepared nigiri, so we ordered no rolls.  We'll be returning to the restaurant later this month for my birthday; a Living Social deal so very budget friendly. And I can heartily recommend this restaurant for its delivery service! Well, except the tempura, but if you order fried food for delivery, it's your fault!

Osaka !!! Yes yes finally some fresh sushi this side of town. The menu is large so bring your appetite. Sushi bar , main dining , Teppan grill as well as a bar with live music. John the waiter was amazing and helped with wonderful suggestions. I look forward to another dining experience.

I give this place 3.5 stars. The only time I have really come here is late night during happy hour. Not sure if I would come in during non-happy hour. I usually order sushi rolls, and maybe their sake sampler or just water. I like their Tatami rooms but the place is older and activity in the surrounding area can feel sketchy. I double check my car and make sure I don't have any items of valuable visible from the outside to tempt some passerby from possibly breaking in. The restaurant itself is borderline dive status but the staff is nice and friendly. Although I did seem to almost get into a debate with one of the servers, one time, over the correct pronunciation of lychee. Whenever I would say, "lie-chee" he would respond back saying, "lee-chee". I'm sure he pronounces tomatoe as "toe-mah-toe," but I digress.  Never had an issue with the place being super busy. They have a Teppanyaki grill area but I have never tried it so I cannot give an opinion. The food is decent and their prices are more or so on par with many of the other sushi places here in town. Maybe a couple items priced higher than other places I have been to. I am a repeat customer and will stop by again if it's during happy hour and I happen to be in the area.

Went here with a groupon discount and had Zach as our tepanyaki chef. Very nice guy. Overall, not a bad experience -- but there were a few things about the place that made me question it's direction. Staff is dressed nicely but offered nothing more than just average service. The only person that was personable was of course, the chef. But the menu was made out of laminated paper in a ringed binder (though the binder was personalized, the quality was not much better than a regular binder you would use at an office). There were so many options of drinks, smoothies, sushi , and combinations of plates that it was a tad bit overwhelming. Later, we found out the desserts had its own menu. There were paintings of what looked like jazz singers on the wall of the tepanyaki section which kind of confused us as the rest of the theme was Japanese. The sushi we had was so-so quality.   I've been to a handful of hibachi places numerous times and this is not at all the worst I've seen.  I would kindly recommend a more consistent theme throughout, a little more focus on the ambiance, customer service, and quality of food.   But overall -- it was filling and the prices were great.

I was recommended to try the sushi here by a friend of mine and was pretty good. I ordered a white tiger roll, banzai roll, and a oh kamisama. They gave the option of either a full roll or half. I ordered half rolls. The price was right and the service was great. This place does not offer all you can eat. I also tried the OG special which was similar to crispy spicy tuna appetizer. The only negative thing is the parking. It's real small and if the place gets busy you may have to park in the parking lot next to business. There is a server there named Jared that helped us and he was great. Very attentive and nice. Anyone that goes there be sure to ask for him. You won't be disappointed. Everything I ordered was recommended by him and was delicious.

I would like to note that the front entrance now has an automatic door, which is much safer and easier to open.   We recently dined in the Hibachi section of the restaurant. It was my daughters first time experiencing this type of meal entertainment. Our chef was newer, as he explained, but quite skilled and entertaining. He kept my daughter attention as she was quite captivated by all the flames and hand tricks. The food was cook to our liking and tasted great, as always. The servers were attentive to our needs and stayed on top of refills. Thanks for the great service and food as always!
Best spicy adamame in town! The service and food are always consistent. I come here weekly and I don't get tired of it,happy hour is my favorite. Definetly one of my favorite sushi places.

Very unique place. A bit intimidating from the outside as there are no windows, just a door. The menu is vast. Ramen was not worth the calories but the fried rice and spicy tuna were excellent. I'd say stick with the sushi if you come here. Service was great.

Not really understanding the high reviews folks.  Food: Bento box with assorted sashimi and tempura, bento box with beef teriyaki and tempura and unagi don. The food was just so-so. I didn't like that they did not serve miso soup with the meal, but instead some soy sauce soup with a few strands of somen noodle in it. It tasted like soy sauce water - yuk. The unagi don was large but was served in a bowl instead of the traditional black laquer box.   Authenticity: Although the owner and waitress were Japanese (props there), the sushi chef was not (doh!).  Location: conveniently located near Kumon, but we will not be back.

I have had food from this restaurant/location over the years and have found that their quality has gone down with every year that passes. Today, I placed a fairly pricey (approx $80) order with them where it was delivered to my home via a delivery service.  The order consisted of multiple Philadelphia rolls, Cal-Vada Maki Roll, multiple San Diego Salmon, etc...  the salmon within the sushi was too thick, and 'gristly'. Additionally, when I received the order I found there was absolutely NO wasabe or ginger provided, none! I mean, what sushi establishment does that??  I hear that the other location is far better than the one in Henderson.  I will need to check it out.  In the meantime, I will be patronizing Sai Sushi as my new local go-to sushi restaurant.

This is really sad, as Osaka used to be relatively good.  Here, specifically are my issues from my visit last night:  1.  WAY too expensive for what you receive. 2.  Quality of fish is near rock bottom.  Toro at market price ($24) was not fatty, nor do I suspect, tuna. 3. Tako was just chewy rubber 4.  It took forever to get a carryout order.  45 minutes to be exact.  Sushi Wa is MUCH better.  I think I was spoiled by Yoshida's in San Marino, CA.  Definitely the best

I've heard so many great things about Osaka Japanese Bistro so of course the hubby and I had to try it when we were in Las Vegas last week.  Both him and I love sushi so we had high expectations going in here.  We chose to dine in one of their tatami rooms since we really wanted to experience the authentic Japanese style of dining.  The tatami rooms do provide somewhat a feeling of intimacy and privacy so it was a nice change.  We ordered their sashimi platter (ahi tuna, yellow tail tuna, salmon, albacore), kim chee, miso soup (perfect blend of sweet and salty), a kamikaze roll (eel roll with sweet sauce), spider roll (deep fried soft shell crab roll with sprouts), white tiger (tuna roll flame cooked on top with a white sauce), tuna-poki (our favorite of all dishes, the slices were super thin and fresh, tossed in a light sesame oil dressing with sweet thin slices of seaweed), and a Nigori sake sampler (apple, strawberry, and lychee flavor - our favorite).    We were pleasantly surprised that everything tasted so fresh and all the dishes came out fast.  Prices were not too bad considering we were in Las Vegas.  We spent a total of $130 total for all our dishes including drinks and tip so not bad for a really good sushi joint.  Would definitely love to come back here when we're in town again.

I'm rating 2 stars because the food arrived very quickly. I have been eating at this restaurant since my cousins family opened. Although the food arrived quickly it was cold and the portions were very small. It was average teriyaki at best.  Very tough slice of beef and very dry. Gyoza was over cooked.
Vast menu and really well executed Japanese fairs.  Casual yet elegantly presented decor.  You will enjoy coming back to try new dishes/styles

We unfortunately got a chef on his first night and we were his first table. He came to the table and seemed quite unsure of himself when he lit the grill the flames were very high and he let it stay lit until it burned away. He was only able to start to cook one thing at once, until he was finishing cooking my lobster. He then added raw chicken to the grill and used the same spatula and knife and than tossed my lobster with it. This was a cross contamination and it was disgusting to watch. We ordered fried rice and he left egg shells in it. He did no special tricks except trying to set the onion on fire, but he even messed that up. He kept dropping the towels and than picking them up to wipe of his spatula and knife. The worst part was when he put the steaks on the grill.  One was bright red and looked fresh the other one was brown. We pointed out the steak being brown he said it was only cut an hour ago. He offered to put teriyaki sauce on it to cover up the mistake. When he put it on my plate it had a bad smell. I refused to eat it. We explained to the waiter who was nice that we were not happy. They still made us pay for all the meals, but took of a small amount for the steak. This was a terrible experience and unfortunately my Mother's birthday and now her memory of her special day is tainted.
I always pass this place and very committed to my sushi bars. BUT this place blew me away and this place is amazing I am definitely coming back thank you Osaka !!!

My favorite sushi place in town. Love all their rolls, they fish are really fresh and the chefs there are very creative. Everything I even try there are very yummy. The services are alway friendly. And they open late at night. This is one of those hidden neighborhood jem.  ALSO, lots of bad reviews regarding Osake are for the other one by Lake Mead, most people mistake the two. I been to that one too and they are one of the worst. It's night and day. Please don't let that mislead you.

I came here on a Tuesday night with a group of friends.  They all had been there before (some of them often enough that they know the staff by name) and raved about the sushi.  I love the idea that they have different rooms depending on what you are ordering.    The sushi menu is quite extensive, especially the rolls section, which is pretty typical here in Las Vegas.  I felt like it was a little hard for me to focus and choose what I wanted but I did appreciate that the rolls all had pictures so I could scan through pretty quickly.  As much as I wanted to love the sushi, I just didn't.  I like to fancy myself a purist.  Seasoned rice, fresh fish, a little wasabi and soy sauce to heighten flavor.  The rice wasn't seasoned and it was soggy.  If the foundation isn't solid the whole thing falls apart and I think that is what happened here.    The sushi here was just your cut rate standard Americanized sushi.  I don't think you would get a bad meal here but if you're really into sushi, you won't get a good one here either.

Recent visit tells me this place is still consistently very good. We've had the sushi, donburi, udon and combo teriyaki dishes and all were high quality. The decor could use an update but the food is reliably excellent!
Best sushi in town! Always fresh and great customer service:) Asakusa roll is my fave!

I come out to this place at least twice a month, usually during happy hour from 10 pm to 2 am.  The location is suspect but this is the very first sushi place in LV so there you go.  The late night menu is awesome.  Ultimate osaka roll, japanese lasagna and kai's special are my favorites.  You can get stuffed with the happy hour appetizers too.  Try the chicken wings, the kalbi sticks and the fried rice.  Oh and the udon too.  I am not sure why some prior reviews say this place is expensive.  In my opinion, this place is very reasonable and I have not been disappointed.   P.S. Green tea tiramisu is really good.  A little expensive at $8 for a slice but splurge once in a while.

I absolutely LOVE Osaka. My primary reason for dining there is their Teppan Grill. The chefs create a fun, entertaining show while preparing your food in front of you, however you like it prepared. It's great for the kids (and they have a toy filled treasure chest for them to dig into!). Some of the dishes can get just a little bit pricey but you get a TON of items included with your dish. For example, I get the filet mignon ($28) but this includes salad, soup, your entree, appetizer shrimp, rice, veggies AND ice cream! The servers are friendly and they come back often to check on you and fill up your drinks (my pet peeve). Can't afford the dinner time prices? Stop in for lunch from 12-3pm and enjoy your favorites from $8.95!  Make sure you sign up for their email club before you go. You'll get a 10% off coupon and also get a VIP Osaka card while your there. You can earn money for future Osaka visits. Enjoy :)

Pros: fast, friendly and helpful service, delicious food, beautiful restaurant, and comfortable environment Cons: none Let me start off by saying this place is amazing! I work near this restaurant and am always looking for a fast, affordable meal. Their bento boxes on the lunch menu have to be my favorite thing to eat here despite many sushi and meat choices. Overall, I've experienced good and okay service here but mainly good. One waitress is very friendly here and she always remembers me and my order. Since I'm trying to devour a usually delicate meal in a very short time in order to get to work, I appreciate that she expedites my order. On the occasions I don't have to rush, I enjoy the tranquil environment and dim lighting. It's very relaxing and the noise level never becomes too loud during the day. The chefs are amazing at their designs and food presentation as well as conversing with customers. It's nice to come here with friends and family because there's something for everyone. Everything about the restaurant makes it a gem. In short, I will be coming back.
Great Las Vegas staple....sushi is great fresh and prepared wonderfully. What a great place to enjoy Japanese in Vegas

Quality, mouth melting, fresh sushi and sashimi. Most of the nigiri and roll sushi pricing was spot on (reasonable esp for Vegas) but the pricing on few of the items left me scratching my head wondering if they came sprinkled with gold flakes on top. Overall good place to go for sushi. Service was satisfactory; No complaints nor compliments (We did have a fairly large group though). Seating is either sushi bar, table, or tatami. They also have a few teppan grill tables.

Came with a big group of family and had a blast at the teppan grill.  Our chef was fun and charismatic and catered to the young-un in our group.  Food was yum.  $2 draft Kirin during NFL games!  Thank goodness for Thursday night football!

I was immediately surprised by the way we had to take off our shoes and sit at the table on pillows- it made the experience a lot more authentic. The portions were a bit smaller than I would like, probably because I was so used to the sushi buffets in the east coast. Great quality food, although the mochi ice creams were tiny. Would reccomend if you're in vegas and do not want to eat on the crowded strip.
Beautiful food and service! What a lovely way to start our holiday week with Family! We already are planning to come back!!
I love this place. 911 Rolls are so freaking amazing. The food is great and the service is even better. I love sitting at the sushi bar and watching them make everything.
My favorite sushi place in all of Vegas.  Fast turn over and fresh fish. Great late night specials and excellent service.  A must try!

When craving sushi late in the evening, generally my friends and I head over to Osaka as they have a great happy hour menu available a few hours before they close. Service is consistent prices fair and food is pretty good.   I admit though, 9 times out of 10, I am eating here around midnight or 1AM, had a few drinks and just looking to fulfill my sushi craving. So when it comes to eating there during non happy hour time, I can not remark on the quality of food, service or pricing. That my friends, I will leave up to my fellow yelpers. :)

I have been going to Osaka since 2005!  It's AMAZING!!!!  I mean, quality fish...friendly service.  The 777 is my FAVORITE!!!!!  When we lived overseas for a few years we'd come back once a year.  I'd make sure to head straight to Osaka for my 777 and much more!!  Whew...really amazing place...you have to try it!
Always come here for the night special. Salmon kama, black sausage, fried rice, spicy tuna, Kalbi sticks, Lisa Lisa role, kamikaze, lasagna roll n top off with tempura ice cream.

This place rules, I visit it every time I visit vegas. It is a hole in the wall, sketchy strip mall location and feels like it used to be a bar or something with the weird hallway entrance. They are open late and have an awesome late night happy hour. The staff is excellent and the food is great. They will make sushi off menu and will do a very thinly sliced japanese tuna that no other place has been able to get right for me. I have tried other menu items and everything has been great, good portion size and value to go along with the great service and quality.

I didn't like Osaka at all! Service was horrible, we had to ask the waitress twice to get our drinks and the shrimp and fish weren't fresh.  I also didn't like that they do not have AYCE.   Our rolls were okay, I would never go here again!!!
Decent japanese in vegas area. Usually,people go to japanese all you can eat but quality isnt good. Osaka had very good quality of fish.

Pocket of aces is delicious. Now with that said, that was the only dish we enjoyed. It's open until 2am which is great for late night sushi. And they have late night specials. Maybe it was the sushi chef we had, not sure. Last, the mochi ice cream wasn't good. How is that possible, right?! It was crumbley.  :-/ not going back anytime soon.

I came here when evening with my family and we did to her Baci Grill my son had such a nice time I had the lobster and the scallops everything was traditional everything was fine we sat with some good people it's a little bit hard to find unless you have your navigator on because you will drive right past it I've done it twice Don't forget that if you come at an odd time you might have to wait for seating so that they have a Knouff to start their presentation but they do the traditional volcano and anything that you would get any hibachi restaurant They do have a full bar It's been around for years so I don't know why anyone would give it a bad review
Desserts are excellent. Fried oreo was yummy. Sorry to inform everyone but happy hour equals half a roll! Just not what I am used to when I go for happy hour.

We went there on St. Patrick's day just to do something different. The place wasn't very crowded which was probably normal on this kind of holiday. The food was pretty good and drinks reasonably priced. They forgot about our California Rolls and when my boyfriend asked the waitress she said that they had brought them lol. Well, I guess we ate them, forgot about it and asked for more lol . Our waitress neglected us a little bit even though the place wasn't that busy yesterday. We need to try another location.
Anything less than 4 stars is blasphemy.  If this place were in San Diego they would give Ota-san a run for his money!!

Great lunch menu. Service, good.  Food, delicious.   The reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the restaurant itself.  Very dingy, needs updating, restrooms smelled bad, carpets looked gross.   Just close your eyes and open your mouth and you'll be alright!

We went in for a late lunch, kind of in a hurry. We picked 3 lunch special rolls, the 911, the white tiger, and Kai's special. We also ordered a full Tropical roll. The service was prompt and it was the best sushi we've had in a long time.
What a great place for a tapanyaki nights! The food is amazing. I couldn't stop complimenting through out the entire dinner course!

I love sitting in the Tatami Room. It's cozy and comfy. Watari Bune 55 "Ferry Boat" Sake - pricey but smooth. I love the Late Night Menu!! 10pm - 2am Everything is good! The Philadelphia Roll is my guilty pleasure. Cajun Crunch is divine chef special Nabeyaki Udon is a fave. Save room for dessert
